original: na jalaṃ dīyate teṣu aśubhaṃ sarvadā bhavet // / / //
analyzed: na jalam dīyate teṣu aśubham sarvadā bhavet
translated: Water is not offered to them, and inauspiciousness always occurs.

analyzed: pañcaka anantaram sarvam kāryam kartavyam anyathā  puttrāṇām gotriṇām tasya santāpaḥ pi upajāyate

analyzed: gṛhe hāniḥ bhavati eva ṛkṣeṣu eṣu mṛtasya ca
translated: There will certainly be loss in the house, and for one who dies in these asterisms,

analyzed: atha vā ṛkṣa madye ca dāhaḥ tu vidhi pūrvakaḥ

analyzed: sūtaka ante tadā puttraiḥ kāryam śāntika pauṣṭikam

original: pañcakeṣu mṛto yo 'sau na satiṃ labhate naraḥ /
analyzed: pañcakeṣu mṛtaḥ na satim labhate naraḥ
translated: One who dies in the five asterisms does not attain peace.

analyzed: tilān gān ca suvarṇam ca tam uddiśya ghṛtam dadet

analyzed: bhojana upānahau chattram hema mudrā ca vāsasī

analyzed: dakṣiṇā dīyate vipre pātakasya pramocanaḥ

analyzed: yam samākhyātaḥ vidhiḥ pañca haraḥ sthitaḥ
translated: This procedure of mine, the five-remover, has been declared to you.

analyzed: nāma caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter on the description of the funeral rites, the characteristics of Krichchhra, the arrival of the burnt, the rules for the death of a woman in her menses, the five funeral rites, and the expiation for death in the Uttara Khanda of the Garuda Purana, the great Purana, in the dialogue between Lord Krishna and Garuda, in the Preta Kalpa.

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Shri Garuda Mahapurana

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

analyzed: evam dagdhvā naram pretam snātvā kṛtvā tilodakam
translated: Thus having cremated the dead body, having bathed, and having offered water with sesame seeds,

analyzed: prāśayet nimba patrāṇi rudantaḥ nāma pūrvakam

analyzed: vidhātavyam ca ācamanam pāṣāṇa upari saṃsthite

analyzed: krīta labdha aśanāḥ sarve svapeyuḥ te pṛthak pṛthak

analyzed: a kṣāra lavaṇa annāḥ syuḥ nimajjeyuḥ ca te tri aham

analyzed: a māṃsa bhojanāḥ ca adhas śayīran brahmacāriṇaḥ

analyzed: parasparam na saṃspṛṣṭāḥ dāna adhyayana varjitāḥ

analyzed: malināḥ ca adhomukhāḥ ca dīnāḥ bhoga vivarjitāḥ

analyzed: aṅga saṃvāhanam keśa mārjanam varjayanti te

analyzed: te kuryuḥ eka aham atha vā tri aham

analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca

analyzed: daśa aham śāvam āśaucam sapiṇḍeṣu vidhīyate

analyzed: śāvasya śeṣāt śudhyanti tri ahāt udaka dāyinaḥ

analyzed: ā danta jananat sadyas ā caulāt naiśikī smṛtā

analyzed: tri rātram ā vrata ādeśāt daśa rātram atas param

analyzed: āśaucam te samākhyātam saṃkṣepāt prakṛtam bruve

analyzed: jalam tridivam ākāśe sthāpyam kṣīram ca mṛd maye

analyzed: atra snāhi piba atra iti mantreṇa anena kāśyapa

analyzed: tad ūrdhvam aṅga saṃsparśaḥ sapiṇḍānām vidhīyate

analyzed: yogyāḥ sarva kriyāṇām ca samāna salilāḥ tathā

analyzed: prāc udīcyām carum kṛtvā snātvā prayata mānasaḥ

analyzed: bhūmau asaṃskṛtānām ca saṃskṛtānām kuśeṣu ca  navabhiḥ divasaiḥ piṇḍān nava dadyāt samāhitaḥ

analyzed: daśamam piṇḍam utsṛjya rātri śeṣe śuciḥ bhavet

analyzed: śālinā saktubhiḥ vā api śākaiḥ vā api atha nirvapet

analyzed: prathame hani yat dravyam tat eva syāt daśāhikam

analyzed: yāvadāśaucam ekaikasya añjaleḥ dānam ucyate

analyzed: yat vā yasmin dine dānam tasmin tad dina saṃkhyayā

analyzed: daśa ahe ñjalayaḥ pakṣin pañcāśat antime

analyzed: dvi vṛddhyā vā bhavet pakṣin añjalīnām śatam punar

analyzed: yadā hi tri aham āśaucam tadā vā añjalayaḥ daśa

analyzed: trayaḥ ñjalayaḥ evam tu prathame hanivai tadā

analyzed: catvāraḥ tu dvitīye hni tṛtīye syuḥ trayaḥ tathā

analyzed: śata añjali yadā pakṣin ādye triṃśat tadā ahani

analyzed: catvāriṃśat dvitīye hni triṃśat ahni tṛtīyake

analyzed: piṇḍa prasekaḥ tūṣṇīm ca puṣpa dhūpa ādikam tathā
translated: The offering of piṇḍas, silence, and flowers, incense, etc.,

analyzed: daśame hani samprāpte snānam grāmāt vahis caret

analyzed: tatra tyājyāni vāsāṃsi keśa śmaśru nakhāni ca  vipraḥ śudhyati apaḥ spṛṣṭvā kṣattriyaḥ vāhanam tathā
translated: There, one should discard clothes, hair, beard, and nails.🔽A Brahmin becomes pure by touching water, a Kṣatriya by touching his vehicle,

analyzed: kāryan tu ṣoḍaśī ṣaḍbhiḥ piṇḍaiḥ daśabhiḥ ā eva ca

analyzed: prathamā malinā hi etaiḥ ādaśa aham mṛteḥ bhavet

analyzed: dināni daśa yān ṣiṇḍān kurvanti atra suta ādayaḥ

analyzed: pratyaham te vibhajyante catur bhāgaiḥ khaga uttama

analyzed: bhāga dvayena dehaḥ syāt tṛtīyena yama anugāḥ

analyzed: tṛpyanti hi caturthena svayam api upajīvati

analyzed: ahorātraiḥ tu navabhiḥ dehaḥ niṣpattim āpnuyāt
translated: The body is formed in nine days and nights.

analyzed: śiraḥ tva ādyena piṇḍena pretasya kriyate tathā
translated: The head of the preta is made with the first ball of rice,

analyzed: dvitīyena tu karṇa akṣi nāsikam tu samāsatas

analyzed: gala aṃsa bhuja vakṣaḥ ca tṛtīyena tathā kramāt
translated: and with the third, the neck, shoulders, arms, and chest in order,

analyzed: caturthena ca piṇḍena nābhi liṅga gudam tathā

analyzed: jānu jaṅgham tathā pādau pañcamena tu sarvadā
translated: and the knees, shanks, and feet are always formed with the fifth,

analyzed: sarva marmāṇi ṣaṣṭhena saptamena tu nāḍayaḥ

analyzed: danta lomāni aṣṭamena vīryantu navamena ca

analyzed: daśamena tu pūrṇa tvam tṛpta tā kṣudh viparyayaḥ

analyzed: madhyamām ṣoḍaśīm vacmi vainateya śṛṇuṣva me
translated: I will tell you about the middle one-sixteenth part. Listen to me, O son of Vinata.

analyzed: viṣṇava ādi viṣṇu paryantāni ekādaśa tathā khaga

analyzed: śrāddhāni pañca devānām iti eṣām madhyaṣīḍaśī
translated: The five Śrāddhas are for the gods. Among these, the middle one is the most important.

original: nimittaṃ durmatiṃ kṛtvā yadi nārāyaṇo baliḥ /
analyzed: nimittam durmatim kṛtvā yadi nārāyaṇaḥ baliḥ
translated: If, considering misfortune as the cause, Narayana is offered as a sacrifice,

analyzed: ekādaśa ahe kartavyaḥ tatra vai
translated: The release of a bull should also be performed there on the eleventh day.

analyzed: ekādaśa ahe pretasya na u vṛṣaḥ
translated: If the release of a bull is not performed for the deceased on the eleventh day,

analyzed: preta tvam su sthiram tasya dattaiḥ śrāddha śataiḥ api
translated: His state as a ghost will be firmly established, even if hundreds of Śrāddhas are offered.

analyzed: a kṛtvā yat vṛṣotsargam kṛtam vai piṇḍapātanam
translated: If the offering of balls of rice is performed without releasing a bull,

analyzed: niṣphalam sakalam vidyāt pramītāya na tat bhavet
translated: Know that it is all fruitless. It will not be for the deceased.

analyzed: vṛṣotsargāt ṛte na anyat kiñcid asti mahī tale
translated: Apart from the release of a bull, there is nothing else on this earth,

original: putraḥ patnyatha dauhitraḥ pitā vā duhitātha vā // / / //
analyzed: putraḥ patnī atha dauhitraḥ pitā vā duhitā atha vā
translated: Whether it is a son, a wife, a daughter's son, a father, or a daughter.

analyzed: mṛtāt anantaram tasya dhruvam kāryaḥ vṛṣotsavaḥ
translated: After death, the festival of releasing a bull should certainly be performed for him.

analyzed: catur vatsatarī yuktaḥ yasya utsṛjyeta vā vṛṣaḥ
translated: If a bull is released along with four cows,

original: alaṅkṛto vidhānena pretatvaṃ tasya no bhavet /
analyzed: alaṅkṛtaḥ vidhānena preta tvam tasya no bhavet
translated: Adorned according to the rules, he will not have the state of a ghost.

analyzed: ekādaśe hni samprāpte vṛṣa alābhaḥ bhavet yadi
translated: If the bull is not available when the eleventh day arrives,

original: darbhaiḥ piṣṭaistu sampādya taṃ vṛṣaṃ mocayedvudhaḥ /
analyzed: darbhaiḥ piṣṭaiḥ tu sampādya tam vṛṣam mocayet vudhaḥ
translated: The wise one should make it with pounded darbha grass and release that bull.

analyzed: vṛṣotsarjana velāyām
translated: At the time of releasing the bull, if there is no bull available,

analyzed: kathañcana
translated: one should somehow or other

analyzed: mṛttikābhiḥ tu darbhaiḥ vā vṛṣam kṛtvā vimocayet
translated: make a bull out of clay or darbha grass and release it.

analyzed: yat iṣṭam jīvataḥ tasya dadyāt ekādaśe hani
translated: If desired, on the eleventh day, one should give

analyzed: mṛtam uddiśya dātavyam śayyā dhenu ādikam tathā
translated: the bed, cow, etc. that are to be given for the deceased.

analyzed: viprān bahūn bhojayīta pretasya kṣudh viśāntaye
translated: One should feed many Brahmins for the satisfaction of the hunger of the departed one.

original: tṛtīyāṃ ṣoḍaśīṃ vacmi vainateya śṛṇuṣva tām /
analyzed: tṛtīyām ṣoḍaśīm vacmi vainateya śṛṇuṣva tām
translated: I will tell you about the third and sixteenth, Garuda, listen to them.

analyzed: dvādaśa pratimāsyāni ādyam ṣāṇmāsikam tathā
translated: The first is the monthly śrāddha, the second is the six-monthly śrāddha,

original: sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ caiva tṛtīyā ṣoḍaśī matā /🔽dvādaśāhe tripakṣe ca ṣaṇmāse māsike 'bdike // / / //
analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇam ca eva tṛtīyā ṣoḍaśī matā  dvādaśa ahe tri pakṣe ca ṣaṣ māse māsike bdike
translated: and the third is the śrāddha performed after the completion of one year of death.🔽The third and sixteenth are mentioned by different authorities

analyzed: tṛtīyām ṣoḍaśīm enām vadanti mata bhedataḥ
translated: as to be performed on the twelfth day, on the third fortnight, on the sixth month, on the monthly śrāddha, and on the annual śrāddha.

original: yasyaitā ni na dattāni pretaśrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa // / / //
analyzed: yasya etāni na dattāni pretaśrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa
translated: If these sixteen śrāddhas for the departed are not performed for him,

analyzed: piśāca tvam sthiram tasya dattaiḥ śrāddha śataiḥ api
translated: even by offering a hundred śrāddhas, his state as a ghost remains firm.

original: ekādaśe dvādaśe vā dine ādyaṃ prakīrtitam // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśe dvādaśe vā dine ādyam prakīrtitam
translated: The first is declared to be on the eleventh or twelfth day.

analyzed: māsa ādau pratimāsam ca śuddham mṛta tithau khaga
translated: O bird, on the first day of each month, on the death anniversary, it is pure.

analyzed: ekena ahnā tribhiḥ vā api hīneṣu vinatā suta
translated: O Son of Vinata (Garuda), in the inferior (cases), the Sraddhas are performed in one day or three days.

analyzed: māsa ṣaṣ māsa varṣeṣu tri pakṣeṣu bhavanti hi
translated: They are performed in months, six months, a year, or three fortnights.

analyzed: śrāddhāni atha asyāt sāpiṇḍyam pūrṇe varṣe tad ardhake
translated: The Sapindikarana (should be performed) after a year or half a year is complete.

analyzed: tri pakṣe bhyudaye vā api dvādaśa ahe vā nṛṇām
translated: Or on an auspicious day, or after twelve days for men.

analyzed: ānantyāt kula dharmāṇām puṃsām ca eva āyuṣaḥ kṣayāt
translated: Because of the endlessness of family customs and the exhaustion of the lifespan of men,

analyzed: asthira tvāt śarīrasya dvādaśa ahe praśasyate
translated: and because of the instability of the body, it is praised after twelve days.

analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇeṣu evam vidhim pakṣi indra me śṛṇu
translated: O lord of birds, listen to the procedure for the Sapindikarana from me.

analyzed: ekoddiṣṭa vidhānena kāryam tat api kāśyapa
translated: That should also be done according to the Ekoddista procedure, O Kashyapa.

original: tilagandhodakairyuktaṃ kuryātpātracatuṣṭayam // / / //🔽pātraṃ pretasya tatraikaṃ pitryaṃ pātratrayaṃ tathā /
analyzed: tila gandha udakaiḥ yuktam kuryāt pātra catuṣṭayam  pātram pretasya tatra ekam pitryam pātra trayam tathā
translated: One should make four vessels filled with sesame seeds, fragrances, and water.🔽There, one vessel is for the departed, and three vessels are for the ancestors.

analyzed: secayet pitṛpātreṣu pretapātram khaga triṣu
translated: O bird, one should sprinkle the departed's vessel into the three vessels for the ancestors.

original: caturo nirvapetpiṇḍānpūrvanteṣu samāpayet /🔽tataḥ prabhṛti vai pretaḥ pitṛsāmānyamaśnute // / / //
analyzed: caturaḥ nirvapet piṇḍān pūrva anteṣu samāpayet  tatas prabhṛti vai pretaḥ pitṛ sāmānyam aśnute
translated: One should offer four Pindas (rice balls) into them and complete it first.🔽From then on, the departed one receives offerings equal to the ancestors.

analyzed: tatas pitṛ tvam āpanne tasmin prete khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, when the departed one has attained the state of a Pitri (ancestor),

analyzed: śrāddha dharmaiḥ aśeṣaiḥ tu tad pūrvān arcayet pitṝn
translated: One should worship one's ancestors with all the rites of the Śrāddha.

analyzed: ekaciti ārohaṇe ca eka ahni maraṇe tathā
translated: In the case of ascending the funeral pyre together and dying on the same day,

original: sāpiṇḍyantu striyā nāsti mṛte bhartuḥ striyo bhavet // / / //
analyzed: sāpiṇḍyam tu striyāḥ na asti mṛte bhartuḥ striyaḥ bhavet
translated: there is no Sapinda relationship for a woman. It would be for a woman whose husband has died.

analyzed: pāka aikyam atha kāla aikyam kartṛ aikyam ca bhavet khaga
translated: O bird! There would be unity of cooking, unity of time, and unity of performer.

original: śrāddhādau saha dāhe ca patipatnyorna saṃśayaḥ // / / //🔽bharturmṛtatitheranyatithau citimathāruhet /🔽tāṃmṛtāhani tu samprāpte pṛthak piṇḍena yojayet // / / //
analyzed: śrāddha ādau saha dāhe ca pati patnyoḥ na saṃśayaḥ  bhartuḥ mṛta titheḥ anya tithau citim atha āruhet  tām mṛta ahani tu samprāpte pṛthak piṇḍena yojayet
translated: In the case of cremation together in a Śrāddha or other rites, there is no doubt for the husband and wife.🔽If the wife ascends the funeral pyre on a different date than the date of her husband's death,🔽but when the date of her death arrives, she should be united with the individual ball of rice.

analyzed: pratyabdam ca yugapad tu samāpayet
translated: And every year, they should be completed together.

analyzed: yasya saṃvatsarāt arvāk sapiṇḍīkaraṇam bhavet
translated: For one whose Sapindikarana occurs within one year,

analyzed: māsikam ca uda kumbham ca deyam tasya api vatsaram
translated: monthly Śrāddha and water pot should be given for one year.

analyzed: navaśrāddham sapiṇḍa tvam śrāddhāni api ca ṣoḍaśa
translated: The nine Śrāddhas, Sapindikarana, and the sixteen Śrāddhas,

analyzed: ekena eva tu kāryāṇi saṃvibhakta dhaneṣu api
translated: should all be performed by a single person, even if the property is divided.

analyzed: pitāmahībhiḥ sāpiṇḍyam tathā mātāmahaiḥ saha
translated: Sapindikarana with the grandmothers and also with the maternal grandfathers,

analyzed: uktam bhartrā api sāpiṇḍyam striyāḥ veṣa ya bhedataḥ
translated: and Sapindikarana with the husband has been mentioned, based on the difference in dress of the woman.

original: navaśrāddhasya te kālaṃ vakṣyāmi śṛṇu kāśyapa /
analyzed: navaśrāddhasya te kālam vakṣyāmi śṛṇu kāśyapa
translated: I shall tell you the time for the Navashraddha. Listen, O Kashyapa.

analyzed: maraṇa ahni mṛti sthāne śrāddham pakṣin prakalpayet
translated: On the day of death, at the place of death, one should perform the Shraddha, O bird.

original: dvitīyañca tato mārge viśrāmo yatra kāritaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyañca tatas mārge viśrāmaḥ yatra kāritaḥ
translated: The second one should be performed on the way, where rest was made.

analyzed: tatas sañcayana sthāne tṛtīyam śrāddham ucyate
translated: Then, the third Shraddha is said to be performed at the place of cremation.

analyzed: pañcame saptame tadvat aṣṭame navame tathā
translated: On the fifth, seventh, eighth, ninth,

original: daśamaikādaśe caiva nava śrāddhāni vai khaga // / / //
analyzed: daśama ekādaśe ca eva nava śrāddhāni vai khaga
translated: tenth, and eleventh days, there are nine Shraddhas, O bird.

original: śrāddhāni nava caitāni tṛtīyā ṣoḍaśī smṛtā /
analyzed: śrāddhāni nava ca etāni tṛtīyā ṣoḍaśī smṛtā
translated: These are the nine Shraddhas, the third is known as the ShodashI.

analyzed: ekoddiṣṭa vidhānena kāryāṇi manujaiḥ tathā
translated: They should be performed by men according to the Ekoddista procedure.

original: prathame 'hni tṛtīye vā pañcame saptame tathā /
analyzed: prathame hni tṛtīye vā pañcame saptame tathā
translated: On the first day, third day, fifth day, seventh day,

analyzed: navama ekādaśe ca eva navaśrāddham prakīrtitam
translated: ninth and eleventh day, the Navashraddha is proclaimed.

analyzed: ucyante ṣaḍ imāni iha nava syuḥ api yāga itas
translated: These six are said to be nine, because of the sacrifice.

original: uktāni te mayā tāni ṛṣīṇāṃ matabhedataḥ // / / //
analyzed: uktāni te mayā tāni ṛṣīṇām mata bhedataḥ
translated: They have been told by me, due to the difference of opinion among the sages.

analyzed: rūḍhi pakṣaḥ mama abhīṣṭaḥ yogaḥ kaiścid iha iṣyate
translated: The Ruti tradition is desired by me, the Yoga is desired by some here.

analyzed: ādye dvitīye dātavyaḥ tathā eva ekam pavitrakam
translated: In the first and second, one Pavitraka should be given in the same way.

analyzed: pretāya piṇḍaḥ dātavyaḥ bhuktavatsu dvijātiṣu
translated: The ball of rice should be offered to the departed soul after the twice-born ones have eaten.

analyzed: yajamāna dvijanmanā
translated: The sacrificer and the twice-born ones should say May it be pleasing to the departed soul.

analyzed: akṣayyam amukasya iti vaktavyam viratau tathā
translated: The words May it be imperishable to such and such a person should be uttered at the end of the rite.

original: ekoddiṣṭaṃ me nibodha cetthamāvatsaraṃ smṛtam // / / //🔽sapiṇḍīkaraṇādūrdhvaṃ yāni śrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa /
analyzed: ekoddiṣṭam me nibodha ca ittham āvatsaram smṛtam  sapiṇḍīkaraṇāt ūrdhvam yāni śrāddhāni ṣoḍaśa
translated: Listen to the Ekoddista (offering to one departed) which is remembered to be done every year.

analyzed: ekoddiṣṭa vidhānena caret vā pārvaṇāt ṛte
translated: After the Sapindikarana, the sixteen Sraddhas should be performed according to the Ekoddista rite, or without the Parvana (offering to the departed ancestors).

original: pratyabdaṃ yo yathā kuryāttathā kuryātsa tānyapi /
analyzed: pratyabdam yaḥ yathā kuryāt tathā kuryāt sa tāni api
translated: One should perform them in the same way as one does every year.

analyzed: ekādaśe dvādaśe hni pretaḥ bhuṅkte dina dvayam
translated: The departed soul eats for two days on the eleventh and twelfth days.

analyzed: yoṣitaḥ puruṣasya api piṇḍam preta iti nirvapet
translated: One should offer the ball of rice to the departed soul of a woman or a man.

original: sāpiṇḍye tu kṛte tasya pretaśabdo nivartate // / / //
analyzed: sāpiṇḍye tu kṛte tasya preta śabdaḥ nivartate
translated: But when the Sapindikarana is done, the word preta (departed) ceases to be used.

analyzed: dīpa dānam prakartavyam āvarṣantu gṛhāt bahis
translated: The offering of lamps should be made outside the house for a year.

original: annaṃ dīpo jalaṃ vastramanyadvādīyate ca yat // / / //🔽tṛptidaṃ pretaśabdena sapiṇḍīkaraṇāvadhi /
analyzed: annam dīpaḥ jalam vastram anyat vā ādīyate ca yat  tṛpti dam preta śabdena sapiṇḍīkaraṇa avadhi
translated: Whatever food, lamp, water, cloth or other things are offered,🔽are satisfying to the departed soul until the Sapindikarana.

analyzed: abdakṛtyam mayā ukta ante samāsāt vinatā suta
translated: O son of Vinata, I have told you the annual rites in brief.

analyzed: vaivasvata gṛhe yānam yathā tat tu
translated: Listen to me as I describe the journey in the abode of Yama.

analyzed: trayodaśe hni saḥ  tvac gṛhīta ahi vat tārkṣya gṛhītaḥ yama kiṅkaraiḥ
translated: On the thirteenth day, after the Sraddha ceremony, he🔽is seized by Yama's servants, like Garuda seizing a snake by the skin.

original: tasminmārge vrajatyeko gṛhīta iva markaṭaḥ // / / //🔽vāyvagrasārivadrūpaṃ dehamanyatprapadyate /
analyzed: tasmin mārge vrajati ekaḥ gṛhītaḥ iva markaṭaḥ  vāyu agra sāri vat rūpam deham anyat prapadyate
translated: He goes along that path, as if seized by a monkey.🔽He assumes another body, like the wind going to the top,

analyzed: tat piṇḍa jam pātana artham anyat tu pitṛ sambhavam
translated: that body born of the elements is for the purpose of falling, but another is born from the father.

analyzed: tad pramāṇa vayaḥ vasthā saṃsthānām pragbhavaḥ yathā
translated: The size, age, condition, and shape are as before.

analyzed: ṣaḍaśīti sahasrāṇi yojanānām pramāṇataḥ
translated: The distance is sixty-eight thousand yojanas.

analyzed: adhva antarālikaḥ jñeyaḥ yama mānuṣa lokayoḥ
translated: The intermediate path between Yama and the human world should be known.

analyzed: sādhika ardha krośa yutam yojanānām śata dvayam
translated: Two hundred yojanas, with half a krosa added,

original: catvāriṃ śattathā sapta pratyahaṃ yāti tatra saḥ /
analyzed: catvārim śat tathā sapta pratyaham yāti tatra saḥ
translated: he goes there every day for forty-seven days.

analyzed: aṣṭācatvāriṃśatā ca traiṃśatā divasaiḥ iti
translated: And for forty-eight days, thirty days,

analyzed: vaivasvata puram yāti kṛṣyamāṇaḥ yama anugaiḥ
translated: he is dragged by Yama's followers to the city of Yama.

original: evaṃ krameṇa yātabye mārge pāparataistu yat // / / //
analyzed: evam krameṇa yātabye mārge pāpa rataiḥ tu yat
translated: Thus, in the path that must be traversed by those engaged in sin,

analyzed: jāyate sa prapañcam tat śṛṇu tvam aruṇānuja
translated: Listen, O younger brother of Aruna, to how it is born with its modifications.

analyzed: trayodaśa dine dattaḥ pāśaiḥ baddhvā ati dāruṇaiḥ
translated: On the thirteenth day, he is given to Yama's servants, bound with extremely terrible fetters.

analyzed: yamasya aṅkuśa hastaḥ vai bhṛkuṭī kuṭila ānanaḥ
translated: Yama's servants have goads in their hands, their faces are distorted with frowns,

analyzed: daṇḍa prahāra sambhrāntaḥ kṛṣyate dakṣiṇām diśam  kuśa kaṇṭaka valmīka śaṅku pāṣāṇa karkaśe
translated: and they drag him, frightened by the blows of their staffs, to the south.🔽On a path rough with kusha grass, thorns, anthills, stumps, and stones,

analyzed: tathā pradīpta jvalane kvacid śvabhra śata utkaṭe
translated: and in some places full of hundreds of chasms, with blazing fire,

analyzed: pradīpta āditya tapte ca dahyamānaḥ sa daṃśake
translated: and scorched by the blazing sun, burning with its rays,

analyzed: kṛṣyate yamadūtaiḥ ca śivā vat nāda bhīṣaṇaiḥ
translated: he is dragged by Yama's servants, terrifying with their howls like jackals.

analyzed: prayātiḥ dāruṇe mārge pāpa karmā yamālaye
translated: The sinner goes on the terrible path to Yama's abode.

analyzed: kalevare dahyamāne mahāntam kṣayam ṛcchati
translated: When the corpse is being burned, he suffers a great loss.

analyzed: bhakṣyamāṇe tathā eva aṅge bhidyamāne ca dāruṇam
translated: When the limbs are being eaten, cut, and torn apart,

analyzed: chidyamāne cirataram jantuḥ duḥkham avāpnute
translated: the creature experiences pain for a long time.

analyzed: svena pākena deha antara gataḥ pi san
translated: Even when he has gone to another body due to the ripening of his own karma,

original: purāṇi ṣoḍaśāmuṣmanmārge tāni ca me śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: purāṇi ṣoḍaśa amuṣmat mārge tāni ca me śṛṇu
translated: there are sixteen cities on the path to the next world. Listen to them from me.

original: yāmyaṃ sauripuraṃ nagedvabhavanaṃ gandharvaśailāgamau krauñcaṃ krūrapuraṃ vicitrabhavanaṃ bahvāpadaṃ duḥ khadam /
analyzed: yāmyam sauripuram nagedvabhavanam gandharva śaila āgamau krauñcam krūrapuram vicitrabhavanam bahvāpadam duḥ kha dam
translated: The sixteen cities are: Yama's city, the city of the Sun's wife, the mountain's second abode, the Gandharva mountain's arrival, the Krauncha mountain, the cruel city, the wonderfully constructed abode, the city of many calamities, the sorrowful,

original: nānākrandapuraṃ sutaptabhavanaṃ raudraṃ payovarṣaṇaṃ śītāḍhyaṃ bahubhītiṣoḍaśapurāṇyetānyadṛṣṭani te // / / //
analyzed: nānā ākranda puram su tapta bhavanam raudram payaḥ varṣaṇam śīta āḍhyam bahu bhīti ṣoḍaśa purāṇi etāni adṛṣṭani te
translated: The city of various cries, the very heated abode, the fierce rain of water, the very cold, and the city of many fears. You have not seen these.

original: tatra yāmya puraṃ gacchanputraputreti ca bruvan /
analyzed: tatra yāmya puram gacchan putra putra iti ca bruvan
translated: There, going to Yama's city, saying Son, son,

original: hāheti krandate nityaṃ svakṛtaṃ duṣkṛtaṃ smaran // / / //
analyzed: hāhā iti krandate nityam sva kṛtam duṣkṛtam smaran
translated: He always cries out Alas! remembering his own evil deeds.

analyzed: tārkṣya tat pura prāpnuyāt asau
translated: On the eighteenth day, Tarkshya, he would reach that city.

analyzed: puṣpabhadrā nadī yatra nyagrodhaḥ priya darśanaḥ
translated: Where is the Pushpabhadra river, and the priyashringa nyagrodha tree.

original: viśrāmecchāṃ karotyatra kārayanti na te bhaṭāḥ /🔽kṣitau dattaṃ sutaistasya snehādvā kṛpayā tathā // / / //
analyzed: viśrāma icchām karoti atra kārayanti na te bhaṭāḥ  kṣitau dattam sutaiḥ tasya snehāt vā kṛpayā tathā
translated: Here he desires to rest, but his soldiers do not allow it.🔽On the ground, his sons give him food out of affection or compassion.

analyzed: māsikam piṇḍam aśnāti tatas sauri puram vrajet
translated: Then he would go to the city of the Sun's wife, eating the monthly oblation.

analyzed: vrajan evam pralapate mudgara āhati pīḍitaḥ
translated: Going, he babbles thus, afflicted by blows from hammers.

original: jalāśayo naiva kṛto mayā tadā manuṣyatṛptyai paśupakṣitṛptaya /
analyzed: jalāśayaḥ nā eva kṛtaḥ mayā tadā manuṣya tṛptyai paśu pakṣi tṛptaye
translated: At that time, I did not create a water reservoir for the satisfaction of humans, animals, and birds.

original: gotṛptihetorna ca gocaraḥ kṛtaḥ śarīra he nistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: go tṛpti hetoḥ na ca gocaraḥ kṛtaḥ śarīra he nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: For the sake of satisfying the cows, you did not make them your pasture. O body, cross over what you have done.

original: tatra nāmnā tu rājāsau jaṅgamaḥ kāmarūpadhṛk /
analyzed: tatra nāmnā tu rājā asau jaṅgamaḥ kāma rūpa dhṛk
translated: There, the king was named Jangama, who could assume any form at will.

analyzed: bhayāt tad darśanāt jātāt bhuṅkte piṇḍam sa śaṅkitaḥ
translated: He ate the oblations with fear, born from the fear of seeing that.

original: tripakṣe jalasaṃyuktaṃ kṣitau dattaṃ tato vrajet /
analyzed: tri pakṣe jala saṃyuktam kṣitau dattam tatas vrajet
translated: After three fortnights, when water is offered on the ground, he would go from there.

analyzed: vrajan evam pralapate khaḍga āghāta prapīḍitaḥ
translated: While going, he laments like this, afflicted by the blows of the sword.

original: na nityadānaṃ na gavāhnikaṃ kṛtaṃ pustaṃ ca dattaṃ na hi vedaśāstrayoḥ /
analyzed: na nitya dānam na gavāhnikam kṛtam pustam ca dattam na hi veda śāstrayoḥ
translated: I did not give regular alms, nor did I offer daily food for cows, nor did I give books, nor did I study the Vedas and scriptures.

original: purāṇadṛṣṭo na hi sevito 'dhvā śarīra he nistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: purāṇa dṛṣṭaḥ na hi sevitaḥ śarīra he nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: I did not follow the path seen in the Puranas. O body, cross over what you have done.

analyzed: naga indra nagaram gatvā bhuktvā ca annam tathāvidham
translated: Having gone to the city of the lord of mountains and having eaten such food,

original: māsi dvitīye yaddattaṃ bāndhavaistu tato vrajet // / / //
analyzed: māsi dvitīye yat dattam bāndhavaiḥ tu tatas vrajet
translated: in the second month, what was offered by relatives, he would go from there.

analyzed: vrajan evam pralapate kṛpāṇa tsaru tāḍitaḥ
translated: While going, he laments like this, struck by the edge of the sword.

analyzed: parādhānam abhūt sarvam mama mūrkha śiromaṇeḥ
translated: Everything became a transgression for me, the crest-jewel of fools.

analyzed: mahatā puṇya yogena mānuṣyam labdhavān aham
translated: By the great union of merit, I obtained human birth.

analyzed: tṛtīye māsi samprāpte gandharvanagare śubham
translated: In the third month, he reaches the auspicious city of the Gandharvas.

analyzed: tṛtīya māsikam piṇḍam tatra bhuktvā brajati asau
translated: Having eaten the third-month pinda there, he departs.

analyzed: vrajan evam vilapate tad agreṇa āhataḥ pathi
translated: While going, he laments in front of it, struck on the path.

original: mayā na dattaṃ na hutaṃ hutāśane tapo na taptaṃ himaśailagahvare /
analyzed: mayā na dattam na hutam hutāśane tapaḥ na taptam himaśaila gahvare
translated: By me, nothing is given, nothing is offered into the fire, no penance is performed in the cave of the Himalayas,

original: na sevitaṃ gāṅgamaho mahājalaṃ śarīra he nistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: na sevitam gāṅgam aho mahā jalam śarīra he nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: and the great water of the Ganges is not served. O body, cross what has been done by you.

analyzed: turye śailāgamam māsi prāpnuyāt tatra varṣaṇam
translated: In the fourth month, he reaches the coming of the mountain, where he receives rain.

analyzed: tasya upari bhavet pakṣin pāṣāṇānām nirantaram
translated: Above it, O bird, there is a continuous stream of stones.

analyzed: caturthamāsikam śrāddham bhuktvā tatra prasarpati
translated: Having eaten the fourth-month śrāddha there, he proceeds.

analyzed: sa patan eva vilapan pāṣāṇa ādi atipīḍitaḥ
translated: Falling down, lamenting, greatly afflicted by stones and other things.

original: na jñānamārgo na ca yogamārgo na karmamārgo na ca bhaktimārgaḥ /
analyzed: na jñāna mārgaḥ na ca yoga mārgaḥ na karma mārgaḥ na ca bhakti mārgaḥ
translated: Not the path of knowledge, not the path of yoga, not the path of action, not the path of devotion,

original: na sādhusaṅgātkimapi śrutaṃ mayā śarīra he nistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: na sādhu saṅgāt kim api śrutam mayā śarīra he nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: I have not heard anything from association with the virtuous. O body, cross what has been done by you.

original: tataḥ krūrapura māsi pañcame yāti kāśyapa /
analyzed: tatas krūrapura māsi pañcame yāti kāśyapa
translated: Then, in the fifth month, which is the month of cruel cities, he goes, O Kāśyapa.

original: bhuvi dattaṃ piṇḍajalaṃ bhuktvā krūrapuraṃ vrajet // / / //
analyzed: bhuvi dattam piṇḍa jalam bhuktvā krūrapuram vrajet
translated: Having eaten the water and ball of rice offered on the ground, he goes to the city of the cruel ones.

analyzed: vrajan evam vilapate paṭṭiśaiḥ pātitaḥ pathi
translated: While going thus, he laments, being struck down on the path with a spear.

original: hā mātarhāpitarbhrātaḥ sutā hā hā mama striyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hā mātar hā pitar bhrātar sutāḥ hā hā mama striyaḥ
translated: Oh mother, oh father, oh brother, oh daughter, oh my wife!

analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ na upadiṣṭaḥ ham avasthām prāptaḥ īdṛśīm
translated: I was not instructed by you, and have attained such a state.

analyzed: evam lālapyamānam te yamadūtāḥ vadanti hi
translated: Thus, while he is lamenting, the messengers of Yama say to him:

original: kva mātā kva pitā mūḍha kva jāyā kva sutaḥ suhṛt /
analyzed: kva mātā kva pitā mūḍha kva jāyā kva sutaḥ suhṛd
translated: Where is the mother, where is the father, O fool? Where is the wife, where is the son, where are the friends?

analyzed: sva karma upārjite bhuṅkṣvam mūrkha yātāḥ ciram pathi
translated: O fool, enjoy what you have earned by your own actions. They have gone a long way.

original: jānāsi śambalamalaṃ balamadhvagānāṃ no 'śambalaḥ prayatate paralokagatyai /
analyzed: jānāsi śambalam alam balam adhvagānām na u śambalaḥ prayatate para loka gatyai
translated: You know the strength of the caravan, but the non-caravan is striving for the state of the next world.

original: gantavyamasti tava niścitameva tena mārgeṇa yena na bhavet krayavikrayo 'pi // / / //
analyzed: gantavyam asti tava niścitam eva tena mārgeṇa yena na bhavet
translated: You must certainly go by that path on which there is no buying and selling.

analyzed: ūna ṣāṇmāsike krauñce bhuktvā piṇḍantu sa udakam
translated: In the Krauñca (hell), if one eats the ball of rice with water for less than six months,

analyzed: ghaṭī mātram tu viśramya vicitra nagaram vrajet
translated: having rested for one ghatika, one goes to the city of Vicitra.

analyzed: vrajan evam vilapate śūla agreṇa vidāritaḥ
translated: While going thus, he laments, being torn apart with a spear-point.

original: kutra yāmi na hi gāmi jīvitaṃ hā mṛtasya maraṇaṃ punarna vai /
analyzed: kutra yāmi na hi gāmi jīvitam hā mṛtasya maraṇam punar na vai
translated: Where shall I go? Life does not go to any place. Alas! Death does not die again.

analyzed: ittham eva vilapan prayāti asau yātanā arha dhṛta vigrahaḥ pati
translated: Lamenting thus, he goes, his body held for the sake of the punishment, to the place of punishment.

analyzed: vicitra nagare tatra vicitraḥ nāma pārithivaḥ
translated: In that variegated city, there was a king named Vicitra.

original: tatra ṣaṇmāsapiṇḍena tṛptaḥ san vrajate puraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatra ṣaṣ māsa piṇḍena tṛptaḥ san vrajate puras
translated: There, satisfied with the lump of food for six months, he goes ahead.

analyzed: vrajan evam vilapate prāsa agreṇa prapīḍitaḥ
translated: Going thus, he laments, afflicted by the spear-point:

original: mātā bhrātā pitā putraḥ ko 'pi me vartate na vā /
analyzed: mātā bhrātā pitā putraḥ kaḥ pi me vartate na vā
translated: Mother, brother, father, son - no one belongs to me.

original: yo māmuddharate pāpaṃ patantaṃ duḥ khasāgare // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ mām uddharate pāpam patantam duḥkha sāgare
translated: Who will deliver me from sin, falling into the ocean of sorrow?

original: vrajatastatra mārge tu tatra vaitaraṇī śubhā /
analyzed: vrajataḥ tatra mārge tu tatra vaitaraṇī śubhā
translated: As he goes there on the path, there is the auspicious Vaitaraṇī river.

analyzed: śata yojana vistīrṇā pūya śoṇita saṃkulā
translated: It is a hundred yojanas wide, filled with pus and blood.

analyzed: āyāti tatra dṛśyante nāvikāḥ dhīvara ādayaḥ
translated: Boatmen, fishermen, and others are seen coming there.

original: te vadanti pradattā gauryadi vaitaraṇī tvayā /
analyzed: te vadanti pradattā gauḥ yadi vaitaraṇī tvayā
translated: They say, If you have given a cow, then cross this Vaitaraṇī river.

analyzed: nāvam enām samāroha sukena uttara vai nadīm
translated: Embark on this boat, O good man, and cross the river.

original: tatra yena pradattā gauḥ sa sukhenaiva tāṃ taret /
analyzed: tatra yena pradattā gauḥ sa sukhena eva tām taret
translated: There, he who has given a cow would cross it happily.

analyzed: a dāyī tatra ghṛṣyeta kara grāhantu nāvikaiḥ
translated: The one who has not given would be ground there by the boatmen with their hands.

analyzed: ukhaiḥ kākaiḥ baka ulūkaiḥ tīkṣṇa tuṇḍaiḥ vitudyate
translated: He is pecked at by crows, herons, owls and other sharp-beaked birds.

analyzed: manujānām hitam dānam ante vaitaraṇī khaga
translated: O bird! In the end, the gift of water to humans crosses the Vaitaraṇī river.

original: dattā pāpaṃ dahet sarvaṃ mama lokantu sā nayet /
analyzed: dattā pāpam dahet sarvam mama lokam tu sā nayet
translated: It burns all sins and takes one to my world.

original: maptame māsi samprāpte puraṃ bahvāpadaṃ mṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: maptame māsi samprāpte puram bahu āpadam mṛtaḥ
translated: In the ninth month, he dies in a city with many calamities.

original: vrajettu sodakaṃ bhuktvā piṇḍaṃ vai saptamāsikam /
analyzed: vrajet tu sa udakam bhuktvā piṇḍam vai sapta māsikam
translated: He goes to the place with water, having eaten the seven-month-old ball of rice.

analyzed: vrajan evam vilapate parigha āhati pīḍitaḥ
translated: While going, he laments, afflicted by the blows of the iron club.

original: na dattaṃ na hutaṃ taptaṃ na snātaṃ na kṛtaṃ hitam /
analyzed: na dattam na hutam taptam na snātam na kṛtam hitam
translated: He says, I have not given, not offered oblations, not bathed, not done what is beneficial.

original: yādṛśaṃ caritaṃ karma mūḍhātman bhuṅkṣva tādṛśam // / / //
analyzed: yādṛśam caritam karma mūḍha ātman bhuṅkṣva tādṛśam
translated: O foolish one! Enjoy the fruits of your own actions, whatever they may be.

original: māsyaṣṭame duḥ khade tu pare bhuktvātha sodakam /
analyzed: māsi aṣṭame duḥ kha de tu pare bhuktvā atha sa udakam
translated: In the eighth month, in the month of Duḥkha, he eats the food with water.

analyzed: piṇḍam prayāt sa yau tārkṣya nānā ākranda puram tatas
translated: Then he goes to the city of Nānākranda, O Garuḍa.

analyzed: prayāṇe ca pravadate musala āghāta pīḍitaḥ
translated: While going, he says, afflicted by the blows of the iron club.

analyzed: kva jāyā caṭulaiḥ cāṭu paṭubhiḥ vacanaiḥ mama
translated: Where are the charming and clever words of my wife?

analyzed: bhojanam bhallabhallībhiḥ musalaiḥ ca kva māraṇam
translated: Where is the food with the bhallas and bhallies, and where is the killing with the pestles?

original: navame māsi dattaṃ vai nānākrandapure tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: navame māsi dattam vai nānā ākranda pure tatas
translated: In the ninth month, the gift is made in the city of Nānākranda.

analyzed: karuṇam nānā ākrandān karoti api
translated: He eats the offered ball of rice and cries pitifully.

original: daśame māsi dattaṃ vai sutaptabhavanaṃ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśame māsi dattam vai sutapta bhavanam tatas
translated: In the tenth month, he is given a well-heated house.

original: sarannevaṃ vilapate halāhatihataḥ pathi /🔽kva sūnupeśalakaraiḥ pādasaṃvāhanaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: saran evam vilapate halāhati hataḥ pathi  kva sūnu peśala karaiḥ pāda saṃvāhanam mama
translated: Crying thus, he laments on the path, struck by the plow.🔽Where is the foot massage by my son's tender hands?

analyzed: kva dūta vajra pratimakaiḥ mad pada karṣaṇam
translated: Where is the dragging of my feet by messengers like thunderbolts?

original: daśame māsi piṇḍādi tatra bhuktvā prasarpati // / / //
analyzed: daśame māsi piṇḍa ādi tatra bhuktvā prasarpati
translated: In the tenth month, having eaten the ball of rice etc. there, he moves on.

original: māse caikādaśe pūrṇe puraṃ raudraṃ sa gacchati /
analyzed: māse ca ekādaśe pūrṇe puram raudram sa gacchati
translated: In the eleventh month, when full, he goes to the terrible city.

original: gacchanneva vilapate yathā pṛṣṭhe prapīḍitaḥ // / / //🔽kvāhaṃ satūlīśayane parivartan kṣaṇe kṣaṇe /
analyzed: gacchan eva vilapate yathā pṛṣṭhe prapīḍitaḥ  kva aham sa tūlī śayane parivartan kṣaṇe kṣaṇe
translated: Going thus, he laments as if struck on the back.🔽Where do I turn on the bed with cotton pillows every moment?

analyzed: bhaṭa hasta bhraṣṭa yaṣṭi kṛṣṭa pṛṣṭhaḥ kva vā punar
translated: Or where is my back being plowed by sticks dropped from the hands of soldiers?

original: kṣitau dattañca piṇḍādi bhuktvā tatra tato vrajet /
analyzed: kṣitau dattañca piṇḍa ādi bhuktvā tatra tatas vrajet
translated: Having eaten the ball of rice etc. given on the ground, he goes from there.

analyzed: payovarṣaṇam iti etad nāmakam puram aṇḍaja
translated: O egg-born one, this city is named Payovarsha.

analyzed: vrajan evam vilapate kuṭhāraiḥ mūrdhni tāḍitaḥ
translated: Going thus, he laments, struck on the head by axes.

analyzed: kva bhṛtya komala karaiḥ gandha taila avasecanam
translated: Where is the sprinkling of fragrant oil by my servant's tender hands?

analyzed: kva kīnāśa anugaiḥ krodhāt kuṭhāraiḥ śirasi vyathā
translated: Where is the pain on the head with axes out of anger by the followers of the god of wealth,

original: ūnābdikañca yacchrāddhaṃ tatra bhuṅkte suduḥ khitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūna ābdikam ca yat śrāddham tatra bhuṅkte su duḥ khitaḥ
translated: And where does he eat with great sorrow in the Śrāddha that is less than a year old?

original: saṃpūrṇe tu tato varṣe śītāḍhyaṃ nagaraṃ vrajet /
analyzed: saṃpūrṇe tu tatas varṣe śīta āḍhyam nagaram vrajet
translated: But when the year is complete, he goes to the city rich in cold.

analyzed: gacchan evam churikayā chinna jihvaḥ tu roditi
translated: While going, he weeps, his tongue cut off with a razor,

analyzed: priya ālāpaiḥ kva ca sa sa madhura tvasya varṇanam
translated: And where is the description of the sweetness of endearments?

analyzed: ukta mātre si patra ādi jihvā chedaḥ kva ca eva hi
translated: And where is the cutting off of the tongue with a sword-leaf etc. as soon as it is spoken?

analyzed: vārṣikam piṇḍa dāna ādi bhuktvā tatra prasarpati
translated: Having eaten the annual offerings of balls of rice etc. there, he proceeds.

analyzed: bahu bhīti karam tat tat piṇḍa jam devam āsthitaḥ
translated: Having resorted to that god born from the balls of rice, he causes much fear.

analyzed: prakāśayati pāppānam ātmānam ca vinindati
translated: He reveals his own sin and censures himself.

analyzed: yoṣit api evam etasmin mārge vai paridevati
translated: A woman also laments in this way on this path.

original: tato yāmyaṃ nātidūre nagaraṃ sa hi gacchati /
analyzed: tatas yāmyam na ati dūre nagaram sa hi gacchati
translated: Then he goes to a city not too far from Yama,

analyzed: catvāriṃśat yojanāni catuḥ yukta ani vistṛtam
translated: Which is forty yojanas in extent with four yokes.

original: trayodaśa pratīhārāḥ śravaṇā nāma tatra vai /
analyzed: trayodaśa pratīhārāḥ śravaṇāḥ nāma tatra vai
translated: There are thirteen doorkeepers named Śravaṇa.

analyzed: śravaṇa akarmataḥ tuṣyanti anyathā krodham āpnuyuḥ
translated: They are pleased with the work of hearing, otherwise they would get angry.

analyzed: tatas tatra āśu raktākṣam bhinnāñjana caya upamam
translated: Then he sees Yama, with red eyes, resembling a mass of split collyrium,

original: mṛtyukālāntakādīnāṃ madhye paśyati vai yamam // / / //🔽daṃṣṭrākarālavadanaṃ bhṛkuṭīdāruṇākṛtim /
analyzed: mṛtyu kāla antaka ādīnām madhye paśyati vai yamam  daṃṣṭrā karāla vadanam bhṛkuṭī dāruṇa ākṛtim
translated: in the midst of Mrityu, Kala, Antaka, and others.🔽With a face terrible with fangs, with a fierce countenance furrowed with frowns,

analyzed: virūpaiḥ bhoṣaṇaiḥ vaktraiḥ vṛtam vyādhi śataiḥ prabhum
translated: surrounded by hundreds of deformed ornaments and faces, by hundreds of diseases, by the lord.

analyzed: daṇḍa āsakta mahā bāhum pāśa hastam su bhairavam
translated: With mighty arms attached to a staff, with a noose in his hand, very terrible,

analyzed: tad nirdiṣṭām tatas jantuḥ gatim yāti śubha aśubhām
translated: then the creature goes to the good or bad destiny indicated by him.

original: pāpī pāpāṃ gatiṃ yāti yathā te kathitaṃ purā /
analyzed: pāpī pāpām gatim yāti yathā te kathitam purā
translated: The sinner goes to a sinful destiny, as told by you before.

analyzed: chatra upānaha dātāraḥ ye ca veśma pradāyakāḥ
translated: Those who give umbrellas and sandals, and those who give houses,

original: ye tu puṇyakṛtastatra te paśyanti yamaṃ tadā /
analyzed: ye tu puṇya kṛtaḥ tatra te paśyanti yamam tadā
translated: but those who have done meritorious deeds there, they then see Yama.

analyzed: saumya ākṛtim kuṇḍalinam maulimantam dhṛta śriyam
translated: With a gentle form, wearing earrings, with a crest, holding prosperity,

original: ekādaśe dvādaśe hi ṣaṇmāse ābdike tathā /
analyzed: ekādaśe dvādaśe hi ṣaṣ māse ābdike tathā
translated: in the eleventh, twelfth, and in the annual (rite),

original: viprān bahūn bhojayet tatra yanmahatī kṣudhā // / / //🔽jīvan putrakalatrādipradiṣṭamitaraiḥ khaga /
analyzed: viprān bahūn bhojayet tatra yat mahatī kṣudhā  jīvan putra kalatra ādi pradiṣṭam itaraiḥ khaga
translated: he should feed many Brahmins there, where there is great hunger.

analyzed: yaḥ na sādhayati sva artham evam paścāt hi khidyate
translated: O bird, he who, while living, does not accomplish his own purpose in this way, as indicated by his sons, wife, and others, later suffers.

analyzed: etat te sarvam ākhyātam saṃyaminyām yathāgati
translated: I have thus told you everything about the path of Saṃyamini.

original: proktamāvarṣakṛtyaṃ te kimanyacchrotumicchasi // / / //🔽iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe dvitīyāṃśe dharmakāṇḍe pretakalpe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde varṣakṛtyayamalokamārgayātanādinirūpaṇaṃ nāma
analyzed: proktam āvarṣa kṛtyam te kim anyat śrotum icchasi  iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe dvitīya aṃśe dharma kāṇḍe pretakalpe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde varṣakṛtyayamalokamārgayātanādinirūpaṇam nāma
translated: I have told you the duties for the rainy season. What else do you wish to hear?

analyzed: pañcamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter in the Pretakalpa of the Uttara Khanda in the great Garuda Purana, composed by the great sage, the son of Sage Parasara and Satyavati.

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Sri Garuda Mahapurana

analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

analyzed: api sādhana yuktasya tīrtha dāna ratasya ca
translated: Even for one endowed with means, devoted to pilgrimage and charity,

analyzed: a kṛte tu vṛṣotsarge para loka gatiḥ na hi
translated: If the rite of releasing a bull is not performed, there is no passage to the next world.

original: tasmāt kṛṣṇa vṛṣotsargaḥ kartavya iti me śrutam /
analyzed: tasmāt kṛṣṇa vṛṣotsargaḥ kartavyaḥ iti me śrutam
translated: Therefore, O Krishna, I have heard that the release of a bull should be performed.

original: kiṃ phalaṃ vṛṣayajñasya purā kena kṛto hare // / / //
analyzed: kim phalam vṛṣa yajñasya purā kena kṛtaḥ hare

analyzed: vipram pradakṣiṇīkṛtya dvijarṣabham atha abruvan
translated: Having circumambulated the brahmin, that bull among brahmins, they said:

analyzed: adya naḥ kṣantum arhe sīti uktvā te sura dāmbhikāḥ
translated: Today you should forgive us, saying this, those gods, with tears in their eyes,

analyzed: gireḥ iva parāvartam samudrasya iva śoṣaṇam
translated: like the turning back of a mountain or the drying up of the ocean,

analyzed: teṣām tat vacanam śrutvā apṛcchat keyūyam iti atha
translated: having heard their words, asked, Who are you?

original: kiṃ māyā kimu vā svapna utāho cittavibhramaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kim māyā kimu vā svapnaḥ uta aho citta vibhramaḥ
translated: Is this an illusion, a dream, or a delusion of the mind?

analyzed: pretāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The ghosts said:

analyzed: avehi tat tvam eva etat pretāḥ vai karma jāḥ vayam
translated: Know that we are indeed ghosts born of our own actions.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: kiṃnāmānaḥ kimācārāḥ kathañca imām daśām gatāḥ
translated: What are your names? What are your practices? And how have you come to this state?

original: avinītāḥ kathaṃ pūrvaṃ vinītāḥ sāmprataṃ katham /
analyzed: avinītāḥ katham pūrvam vinītāḥ sāmpratam katham
translated: How were you disrespectful before and how are you respectful now?

analyzed: pretāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The ghosts said:

analyzed: śṛṇu vipra indra vakṣyāmaḥ praśrānām anupūrvaśas
translated: Listen, O chief of Brahmins, we will tell you the answers in order.

analyzed: uttarāṇi mahā yogin tvad darśana gata aṃhasaḥ
translated: O great yogi, our sins have gone away by seeing you.

original: ahaṃ paryuṣito nāmnā eṣa sūcīmukhaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: aham paryuṣitaḥ nāmnā eṣa sūcīmukhaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: I am named Paryushita, he is known as Suchi-mukha,

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ śīghra gaḥ turyaḥ rodhakaḥ lekhakaḥ paraḥ
translated: The third is Shighraga, the fourth is Rodhaka, and the next is Lekhaka.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: pretānām karma jātānām kutas nāma nirarthakam
translated: How can the names of ghosts born of their own actions be meaningless?

original: niruktimeṣāṃ nāmnāṃ vai pretā vadata mā ciram /
analyzed: niruktim eṣām nāmnām vai pretāḥ vadata mā ciram
translated: O ghosts, tell me the etymologies of these names without delay.

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shrikrishna said:

analyzed: evam uktāḥ tu vipreṇa pṛthak uttaram abruvan
translated: Thus addressed by the Brahmin, they spoke their individual replies.

original: paryuṣita uvāca /🔽kadācicchrāddhakāle vai mayā vipro nimantritaḥ // / / //
analyzed: paryuṣitaḥ uvāca  kadācid śrāddha kāle vai mayā vipraḥ nimantritaḥ
translated: Paryushita said:🔽Once, at the time of a Shraddha ceremony, a Brahmin was invited by me.

original: sa ca kṛtvā vilambena vṛddho madgṛhamāgataḥ /
analyzed: sa ca kṛtvā vilambena vṛddhaḥ mad gṛham āgataḥ
translated: He, being old, came to my house with delay.

analyzed: a kṛta śrāddha karmā aham tam pākam bhuktavān kṣudhā
translated: I had not performed the Sraddha ceremony, and being hungry, I ate that food.

analyzed: adadām annam ākṛṣya vipre paryuṣitam kiyat
translated: I gave some stale food to a Brahmana, having brought it from somewhere.

original: tasmāt pāpānmṛtaḥ pāpo yoniṃ vai kutsitāṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt pāpāt mṛtaḥ pāpaḥ yonim vai kutsitām gataḥ
translated: From that sin, I died and went to a despicable birth.

original: yataḥ paryuṣitaṃ dattaṃ tataḥ paryuṣitaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yatas paryuṣitam dattam tatas paryuṣitaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Since stale food was given, I am known as Paryushita.

analyzed: sūcīmukhaḥ uvāca
translated: Suchi-mukha said:

analyzed: kadācid brāhmaṇī kācid tīrtham bhadravaṭam yayau
translated: Once a certain Brahmani went to the holy place of Bhadravata.

analyzed: pañca varṣa sutā vṛddhā putra mātra eka jīvitā
translated: She was old, with a son of five years, and her life depended only on her son.

analyzed: aham kṣattriya dāyādaḥ tasyāḥ rodham akāriṣam
translated: I, a Kshatriya heir, obstructed her.

original: vane tu vijane tatra pāpādhvagagatiṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: vane tu vijane tatra pāpa adhvaga gatim gataḥ
translated: In that lonely forest, I went on a sinful journey.

analyzed: tasyāḥ sa vastram pātheyam tad sūnoḥ vasanāni ca
translated: Her clothes, provisions, and the clothes of her son,

analyzed: gṛhītāni mayā vipra śirasi āpīḍya muṣṭinā
translated: were seized by me, O Brahmana, having struck her on the head with my fist.

analyzed: tṛṣā ārtaḥ tad kṣaṇam bālaḥ pātra saṃstham jalam piban
translated: The thirsty boy, drinking water from a vessel at that very moment,

analyzed: tāvanmātra udake deśe mayā huṅkṛtya vāritaḥ
translated: was stopped by me with a hum sound in a place with only that much water.

analyzed: mayā atha sakalam pītam jalam pātrāt tṛṣāvatā
translated: Then, being thirsty, I drank all the water from the vessel.

analyzed: bālaḥ pi bhaya santrastaḥ pipāsuḥ vyasuḥ āpatat
translated: The frightened boy, thirsty, fell down dead.

original: putraśokānmṛtā mātā kūpe prāsya nijaṃ vapuḥ // / / //
analyzed: putra śokāt mṛtā mātā kūpe prāsya nijam vapuḥ
translated: My mother died of grief for her son, throwing herself into a well.

analyzed: etasmāt pātakāt vipra preta tvam prāptavān aham
translated: O Brahmin, it is from this sin that I have attained the state of a ghost.

analyzed: sūci agra prāya vivara mukhaḥ parvata dehavān
translated: Having a body like a mountain, my mouth is as small as the tip of a needle.

original: yadyapi prāpnuyāṃ bhakṣyaṃ bhakṣituntu na śakyate /
analyzed: yadi api prāpnuyām bhakṣyam bhakṣitum tu na śakyate
translated: Even if I obtain food, I am unable to eat it.

original: mayā kṣudhānalenāpi jvalatāsyaṃ nikocitam // / / //🔽ata āsye tu vivaraṃ sūcyagreṇa samaṃmama /
analyzed: mayā kṣudhā analena api jvalatā āsyam nikocitam  atas āsye tu vivaram sūci agreṇa samam mama
translated: Even I, burning with the fire of hunger, am unable to open my mouth.🔽Therefore, my mouth is as small as the tip of a needle.

analyzed: etasmāt kāraṇāt vipre nāmnā sūcīmukhaḥ smi aham
translated: For this reason, O Brahmin, my name is Suchi-mukha (needle-mouth).

original: śīghraga uvāca /🔽purāhaṃ vaiśyajātīyaḥ sākaṃ sakhyā ca kenacit /
analyzed: śīghragaḥ uvāca  purā aham vaiśya jātīyaḥ sākam sakhyā ca kenacid
translated: Shighraga said:

analyzed: vāṇijyam kartum agamam deśam anyam mahādhanaḥ
translated: Formerly, I was a very wealthy Vaishya, and I went to another country with a friend to do business.

original: mitraṃ ca me bahudhanaṃ tasya lobho mahāṃstataḥ /
analyzed: mitram ca me bahu dhanam tasya lobhaḥ mahān tatas
translated: And my friend was very wealthy, and I became very greedy for his wealth.

analyzed: jātaḥ u pi adṛṣṭa vaimukhyāt me naṣṭam mūlam api uta
translated: But due to my lack of foresight, my own capital was lost.

original: tatastasmāttu niṣkrāntāvāvāṃ nāvātha nimnagām /🔽mārgagāṃ tartumārabdhau lohitāyati bhāskare // / / //
analyzed: tatas tasmāt tu niṣkrāntau āvām na āvām atha nimnagām  mārga gām tartum ārabdhau lohitāyati bhāskare
translated: Then we left that place and boarded a boat on the river.🔽We started crossing the river, which was flowing along our path, when the sun was turning red.

analyzed: sakhā sa ca mad utsaṅge suṣvāpa adhva klama ākulaḥ
translated: And my friend, exhausted from the journey, fell asleep in my lap.

analyzed: abhūt tadā ati pāpasya krūrā matiḥ atīva me
translated: Then a cruel thought arose in me, extremely sinful.

analyzed: tam utsaṅga gatam sūre naṣṭe pūre kṣipam tadā
translated: When the sun rose, I threw him into the water, while he was still in my lap.

original: katkṛtyaṃ kurvato nāvi lokaistu jñātameva na // / / //
analyzed: katkṛtyam kurvataḥ nāvi lokaiḥ tu jñātam eva na
translated: What I did, the people on the boat knew, but not the people on land.

analyzed: tasya yat vastu tat sarvam maṇi muktā ādi kāñcanam  ādāya śīgragaḥ tasmāt deśāt sva gṛham āgataḥ
translated: All the wealth he had, such as jewels, pearls, and gold,🔽I took and quickly left that place and returned to my own house.

original: tatsarvaṃ svagṛhe muktvā tasya patnyai nyavedayam /
analyzed: tat sarvam sva gṛhe muktvā tasya patnyai nyavedayam
translated: Having left all that in my house, I informed his wife,

original: dasyubhirme hato bhrātā dhanamācchidya vai pathi // / / //
analyzed: dasyubhiḥ me hataḥ bhrātā dhanam ācchidya vai pathi
translated: My brother was killed by robbers on the road, having robbed him of his wealth.

analyzed: prajāvati pradrutaḥ ham mā rodi iti evam abravam
translated: I ran away, saying, 'Do not weep.'

analyzed: śoka ārtā sā api tad kālam mamatvam gṛha bandhuṣu
translated: She too, afflicted with grief, abandoned her attachment to her house and relatives

analyzed: tyaktvā ca ati priyān prāṇān juhāva agnau yathāvidhi
translated: and, having given up her dear life, offered it into the fire according to the prescribed ritual.

original: tato niṣkaṇṭakaṃ taddhi vīkṣya hṛṣṭo gato gṛham // / / //
analyzed: tatas niṣkaṇṭakam tat hi vīkṣya hṛṣṭaḥ gataḥ gṛham
translated: Then, seeing that place free from obstacles, I was delighted and went home.

analyzed: abhuñjam sarvam āgatya yāvajjīvam tu tat dhanam
translated: Having come, I enjoyed all that wealth for the rest of my life.

original: mitraṃ pūre hi niḥ kṣipya yadahaṃ śīghramāgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: mitram pūre hi niḥ kṣipya yat aham śīghram āgataḥ
translated: Because I quickly left after throwing my friend Pūra into the water,

analyzed: etasmāt kāraṇāt pretaḥ śīghragaḥ ham tu nāmataḥ
translated: for that reason I am a ghost named Śīghraga (Swift-goer).

analyzed: rodhakaḥ uvāca
translated: Rodhaka said:

analyzed: śūdra jātīyaḥ purā abhūvam muni īśvara
translated: O great sage, in the past, I was a Shudra by caste,

analyzed: rāja prasāda āpta mahā śata grāma adhikāravān  vṛddhau me pitarau āstām laghuḥ ekaḥ sahodaraḥ
translated: with authority over a large number of villages obtained through the grace of the king.🔽My parents were old, and I had a younger brother,

original: śīghraṃ sa ca mayā bhrātā lubdhenaikaḥ pṛthakkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: śīghram sa ca mayā bhrātā lubdhena ekaḥ pṛthakkṛtaḥ
translated: and that brother of mine was quickly separated by me, the greedy one.

original: āptavānparamaṃ duḥkhaṃ sonnavastravivarjitaḥ // / / //🔽adattāṃ pitarau cchannaṃ kiñcitkiñcittu tasya ca /
analyzed: āptavān paramam duḥkham sa unna vastra vivarjitaḥ  adattām pitarau channam kiñcid kiñcid tu tasya ca
translated: He obtained supreme sorrow, being deprived of new clothes,🔽and my parents secretly gave him little by little, without my knowledge.

analyzed: tasmai pitṛbhyām yat dattam āptebhyaḥ tat mayā śrutam
translated: I heard from his trusted friends what was given to him by his parents.

analyzed: tat sarvam tattvataḥ jñātvā pitroḥ rodham akārayam
translated: Knowing all that to be true, I imprisoned my parents,

analyzed: śūnya mandire ekasmin baddhvā tu nigaḍaiḥ dṛḍhaiḥ
translated: binding them tightly with chains in an empty house.

analyzed: tatas tau jahatuḥ prāṇān duḥ khitau viṣa pānataḥ
translated: Then, afflicted with grief, they gave up their lives by drinking poison.

original: sosau bālo 'pi babhrāma pitṛbhyāṃ rahito dvija // / / //
analyzed: saḥ asau bālaḥ babhrāma pitṛbhyām rahitaḥ dvija
translated: And that boy, O Brahmin, separated from his parents, wandered,

analyzed: puras kheṭān api mṛtaḥ kṣudhā
translated: dying of hunger in front of towns, villages, and hamlets.

analyzed: etasmāt pātakāt vipra mṛtaḥ preta tvam āgataḥ
translated: From that sin, O Brahmin, I died and came to the state of a ghost.

analyzed: ruddhau tu pitarau yasmāt nāmnā aham rodhakaḥ tatas
translated: Since I have thus confined my parents, I am therefore called Rodhaka.

analyzed: lekhakaḥ uvāca
translated: Lekhaka said:

analyzed: aham vipra purā abhūvam avantyām dvija la sattamaḥ
translated: O Brahmin, in a past life, I was a great Brahmin in Avanti.

original: bhadrasya rājño devānāṃ pūjane 'dhikṛto hyaham /🔽bahvyastu pratimāstatra babhūvurbahunāmikāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhadrasya rājñaḥ devānām pūjane dhi kṛtaḥ hi aham  bahvyaḥ tu pratimāḥ tatra babhūvuḥ bahu nāmikāḥ
translated: I was appointed by King Bhadra to worship the gods.🔽There were many idols with various names.

analyzed: hemnaḥ tad aṅgeṣu bahu ratna jātam babhūva ha
translated: Much gold and various jewels were used in making their limbs.

original: tāsāṃ me kurvataḥ pūjāṃ pāpā matirajāyata // / / //🔽akhilaṃ tīkṣṇalohena tāsāmaṅgaṃ viśīrya ca /
analyzed: tāsām me kurvataḥ pūjām pāpā matiḥ ajāyata  akhilam tīkṣṇalohena tāsām aṅgam viśīrya ca
translated: While worshipping them, an evil thought arose in my mind.🔽I destroyed their limbs with sharp iron tools.

original: ullekhanañca ratnānāṃ netrādibhyaḥ kṛtaṃ mayā // / / //🔽tathākṛtānyathāṅgāni pratimānāṃ nirīkṣya ca /
analyzed: ullekhanam ca ratnānām netra ādibhyaḥ kṛtam mayā  tathākṛtāni atha aṅgāni pratimānām nirīkṣya ca
translated: I also extracted the jewels from their eyes and other parts.

analyzed: netrāṇi ca viratnāni nṛpaḥ cukrodha vahni vat
translated: Seeing the idols with their limbs damaged and their eyes without jewels, the king became angry like fire.

analyzed: pratijajñe nṛpaḥ paścāt eṣa brāhmaṇa puṅgavaḥ
translated: The king later vowed, This best of Brahmins

original: ābhyo ratnaṃ suvarṇañca hṛtaṃ yena bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: ābhyaḥ ratnam suvarṇam ca hṛtam yena bhaviṣyati
translated: will be punished for stealing the jewels and gold from them.

original: jñātaśca sa hi me vadhyo bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: jñātaḥ ca sa hi me vadhyaḥ bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And he will be known and killed by me, there is no doubt.

analyzed: aham tat sakalam jñātvā rātrau asi dharaḥ gṛham
translated: Knowing all this, I entered his house at night with a sword.

analyzed: rājñaḥ praviśya rājānam paśumāram amārayam
translated: Having entered the king's palace, I killed the king, the slayer of animals.

analyzed: gṛhītvā atha maṇīn svarṇam niśīthe haṃ gataḥ nyatas
translated: Then taking the jewels and gold, I went elsewhere at night.

original: vyāghreṇa mahātāraṇye nakhaṭaṅkairviṭaṅkitaḥ /🔽lekhanātpratimāyā yanmayā lohena kartitam // / / //
analyzed: vyāghreṇa mahā tāraṇye nakha ṭaṅkaiḥ viṭaṅkitaḥ  lekhanāt pratimāyāḥ yat mayā lohena kartitam
translated: In a great forest, I was torn by a tiger with its claws and teeth.🔽Because I cut with iron what was written on an image,

analyzed: etasmāt pātakāt pretaḥ lekhakaḥ nāmataḥ smi aham
translated: from this sin I am a preta named Lekhaka.

analyzed: āsīt naraka bhoga ante naḥ preta tvam idam dvija
translated: After the end of my hellish experiences, I became a preta, O Brahmin.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: saṃjñāḥ tādṛśyaḥ ākhyātāḥ yathā etāḥ bhavatā daśāḥ
translated: You have described the signs and conditions like these.

analyzed: vadantu ācāra mātram me pretāḥ āhāram api uta
translated: Let the pretas tell me about their conduct and food.

original: pretā ūcuḥ /🔽vedamārgānusaraṇaṃ lajjā dharmo damaḥ kṣamā /
analyzed: pretāḥ ūcuḥ  veda mārga anusaraṇam lajjā dharmaḥ damaḥ kṣamā
translated: The pretas said:🔽We dwell where there is no following of the Vedic path, no shame, no dharma, no self-control, no forgiveness,

original: dhṛtirjñānaṃ naiva yatra vayaṃ tatra vasāmahe // / / //
analyzed: dhṛtiḥ jñānam na eva yatra vayam tatra vasāmahe
translated: no patience, and no knowledge.

original: tasya pīḍāṃ vapaṃ kurmo naiva śrāddhaṃ na tarpaṇam /
analyzed: tasya pīḍām vapam kurmaḥ na eva śrāddham na tarpaṇam
translated: We cause affliction to him, not to his sraddha or tarpana.

original: yasya gehe tadaṅgāttu māṃsañca rudhiraṃ kramāt // / / //
analyzed: yasya gehe tad aṅgāt tu māṃsam ca rudhiram kramāt
translated: In whose house, in due order, there is flesh and blood from his body,

original: jakṣāmaśca pibāmaśca ukta ācāra eṣa naḥ /
analyzed: jakṣāmaḥ ca pibāmaḥ ca uktaḥ ācāraḥ eṣa naḥ
translated: we eat and drink. This is our stated conduct.

analyzed: śṛṇu ca āhāram asmākam sarva loka vigarhitam
translated: Listen to our food, which is condemned by all the worlds.

analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ tvayā ca kiñcid vai brūmaḥ jñātam tvayā anagha
translated: You have seen something. Tell us what you know, O sinless one.

original: vamanaṃ viḍū dūṣikā ca śleṣmā mūtrāśruṇī tathā // / / //🔽etadbhakṣyañca pānañca mā pṛcchātaḥ paraṃ dvija /
analyzed: vamanam dūṣikā ca śleṣmā mūtra aśruṇī tathā  etat bhakṣyam ca pānam ca mā pṛccha atas param dvija
translated: Vomiting, feces, phlegm, urine, tears, and so on -🔽This is our food and drink. Do not ask anything beyond this, O Brahmin.

original: lajjā no jāyate svāminnāhāraṃ vadatāṃ svakam // / / //
analyzed: lajjā naḥ jāyate svāmin āhāram vadatām svakam
translated: O Lord, we feel no shame in telling you our own food.

analyzed: ajñānāḥ tāmasāḥ mandā kāndiśīkāḥ vayam vibho
translated: We are ignorant, in the mode of darkness, dull, and confused, O Lord.

original: akasmājjanmanāṃ vipra smṛtiḥ prāptā tu paurvikī // / / //
analyzed: akasmāt janmanām vipra smṛtiḥ prāptā tu paurvikī
translated: O Brahmin, we have suddenly obtained the memory of our past life.

analyzed: vinīta tva avinīta tve jānīmaḥ nā eva naḥ prabho
translated: We do not know whether we are humble or not, O Lord.

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shrikrishna said:

original: evaṃ vadatsu preteṣu tathā śrutavati dvije // / / //
analyzed: evam vadatsu preteṣu tathā śrutavati dvije
translated: While the ghosts were speaking thus and the Brahmin was listening,

analyzed: adarśayam aham rūpam tadā tārkṣya idam eva vai
translated: I then showed this very form to Tarkshya.

original: sa tu dṛṣṭvā dvijaśreṣṭho hṛdgataṃ puruṣaṃ puraḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa tu dṛṣṭvā dvijaśreṣṭhaḥ hṛd gatam puruṣam puras
translated: That best of Brahmins saw the Supreme Person in front of him, in his heart,

analyzed: stotraiḥ tuṣṭāva pakṣi īśa daṇḍa vat praṇanāma mām
translated: and praised Him with hymns, O Lord of birds, and prostrated before Me.

analyzed: te pi tepuḥ tatas pretāḥ āścarya utphulla cakṣuṣaḥ
translated: Then the ghosts also praised Him, their eyes wide with wonder.

analyzed: praṇayena skhalat vācaḥ khaga nā ūcuḥ kim api uta
translated: O bird, they spoke with faltering words out of affection, but said nothing.

analyzed: rajasā goḥ acittānām tamasā mūḍha cetasām
translated: For those whose minds are covered by the dust of attachment and whose intellect is deluded by darkness,

original: kṛpayā yaḥ samuddhāraṃ kuruṣe vai namo 'sta te // / / //
analyzed: kṛpayā yaḥ samuddhāram kuruṣe vai namaḥ sta te
translated: You who bring about their liberation through compassion, to you I offer salutations.

original: evaṃ dvijātau bruvati prabhū taprabhaiśca mukhyāṃbaracāriyuktaiḥ /
analyzed: evam dvijātau bruvati mukhya aṃbara cāri yuktaiḥ
translated: When the brahmin was speaking thus, and the chief sky-goers along with their retinue,

original: tadā madicchāprabhavairvimānaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ samantādruruce giriḥ saḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā mad icchā prabhavaiḥ vimānaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ samantāt ruruce giriḥ saḥ
translated: Then that mountain shone all around with the six vimānas produced by my will.

original: itthaṃ vimānena madīyalokaṃ gato dvijaraso 'pyatha pañcamistaiḥ /

analyzed: āhāraḥ maithunam nidrā bhayam krodhaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Food, sex, sleep, fear and anger are common to all beings.

original: sarveṣā meva jantūnāṃ viveko durlabhaḥ paraḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva jantūnām vivekaḥ durlabhaḥ paraḥ
translated: Discrimination is very difficult for all beings.

analyzed: eka pāda ādi rūpeṇa deha bhedāḥ tu anekaśas
translated: The differences in bodies are in many ways, in the form of one-footed and so on.

original: kṛṣṇasāro mṛgo yatra dharmadaśaḥ sa ucyate /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa sāraḥ mṛgaḥ yatra dharma daśaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: That place where there are black antelopes is said to be the abode of dharma.

analyzed: brahma ādyāḥ devatāḥ sarvāḥ tatra tiṣṭhanti sarvaśas
translated: All gods beginning with Brahma reside there in every way.

analyzed: bhūtānām prāṇinaḥ śreṣṭhāḥ prāṇinām mati jīvinaḥ
translated: Among beings, living beings are the best, among living beings, those with intelligence.

original: matimatsu narāḥ śreṣṭhā nareṣu brāhmaṇāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: matimatsu narāḥ śreṣṭhāḥ nareṣu brāhmaṇāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Among the intelligent, humans are the best, among humans, Brahmins are remembered as the best.

analyzed: mānuṣyam yaḥ samāsādya svargam ekṣā eka sādhakam
translated: One who, having attained human birth, the sole means of attaining heaven,

analyzed: tayoḥ na sādhayet ekam tena ātmā vañcitaḥ dhruvam
translated: Does not accomplish one of those two, is certainly deceiving oneself.

original: icchati śatī sahasraṃ sahasrī lakṣamīhate kartum /
analyzed: icchati śatī sahasram sahasrī lakṣam īhate kartum
translated: One desiring a hundred desires a thousand, one desiring a lakh desires to make a lakh.

original: lakṣādhipatī rājyaṃ rājāpi sakalāṃ dharāṃ labdhum // / / //🔽cakradharo 'pi suratvaṃ surabhāve sakalasurapatirbhavitum /
analyzed: lakṣādhipatiḥ rājyam rājā api sakalām dharām labdhum 🔽cakradharaḥ pi sura tvam sura bhāve sakala surapatiḥ bhavitum
translated: The lord of lakhs desires a kingdom, and the king desires to obtain the entire earth.🔽The wielder of the discus desires the state of a god, and in the state of a god, he desires to become the lord of all gods.

analyzed: surapatiḥ ūrdhva gati tvam tathā api tṛṣṇā
translated: Even though he has attained the upward path, the lord of the gods does not turn away from craving.

analyzed: tṛṣṇayā ca abhibhūtaḥ tu narakam pratipadyate
translated: And being overcome by craving, one goes to hell.

analyzed: tṛṣṇā muktāḥ tu ye kecid svarga vāsam labhanti te
translated: But those who are freed from craving, they attain a heavenly abode.

analyzed: ātma adhīnaḥ pumān loke sukhī bhavati niścitam
translated: A man who is self-controlled in this world certainly becomes happy.

original: śabdaḥ sparśaśca rūpaṃ ca raso gandhaśca tadguṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śabdaḥ sparśaḥ ca rūpam ca rasaḥ gandhaḥ ca tad guṇāḥ
translated: Sound, touch, form, taste, and smell are the qualities of that.

original: tathā ca viṣayādhīno duḥ khī bhavati niścitam // / / //
analyzed: tathā ca viṣaya adhīnaḥ duḥ khī bhavati niścitam
translated: And likewise, one who is controlled by objects certainly becomes miserable.

analyzed: kuraṅga matāṅga pataṅga bhṛṅga mīnāḥ hatāḥ pañcabhiḥ eva pañca
translated: Deer, elephants, moths, bees, and fish are killed by the five alone.

original: ekaḥ pramādī sa kathaṃ na hanyate yaḥ sevate pañcabhireva pañca // / / //
analyzed: ekaḥ pramādī sa katham na hanyate yaḥ sevate pañcabhiḥ eva pañca
translated: How is it that the single heedless one is not killed, who indulges in the five with the five alone?

analyzed: pitṛ mātṛ mayaḥ bālye yauvane dayitā mayaḥ
translated: In childhood, one is full of parents; in youth, full of wife;

analyzed: putra pautra mayaḥ ca ante mūḍhaḥ na ātma mayaḥ kvacid
translated: And in the end, full of sons and grandsons; the deluded one is never full of the self.

analyzed: loha dāru mayaiḥ pāśaiḥ pumān baddhaḥ vimucyate
translated: A man bound by iron and wooden fetters is released.

analyzed: putra dāra mayaiḥ pāśaiḥ nā eva baddhaḥ vimucyate
translated: But one bound by fetters of wife and children is never released.

original: ekaḥ karoti pāpāni phalaṃ bhuṅkte mahājanaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ karoti pāpāni phalam bhuṅkte mahājanaḥ
translated: One alone commits sins, but the people at large enjoy the fruits.

analyzed: bhoktāraḥ viprayujyante kartā doṣeṇa lipyate
translated: The enjoyers are separated, the doer is tainted with fault.

original: ko 'pi mṛtyuṃ na jayati bālo vṛddho yuvāpi vā /
analyzed: kaḥ pi mṛtyum na jayati bālaḥ vṛddhaḥ yuvā api vā
translated: No one conquers death, whether a child, an old man, or a youth.

original: sukhaduḥ khādiko vāpi punarāyāti yāti ca // / / //
analyzed: sukha duḥ kha ādikaḥ vā api punar āyāti yāti ca
translated: And happiness, sorrow, and so on, come and go again.

analyzed: sarveṣām paśyatām eva mṛtaḥ sarvam parityajet
translated: While all are watching, a dead person would abandon everything.

analyzed: ekaḥ prajāyate jantuḥ ekaḥ eva pralīyate
translated: A creature is born alone, and alone it perishes.

original: eko 'pi bhuṅkte sukṛtameka eva ca duṣkṛtam /
analyzed: ekaḥ pi bhuṅkte sukṛtam ekaḥ eva ca duṣkṛtam
translated: Alone one enjoys good deeds, and alone one suffers for bad deeds.

original: mṛtaṃ śarīramutsṛjya kāṣṭhaloṣṭasamaṅkṣitau // / / //🔽bāndhavā vimukhā yānti dharmastamanugacchati /
analyzed: mṛtam śarīram utsṛjya kāṣṭha loṣṭa samaṅkṣitau  bāndhavāḥ vimukhāḥ yānti dharmaḥ tam anugacchati
translated: Having abandoned the dead body, which is like a piece of wood or a clod of earth,🔽relatives turn away and depart, but one's own Dharma follows one.

original: gṛheṣvarthā nivartante śmaśānānmitrabāndhavāḥ // / / //🔽śarīraṃ vahnirādatte sukṛtaṃ duṣkṛtaṃ vrajet /
analyzed: gṛheṣu arthāḥ nivartante śmaśānāt mitra bāndhavāḥ  śarīram vahniḥ ādatte sukṛtam duṣkṛtam vrajet
translated: Wealth turns back from the houses, friends and relatives from the cremation ground.🔽The body is taken by fire, and good or bad deeds go along.

original: śarīraṃ vahninā dagdhaṃ puṇyaṃ pāpaṃ saha sthitam // / / //
analyzed: śarīram vahninā dagdham puṇyam pāpam saha sthitam
translated: The body, burned by fire, remains with good and bad deeds.

original: śubhaṃ vā yadi vā pāpaṃ bhuṅkte sarvatra mānavaḥ /🔽yadanastamite sūrye na dattaṃ dhanamarthinām // / / //
analyzed: śubham vā yadi vā pāpam bhuṅkte sarvatra mānavaḥ  yat an astamite sūrye na dattam dhanam arthinām
translated: A man enjoys everywhere, whether good or bad.🔽I do not know whose wealth it will be in the morning,

original: na jāne tasya tadvittaṃ prātaḥ kasya bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na jāne tasya tat vittam prātar kasya bhaviṣyati
translated: which was not given to the needy while the sun was not set.

original: rāraṭīti dhanaṃ tasya ko me bhartā bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: rāraṭīti dhanam tasya kaḥ me bhartā bhaviṣyati
translated: She cries out, 'Who will be my husband and give me wealth?'

analyzed: na dattam dvijamukhyebhyaḥ para upakṛtaye tathā
translated: Nor has it been given to the chief Brahmins for the benefit of others.

analyzed: pūrva janma kṛtāt puṇyāt yat labdham bahu ca alpakam
translated: Whatever little wealth has been obtained from the merit earned in previous births,

analyzed: tat īdṛśam parijñāya dharma arthe dīyate dhanam
translated: Having recognized it to be like this, wealth is given for the sake of Dharma and Artha.

analyzed: dhanena dhāryate dharmaḥ śraddhā pūtena cetasā
translated: Dharma is sustained by wealth, with a mind purified by faith.

analyzed: śraddhā virahitaḥ dharmaḥ na iha amutra ca tad phalam
translated: Dharma devoid of faith has no fruits here or hereafter.

analyzed: dharmāt ca jāyate hi arthaḥ dharmāt kāmaḥ pi jāyate
translated: Artha arises from Dharma, and even Kama arises from Dharma.

analyzed: dharmaḥ eva apavargāya tasmāt dharmam samācaret
translated: Dharma alone leads to liberation, therefore one should practice Dharma.

analyzed: śraddhayā sādhyate dharmaḥ bahubhiḥ na artha rāśibhiḥ
translated: Dharma is accomplished by faith, not by many heaps of wealth.

original: akiñcanā hi munayaḥ śraddhāvanto divaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: akiñcanāḥ hi munayaḥ śraddhāvantaḥ divam gatāḥ
translated: Indeed, sages without possessions, full of faith, have gone to heaven.

original: aśraddhayā hutaṃ dattaṃ tapastaptaṃ kṛtaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: aśraddhayā hutam dattam tapaḥ taptam kṛtam ca yat
translated: Whatever is offered, given, austerity performed, or done without faith,

analyzed: asat iti ucyate pakṣin pretya ca iha na tat phalam
translated: That is said to be false, O bird, and has no fruits hereafter or in this world.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe dvitīyāṃśe dharmakādṛpretakalpe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde mṛtasya dharmamātrānuyāyitvanirūpaṇaṃ nāma dvādaśo🔽śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam🔽garuḍa uvāca /🔽karmaṇā kena deveśa pretatvaṃ naiva jāyate /
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe dvitīya aṃśe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde mṛtasya dharmamātrānuyāyitvanirūpaṇam nāma dvādaśaḥ  śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam  garuḍaḥ uvāca  karmaṇā kena deveśa preta tvam nā eva jāyate
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter in the Uttarārdha of the second part in the Garuḍa Purāṇa, in the description of the Pretakalpa, in the dialogue between Śrīkṛṣṇa and Garuḍa, on the determination of the sole inheritor of the dead person's merit.🔽The Glorious Garuḍa Mahāpurāṇa🔽Garuḍa said:🔽By what action, O Lord of gods, does one not become a ghost?🔽

original: pṛthivyāṃ sarvajantūnāṃ tad brūhi parameśvara // / / //🔽śrīkṛṣṇa uvāca /🔽atha vakṣyāmi saṃkṣepātkṣayāhādaurdhvadaihikam /🔽kvahastenaiva kartavyaṃ mokṣakāmaistu mānavaiḥ // / / //🔽strīṇāmapi viśeṣeṇa pañcavarṣādhike śiśau /🔽vṛṣotsargādikaṃ karma pretatvavinivṛttaye /🔽vṛṣotsargādṛte nānyatkiñcidasti mahītale // / / //🔽jīvanvāpi mṛto vāpi vṛṣotsargaṃ karoti yaḥ /🔽pretatvaṃ na bhavettasya vinā dānamakhavrataiḥ // / / //🔽garuḍa uvāca /🔽kasminkāle vṛṣotsargaṃ jīvanvāpi mṛto 'pi vā /
analyzed: pṛthivyām sarva jantūnām tat brūhi parameśvara 🔽śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca 🔽atha vakṣyāmi saṃkṣepāt kṣaya ahāt aurdhvadaihikam 🔽kvahastena eva kartavyam mokṣa kāmaiḥ tu mānavaiḥ 🔽strīṇām api viśeṣeṇa pañca varṣa adhike śiśau 🔽vṛṣotsarga ādikam karma preta tva vinivṛttaye 🔽vṛṣotsargāt ṛte na anyat kiñcid asti mahī tale 🔽jīvan vā api mṛtaḥ vā api vṛṣotsargam karoti yaḥ 🔽preta tvam na bhavet tasya vinā dāna makha vrataiḥ 🔽garuḍaḥ uvāca 🔽kasmin kāle vṛṣotsargam jīvan vā api vā
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter, in the Vamana Purana, describing the journey of the dead person to the other world, and the means of his liberation from the state of Preta.

analyzed: kuryāt sura vara śreṣṭha brūhi me madhusūdana
translated: O best of the excellent gods, please tell me, O slayer of Madhu.

original: kiṃ phalaṃ tu bhavedante kṛtaiḥ śrāddhaistu ṣoḍaśaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kim phalam tu bhavet ante kṛtaiḥ śrāddhaiḥ tu ṣoḍaśaiḥ

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca

analyzed: ekādaśa ahe pretasya yasya na utsṛjyate vṛṣaḥ
translated: If a bull is not released for eleven days after someone's death,

analyzed: preta tvam su sthiram tasya dattaiḥ śrāddha śataiḥ api

translated: Garuda said:🔽For those who die from snake bites, fire burns, etc., no rituals are performed.

analyzed: jalena śṛṅgiṇā vā api śastra ādyaiḥ mriyate yadi
translated: If one dies by water, horned animals, weapons, etc.,

translated: O Lord, how is purification for those who die an inauspicious death?

analyzed: etat me saṃśayam deva chettum arhasi aśeṣatas
translated: O God, please completely remove this doubt of mine.

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Lord Krishna said:

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsaiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ śudhyet yugme sārdhe tu bāhujaḥ
translated: A Brahmin becomes pure in six months, a Kshatriya in a year and a half,

analyzed: sa ardha māsena vaiśyaḥ tu śūdraḥ māsena śudhyati
translated: A Vaishya in a month and a half, and a Shudra in a month.

analyzed: dattvā dānāni aśeṣāṇi su tīrthe mriyate yadi
translated: If one dies in a good holy place after giving all kinds of gifts,

translated: He who is celibate and pure does not go to a bad state in this world.

translated: Having performed the rite of releasing a bull and so on, one should practice the duties of an ascetic.

analyzed: yati tve mṛtyum āpnoti sa gacchet brahmaśākhvatam
translated: If one attains death while being an ascetic, one goes to Brahma's world.

analyzed: vikarma kurute yaḥ tu śiṣṭa ācāra vivarjitaḥ
translated: One who performs forbidden acts, devoid of the conduct of the virtuous,

analyzed: vṛṣotsarga ādikam kṛtvā na gacchet yama śāsanam
translated: Having performed the rite of releasing a bull and so on, does not go to Yama's realm.

analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

translated: O Lord of the gods, if a man or woman has no sons,

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

analyzed: yāni kāni ca dānāni svayam dattāni mānavaiḥ
translated: Whatever gifts are given by men with their own hands,

analyzed: tāni tāni ca sarvāṇi tu upatiṣṭhanti ca agratas  vyañjanāni vicitrāṇi bhakṣya bhojyāni yāni ca

analyzed: go bhū hiraṇya vāsāṃsi bhojanāni pādani ca

analyzed: yatra yatra vaset jantuḥ tatra tatra upatiṣṭhati
translated: whatever is given with one's own hands, all that stands before the person wherever he may be.

analyzed: yāvat svastham śarīram hi tāvat dharmam samācaret
translated: As long as the body is healthy, one should practice dharma.

analyzed: asvasthaḥ preritaḥ ca anyaiḥ na a kiñcid kartum arhati
translated: An unhealthy person, being urged by others, is not fit to do anything.

analyzed: jīvataḥ pi mṛtasya iha na bhūtam ca aurdhvadaihikam
translated: For one who is alive, there is no afterlife.

analyzed: vāyu bhūtaḥ kṣudhā āviṣṭaḥ bhramate ca divāniśam
translated: Becoming like air, afflicted by hunger, one wanders day and night.

original: kṛmiḥ kīṭaḥ pataṅgo vā jāyate mriyate punaḥ /
analyzed: kṛmiḥ kīṭaḥ pataṅgaḥ vā jāyate mriyate punar
translated: One is born as a worm, insect, or moth, and dies again.

analyzed: asat garbhe bhavet saḥ jātaḥ sadyas vinaśyati
translated: Even in an impure womb, one is born and immediately perishes.

translated: As long as this body is healthy, free from disease, old age is far away, the power of the senses is unimpeded, and there is no decline in lifespan,

translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter on the praise of giving away a bull, charity, the son of Dharma, etc., in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Garuda in the Pretakalpa section of the Dharma Kanda in the second part of the Uttara Khanda in the glorious Garuda Purana.

translated: Garuda said:

analyzed: svastha avasthena dattena vidhi hīnena vā vibho
