analyzed: śṛṇu tārkṣya param guhyam dānānām dānam uttamam
translated: Listen, O Garuḍa, the supreme secret, the best of all gifts,

analyzed: paramam sarva dānānām param gopyam divaukasām
translated: The highest of all gifts, the most secret of the heaven-dwellers,

analyzed: deyam ekam mahādānam kārpāsam ca uttamottamam
translated: The one great gift to be given, cotton, the best of the best,

original: yena dattena prīyante bhūrbhuvaḥ svariti kramāt // / / //
analyzed: yena dattena prīyante bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar iti kramāt
translated: By giving which Bhū, Bhuvaḥ, Svaḥ are pleased in order.

analyzed: brahma ādyāḥ devatāḥ sarvāḥ kāryāt ca prītim āpnuyuḥ
translated: All the gods, Brahma and others, will be pleased with this act.

analyzed: deyam etat mahā dānam preta uddharaṇa hetave
translated: This great gift should be given for the liberation of the departed.

analyzed: ciram vaset rudra loke tatas rājā bhavet iha
translated: He will dwell for a long time in Rudra's world and then become a king here.

analyzed: rūpavān subhagaḥ vāgmī śrīmān atula vikramaḥ
translated: Handsome, fortunate, eloquent, prosperous, and incomparable in valor,

original: yamalokaṃ vinirjitya svargaṃ tākṣya sa gacchati // / / //
analyzed: yama lokam vinirjitya svargam sa gacchati
translated: having conquered the world of Yama, he goes to heaven.

original: gāṃ tilāṃśca kṣitaṃ hema yo dadāti dvijanmane /
analyzed: gām tilān ca kṣitam hema yaḥ dadāti dvijanmane
translated: He who gives a cow, sesamum, land, and gold to a Brahmin,

analyzed: tasya pāpam tad kṣaṇāt eva naśyati
translated: his sins earned in this life perish instantly.

analyzed: tilāḥ gāvaḥ mahā dānam mahāpātaka nāśanam
translated: Sesamum, cows, and land are great gifts that destroy great sins.

analyzed: tat dvayam dīyate vipre na anya varṇe kadācana
translated: Those two are given to a Brahmin, never to any other caste.

analyzed: kalpitam dīyate dānam tilāḥ gāvaḥ ca medinī
translated: Gifts are given, sesamum, cows, and land,

analyzed: anyeṣu nā eva varṇeṣu poṣya varge kadācana
translated: never to other castes or to dependents.

analyzed: poṣya varge tathā strīṣu dānam deyam akalpitam
translated: To dependents and women, gifts should be given without any consideration.

original: āture voparāge ca dvayaṃ dānaṃ viśiṣyate /
analyzed: āture vā uparāge ca dvayam dānam viśiṣyate
translated: In sickness or eclipse, both gifts are especially recommended.

analyzed: āture dīyate dānam tad kāle ca upatiṣṭhati
translated: A gift given in sickness is effective at that time.

analyzed: jīvataḥ tu punar dattam upatiṣṭhati asaṃskṛtam
translated: But a gift given to the living is effective even if not consecrated.

analyzed: satyam satyam punar satyam yat dattam vikala indriye
translated: It is true, it is true, and again it is true, that what is given to one with impaired senses,

analyzed: yat ca anu modate putraḥ tat ca dānam anantakam
translated: And what a son approves of, that gift is endless.

original: ato dadyāt sa putro vā yāvajjīvatsasau ciram /
analyzed: atas dadyāt sa putraḥ vā yāvat jīvat sa asau ciram
translated: Therefore, that son should give as long as he lives for a long time.

analyzed: ativāhaḥ tathā pretaḥ bhogān ca labhate yatas
translated: Because he crosses over and obtains enjoyments as a ghost.

analyzed: asvasthā tura kāle tu dehapāte kṣiti sthite
translated: When one is unwell or at the time of death, when the body falls and rests on the ground,

analyzed: dehe tathā ativāhasya paratas prīṇanam bhavet
translated: And likewise for the one who has crossed over, there will be satisfaction beyond.

analyzed: paṅgau andhe ca kāṇe ca hi ardha unmīlita locane
translated: For the lame, the blind, the one-eyed, and the one with half-opened eyes,

analyzed: tileṣu darbhān saṃstīrya dānam uktam tat akṣayam
translated: Having spread sesamum seeds and darbha grass, the gift is said to be inexhaustible.

original: tilā lauhaṃ hiraṇyañca kārpāsaṃ lavaṇaṃ tathā /
analyzed: tilāḥ lauham hiraṇyam ca kārpāsam lavaṇam tathā
translated: Sesamum seeds, iron, gold, cotton, salt,

analyzed: saptadhānyam kṣitiḥ gāvaḥ ekaikam pāvanam smṛtam
translated: And the seven grains, land, and cows are remembered as each being purifying.

analyzed: loha dānāt yamaḥ tuṣyet dharma rājaḥ tila arpaṇāt
translated: By the gift of iron, Yama becomes pleased, by offering sesamum seeds,

original: lavaṇe dīyamāne tu na bhayaṃ vidyate yamāt // / / //
analyzed: lavaṇe dīyamāne tu na bhayam vidyate yamāt
translated: When salt is being given, there is no fear from Yama.

analyzed: karpāsasya tu dānena na bhūtebhyaḥ bhayam bhavet
translated: By the gift of cotton, there will be no fear from beings.

analyzed: tārayanti naram gāvaḥ trividhāḥ ca eva pātakāt
translated: Cows deliver a man from the three types of sins.

analyzed: hema dānāt sukham svarge bhūmi dānāt nṛpaḥ bhavet
translated: By giving gold, one attains happiness in heaven. By giving land, one becomes a king.

analyzed: hema bhūmi pradānāt ca na pīḍā narake bhavet
translated: By giving both gold and land, one does not suffer in hell.

analyzed: sarve yama dūtāḥ ca yama rūpāḥ vibhīṣaṇāḥ
translated: All the messengers of Yama, all the terrifying forms of Yama,

analyzed: sarve te vara dāḥ yānti saptadhānyena prīṇitāḥ
translated: All of them become bestowers of boons when pleased with the seven types of grain.

analyzed: viṣṇoḥ smaraṇa mātreṇa prāpyate paramā gatiḥ
translated: By merely remembering Vishnu, one attains the highest state.

analyzed: etat te sarvam ākhyātam martyaiḥ yā gatiḥ āpyate
translated: This has been told to you - the state that mortals attain.

analyzed: tasmāt putram praśaṃsanti dadāti pituḥ ājñayā
translated: Therefore, they praise the son who gives according to the father's command.

analyzed: bhūmiṣṭham pitaram dṛṣṭvā hi ardha unmīlita locanam
translated: Seeing the father on the ground, with half-opened eyes,

original: tasmin kāle suto yastu sarvadānāni dāpayet /
analyzed: tasmin kāle sutaḥ yaḥ tu sarva dānāni dāpayet
translated: At that time, the son should give all the gifts.

analyzed: gayā śrāddhāt viśiṣyeta sa putraḥ kula nandanaḥ
translated: That son, the delighter of the family, excels the Gayashraddha.

analyzed: sva sthānāt calitaḥ ca asau vikalasya pituḥ tadā
translated: And he has moved from his own place, then for the disabled father,

analyzed: putraiḥ yatnena kartavyā pitaram tārayanti te
translated: The sons should make efforts. They liberate the father.

analyzed: kim dattaiḥ bahubhiḥ dānaiḥ pituḥ antyeṣṭim ācaret
translated: What is the use of giving many gifts? One should perform the last rites for the father.

analyzed: aśvamedhaḥ mahā yajñaḥ kalām na arhati ṣoḍaśīm
translated: The great sacrifice of Ashvamedha does not deserve even a sixteenth part.

analyzed: dharma ātmā sa nu putraḥ vaidevaiḥ api su pūjyate  dāpayet yaḥ tu dānāni hi āturam pitaram bhuvi
translated: That son who is righteous-souled is well-worshipped even by the gods.🔽He who gives gifts on earth to his sick father,

analyzed: loha dānam ca dātavyam bhūmi yuktena pāṇinā
translated: and gives the gift of iron with his hand holding the earth,

original: yamaṃ bhīmañca nāpnoti na gacchet tasya veśmani // / / //
analyzed: yamam bhīmam ca na āpnoti na gacchet tasya veśmani
translated: does not meet Yama, nor does he go to his abode.

analyzed: kuṭhāraḥ musalaḥ daṇḍaḥ khaḍgaḥ ca churikā tathā
translated: The axe, the pestle, the rod, the sword, and the knife,

analyzed: etāni yama hasteṣu dṛśyāni pāpa karmiṇām
translated: these are seen in the hands of Yama by the sinners.

analyzed: tasmāt lohasya dānam tu brāhmaṇāya āturaḥ dadet
translated: Therefore, the sick one should give the gift of iron to a Brahmin.

analyzed: yama āyudhānām santuṣṭyai dānam etat udāhṛtam
translated: This gift is said to be for the satisfaction of Yama's weapons.

original: garbhasthāḥ śiśavo ye ca yuvānaḥ sthavirāstathā /
analyzed: garbha sthāḥ śiśavaḥ ye ca yuvānaḥ sthavirāḥ tathā
translated: Those who are in the womb, the infants, the young, and the old,

analyzed: ebhiḥ dāna viśeṣaiḥ tu nirdaheyuḥ sva pātakam
translated: by these special gifts, they should burn their own sins.

analyzed: churiṇaḥ śyāma śabalau ṣaṇḍāmarkāḥ udumbarāḥ
translated: Those who are dark-spotted, tawny, with white spots, those who are like udumbara flowers,

analyzed: śyāmadūtāḥ ye loha dānena prīṇitāḥ
translated: those who are variegated, dark, and messengers, who are pleased by the gift of iron,

analyzed: putrāḥ pautrāḥ tathā bandhuḥ sagotrāḥ suha hṛdaḥ tathā
translated: sons, grandsons, relatives, those of the same gotra, and good friends,

analyzed: dadate na āture dānam brahma ghnaiḥ tu samāḥ hi te
translated: those who do not give gifts to the sick are equal to the killers of Brahmins.

analyzed: pañcatve bhūmi yuktasya śṛṇu tasya ca yā gatiḥ

analyzed: ativāhaḥ punar sukṛtam labhet
translated: The departed soul attains good deeds after a year in the intermediate state.

analyzed: agni trayam trayaḥ lokāḥ trayaḥ vedāḥ trayaḥ marāḥ
translated: The three fires, the three worlds, the three Vedas, the three gods,

analyzed: kāla trayam tri sandhyam ca trayaḥ varṇāḥ tri śaktayaḥ  pādāt ūrdhvam kaṭim yāvat tāvat brahyā adhitiṣṭhati
translated: The three times, the three junctions, the three castes, and the three powers -🔽From the feet upwards to the waist, Brahma presides over that much of the human body.

analyzed: grīvām yāvat hariḥ nābheḥ śarīre manujasya ca
translated: Up to the neck, Vishnu presides over the body from the navel.

analyzed: mastake tiṣṭhati īśānaḥ vyakta avyaktaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: Maheshvara, the manifest and unmanifest Lord, resides in the head.

analyzed: eka mūrteḥ trayaḥ bhāgāḥ brahmā viṣṇu ha īśvarāḥ
translated: The three parts of the single-formed one are Brahma, Vishnu, and Ishvara.

analyzed: aham prāṇaḥ śarīra sthaḥ bhūta grāma catuṣṭaye
translated: I am the life-breath residing in the body, in the group of four elements.

analyzed: dharma adharme matim dadyāt sukha duḥkhe kṛta akṛte
translated: I give the mind to virtue and vice, and happiness and sorrow to what is done and not done.

analyzed: jantoḥ vuddhim samāsthāya pūrva marma adhivāsitām
translated: Relying on the mind of a living being, which has been dwelling in the body since before,

analyzed: aham eva tathā jīvān prerayāmi ca karmasu  svargam ca narakam mokṣam prayānti prāṇinaḥ dhruvam

analyzed: svarga stham naraka stham vā śrāddhe vā āpyāyanam bhavet
translated: Whether one is in heaven or hell, one should perform the ancestral offering.

analyzed: tasmāt śrāddhāni kurvīta trividhāni vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, the wise one should perform three types of Śrāddha rites.

original: matsyaṃ karmaṃ ca vārāhaṃ nārasiṃhañca vāmanam /
analyzed: matsyam karmam ca vārāham nārasiṃham ca vāmanam
translated: The Matsya, Kūrma, Varāha, Narasiṃha, Vāmana,

analyzed: rāmam rāmam ca kṛṣṇam ca buddham ca eva sa kalkinam
translated: Rāma, Rāma, Kṛṣṇa, Buddha, and Kalki,

original: etāni daśa nāmāni smartavyāni sadā budhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: etāni daśa nāmāni smartavyāni sadā budhaiḥ
translated: These ten names should always be remembered by the wise.

analyzed: svargam jīvāḥ sukham yānti cyutāḥ svargāt ca mānavāḥ
translated: The living ones go to heaven and after falling from heaven,

analyzed: labdhvā sukham ca vittam ca dayā dākṣiṇya saṃyutāḥ
translated: Having obtained happiness and wealth, endowed with compassion and generosity,

analyzed: putra pautraiḥ dhanaiḥ āḍhyāḥ jīveyuḥ śaradām śatam
translated: Rich with sons, grandsons, and wealth, they should live for a hundred autumns.

analyzed: āture ca dadet dānam viṣṇu pūjām ca kārayet
translated: And when one is sick, one should give gifts and perform the worship of Viṣṇu.

analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaram tathā mantram japet vā dvādaśa akṣaram
translated: And one should recite the eight-syllabled mantra or the twelve-syllabled mantra.

analyzed: pūjayet śukla puṣpaiḥ ca naivedyaiḥ ghṛta pācitaiḥ
translated: One should worship with white flowers and food offerings cooked with ghee,

analyzed: tathā gandhaiḥ ca dhūpaiḥ ca śruti smṛti manūditaiḥ
translated: And also with fragrances and incense as prescribed in the Vedas and Smṛtis.

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ mātā pitā viṣṇuḥ viṣṇuḥ sva jana bāndhavāḥ
translated: Viṣṇu is the mother, Viṣṇu is the father, Viṣṇu is the kinsmen and relatives,

analyzed: yatra viṣṇum na paśyāmi tena vāsena kim mama
translated: Where I do not see Viṣṇu, what is the use of living there?

analyzed: jale viṣṇuḥ sthale viṣṇuḥ viṣṇuḥ parvata mastake
translated: Vishnu is in water, Vishnu is on land, Vishnu is on the top of the mountain,

analyzed: jvālā mālā kule viṣṇuḥ sarvam viṣṇu mayam jagat
translated: Vishnu is in the midst of a garland of flames, the entire world is full of Vishnu.

original: vayamāpo vayaṃ pṛthvī vayaṃ darbhā vayaṃ tilāḥ /
analyzed: vayam āpaḥ vayam pṛthvī vayam darbhāḥ vayam tilāḥ
translated: We are water, we are earth, we are darbha grass, we are sesamum seeds,

original: vayaṃ gāvo vayaṃ rājā vayaṃ vāyurvayaṃ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vayam gāvaḥ vayam rājā vayam vāyuḥ vayam prajāḥ
translated: We are cows, we are the king, we are the wind, we are the people.

original: vayaṃ hema vayaṃ dhānyaṃ vayaṃ madhu vayaṃ ghṛtam /
analyzed: vayam hema vayam dhānyam vayam madhu vayam ghṛtam
translated: We are gold, we are grain, we are honey, we are ghee,

original: vayaṃ viprā vayaṃ devā vayaṃ śambhuśca bhūrbhuvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vayam viprāḥ vayam devāḥ vayam śambhuḥ ca bhūḥ bhuvaḥ
translated: We are Brahmins, we are gods, we are Shambhu, we are earth, we are the atmosphere.

original: ahaṃ dātā ahaṃ grāhī ahaṃ yajvā ahaṃ kratuḥ /
analyzed: aham dātā aham grāhī aham yajvā aham kratuḥ
translated: I am the giver, I am the receiver, I am the performer of sacrifices, I am the sacrifice,

original: ahaṃ hartā ahaṃ dharmo ahaṃ pṛthvī hyahaṃ jalam // / / //
analyzed: aham hartā aham dharmaḥ aham pṛthvī hi aham jalam
translated: I am the destroyer, I am Dharma, I am earth, I am water.

analyzed: dharma adharme matim dadyām karmabhiḥ tu śubha aśubhaiḥ
translated: I give the idea of Dharma and Adharma through auspicious and inauspicious actions.

original: yat karma kriyate kvāpi pūrvajanmārjitaṃ khaga // / / //
analyzed: yat karma kriyate kvāpi pūrva janma arjitam khaga
translated: Whatever action is done anywhere, O bird, is earned in previous births.

analyzed: dharme matim aham dadyām adharme pi aham eva ca
translated: I give the idea of Dharma and also of Adharma.

original: yātanāṃ kurute so 'pi dharme muktiṃ dadāmyaham // / / //
analyzed: yātanām kurute dharme muktim dadāmi aham
translated: He who inflicts punishment, I give liberation in Dharma.

original: manujānāṃ hitā tārkṣya ante vaitaraṇī smṛtā /
analyzed: manujānām hitā tārkṣya ante vaitaraṇī smṛtā
translated: O Garuda, Vaitarani is remembered as beneficial to humans in the end.

original: tayāvamatya pāpaughaṃ viṣṇulokaṃ sa gacchati // / / //🔽bālatve yacca kaumāre yacca pariṇatau ca yat /
analyzed: tayā avamatya pāpa ogham viṣṇu lokam sa gacchati  bāla tve yat ca kaumāre yat ca pariṇatau ca yat
translated: By that, he disregards the flood of sins and goes to Vishnu's world.🔽Whatever sins are committed in childhood, youth, and old age,

original: sarvāvamthākṛtaṃ pāpaṃ yacca janmāntareṣvapi // / / //🔽yanniśāyāṃ tathā prātaryanmadhyāhnāparāhnayoḥ /
analyzed: sarva avamthā kṛtam pāpam yat ca janmāntareṣu api  yat niśāyām tathā prātar yat madhyāhna aparāhnayoḥ
translated: And in all the stages of life, and even in other births,🔽Whatever deeds are done at night, in the morning, at midday, in the afternoon,

original: sandhyayoryat kṛtaṃ karma karmaṇā manasā girā // / / //
analyzed: sandhyayoḥ yat kṛtam karma karmaṇā manasā girā
translated: In the two twilights, by action, thought, or word,

analyzed: dattvā varām sakṛt api kapilām sarva kāmikām
translated: By giving just once the tawny cow, which fulfills all desires,

original: uddharedantakāle sa ātmānaṃ pāpasañcayāt // / / //🔽gāvo mamāgrataḥ santu pṛṣṭhataḥ pārśvatastathā /
analyzed: uddharet antakāle saḥ ātmānam pāpa sañcayāt  gāvaḥ mama agratas santu pṛṣṭhatas pārśvatas tathā
translated: One would uplift oneself from the heap of sins at the time of death.🔽May cows be in front of me, behind me, and on both sides.

original: gāvo me hṛdaye santu gavāṃ madhye vasāmyaham // / / //
analyzed: gāvaḥ me hṛdaye santu gavām madhye vasāmi aham
translated: May cows be in my heart; I dwell amidst cows.

original: yā lakṣmīḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ yā ca deve vyavasthitā /
analyzed: yā lakṣmīḥ sarva bhūtānām yā ca deve vyavasthitā
translated: May that Goddess Lakshmi who resides in all beings and in the gods,

original: dhenurūpeṇa sā devī mama pāpaṃ vyapohatu // / / //
analyzed: dhenu rūpeṇa sā devī mama pāpam vyapohatu
translated: In the form of a cow, remove my sins.🔽Thus ends the thirty-first chapter in the Uttarakhṇḍa of the Skanda Purāṇa, in which is described the enumeration of various gifts.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe dvitīyāṃśe dharmakāṇḍe pretakalpe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde nānādānanirūpaṇaṃ nāma triṃso 'dhyāyaḥ🔽śrīgaruḍamahāpurāṇam
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe dvitīya aṃśe dharma kāṇḍe pretakalpe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde nānādānanirūpaṇam nāma triṃsaḥ dhyāyaḥ 🔽śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Śrī Garuḍa Mahāpurāṇa

analyzed: śrī viṣṇuḥ uvāca
translated: Lord Vishnu said:

analyzed: ye narāḥ pāpa saṃyuktāḥ te gacchanti yama ālayam
translated: Those men who are full of sin go to Yama's abode.

analyzed: nṛṇām mad sākṣikam dattam ananta phala dam bhavet
translated: The gift made in my presence by men would give infinite fruits.

analyzed: yāvat rajaḥ pramāṇa abdam svarge tiṣṭhati bhūmi daḥ
translated: The giver of land stays in heaven for as many years as there are particles of dust on the land given.

original: aśvārūḍhāśca te yānti dadate ye hyupānahau // / / //
analyzed: aśva ārūḍhāḥ ca te yānti dadate ye hi upānahau
translated: Those who give footwear go riding on horses.

original: ātape śramayogena na dahyante ca kutracit /
analyzed: ātape śrama yogena na dahyante ca kutracid
translated: They are never burnt anywhere by the heat of exertion.

original: chattradānena vai pretā vicaranti sukhaṃ pathi // / / //
analyzed: chattra dānena vai pretāḥ vicaranti sukham pathi
translated: The ghosts move happily on the path by the gift of an umbrella.

analyzed: yam uddiśya dadāti annam tena ca āpyāyitaḥ bhavet
translated: One is nourished by the person for whom food is given.

analyzed: andhakāre mahā ghore amūrte lakṣya varjite
translated: In the great darkness, which is formless and devoid of any visible object,

analyzed: uddyotena eva te yānti dīpa dānena mānavāḥ
translated: men go by the light of a lamp by the gift of a lamp.

analyzed: āśvine kartike vā api māghe mṛta tithau api
translated: In the months of Ashvina, Kartika, or Magha, on the day of death,

original: caturdaśyāñca dīyeta dīpadānaṃ sukhāya vai // / / //🔽pratyahañca pradātavyaṃ mārge suviṣame naraiḥ /
analyzed: caturdaśyām ca dīyeta dīpa dānam sukhāya vai  pratyaham ca pradātavyam mārge su viṣame naraiḥ
translated: or on the fourteenth day, the gift of a lamp should be given for happiness.🔽And the gift should be given daily on a difficult path

analyzed: yāvat saṃvatsaram vā api pretasya sukha lipsayā
translated: for a year or so, with a desire for the happiness of the ghost.

original: kule dyotati śuddhātmā prakāśatvaṃ sa gacchati /
analyzed: kule dyotati śuddha ātmā prakāśa tvam sa gacchati
translated: The pure soul shines in the family and attains illumination.
He who gives a lamp is full of light, he is to be worshipped.

analyzed: prāc mukha udak mukham dīpam devāgāre dvijātaye
translated: The lamp should be placed facing east or north in the temple of the deity, and given to a Brahmin.

analyzed: kuryāt yāmya mukham pitre adbhiḥ saṅkalpya su sthiram
translated: Facing south, it should be offered to the ancestors, consecrated with water, and kept steady.

analyzed: sarva upahāra yuktāni padāni atra trayodaśa
translated: Here, thirteen steps are endowed with all offerings.

analyzed: yaḥ dadāti mṛtasya iha jīvan api ātma hetave
translated: He who gives this for the sake of the deceased, or even for his own sake while alive,

analyzed: sa gacchati mahā mārge mahā kaṣṭa vivarjitaḥ
translated: goes on the great path, free from great hardship.

analyzed: āsanam bhājanam bhojyam dīyate yat dvijāyate
translated: If a seat, vessel, or food is given to a Brahmin,

original: sukhe na bhuñjamānastu dena gacchatyalaṃ pathi // / / //
analyzed: sukhe na bhuñjamānaḥ tu gacchati alam pathi
translated: the giver, not the enjoyer, goes happily on the path.

analyzed: kamaṇḍalu pradānena tṛṣitaḥ pibate jalam
translated: By the gift of a water pot, the thirsty one drinks water.

analyzed: bhājanam vastra dānam ca kusumam ca aṅgulīyakam
translated: A vessel, cloth, flower, and ring,

analyzed: dātavyam preta uddharaṇa hetave
translated: these eleven should be given for the liberation of the departed.

analyzed: trayodaśa padāni ittham pretasya śubham icchatā
translated: Thus, thirteen steps should be given by one desiring the well-being of the departed.

analyzed: dātavyāni yathāśaktyā pretaḥ sau prīṇitaḥ bhavet
translated: They should be given according to one's ability, and the departed one would be satisfied.

analyzed: tilān ca eva uda kumbhān trayodaśa
translated: Thirteen water pots, along with food and sesame seeds,

original: mudrikāṃ vastrayugmañca tayā yāti parāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: mudrikām vastra yugmam ca tayā yāti parām gatim
translated: By giving a ring and a pair of garments, he attains the highest state.

original: yo 'śvaṃ nāvaṃ gajaṃ vāpi brāhmaṇe pratipādayet /
analyzed: yaḥ śvam nāvam gajam vā api brāhmaṇe pratipādayet
translated: One who offers a horse, a boat, or an elephant to a Brahmin,

analyzed: sa mahimnaḥ nusāreṇa tat tat sukham upāśnute
translated: Enjoys that corresponding happiness according to his greatness.

analyzed: nānā lokān vicarati mahiṣīn ca dadāti yaḥ
translated: One who moves through various worlds and gives a she-buffalo,

analyzed: yamaputtrasya yā mātā mahiṣī sugati pradā
translated: The mother of Yama's son, a she-buffalo, is the giver of good fortune.

analyzed: tāmbūlam kusumam deyam yāmyānām harṣa vardhanam
translated: Betel nut and flowers should be given, which increase the delight of Yama's followers.

original: tena samprīṇitāḥ sarve tasmin kleśaṃ na kurvate // / / //
analyzed: tena samprīṇitāḥ sarve tasmin kleśam na kurvate
translated: Being pleased by that, all of them do not cause him any trouble.

analyzed: go bhū tila hiraṇyāni dānāni āhuḥ sva śaktitaḥ
translated: Cows, land, sesame seeds, and gold are said to be gifts according to one's ability.

analyzed: mṛta uddeśena yaḥ yat yāt jala pātram ca mṛd mayam
translated: One who performs a sacrifice for the sake of the deceased and gives a water pot made of clay,

analyzed: udapātra sahasrasya phalam āpnoti mānavaḥ
translated: That man obtains the fruit of a thousand water pots.

analyzed: yama dūtāḥ mahā raudrāḥ karālāḥ kṛṣṇa piṅgalāḥ
translated: The messengers of Yama, who are extremely fierce, terrible, dark, and tawny,

original: na bhīṣayanti taṃ yāmyā vastradāne kṛte sati // / / //
analyzed: na bhīṣayanti tam yāmyāḥ vastra dāne kṛte sati
translated: Do not frighten him when the gift of cloth is made.

analyzed: mārge hi gacchamānaḥ tu tṛṣṇā ārtaḥ śrama pīḍitaḥ
translated: While traveling on the road, being thirsty and afflicted by fatigue,

analyzed: ghaṭa anna dāna yogena sukhī bhavati niścitam
translated: By the gift of a pot of food, he certainly becomes happy.

analyzed: śayyā dakṣiṇayā yuktā āyudha ambara saṃyutā
translated: A bed along with Dakshina, weapons and garments,

analyzed: haimaśrīpatinā yuktā deyā viprāya śarmaṇe
translated: and a golden image of Shrihari should be given to a Brahmin for peace.

original: tathā pretatvamukto 'sau modate saha daivataiḥ // / / //🔽etat te kathitaṃ tārkṣya dānamantyeṣṭikarmajam /
analyzed: tathā preta tva muktaḥ sau modate saha daivataiḥ  etat te kathitam tārkṣya dānam antyeṣṭi karma jam
translated: Thus, he becomes liberated from the state of a ghost and rejoices with the gods.🔽O Tarkshya, this has been told to you - the gift and the funeral rites.

analyzed: adhunā kathayiṣye hamanya deha praveśanam
translated: Now I will tell you about the entry into another body.

original: jātasya mṛtyuloke vai prāṇino maraṇaṃ dhruvam /
analyzed: jātasya mṛtyu loke vai prāṇinaḥ maraṇam dhruvam
translated: For a living being born in the world of death, death is certain.

analyzed: mṛtiḥ kuryāt svadharmeṇa yāsyataḥ ca parantapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies, death should be performed according to one's own dharma for one who is passing away.

analyzed: pūrva kāle mṛtānām ca prāṇinām ca khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, for living beings who die in the past,

analyzed: sūkṣmaḥ bhūtvā tu asau vāyuḥ nirgacchati āsya maṇḍalāt
translated: that subtle air leaves through the mouth.

analyzed: nava dvāraiḥ romabhiḥ ca janānām tālurandhrake
translated: Through the nine doors and the pores of the body, in the palate of people,

analyzed: pāpiṣṭhānām apānena jīvaḥ niṣkrāmati dhruvam
translated: the life force certainly exits through the exhalation of the most sinful.

original: śarīrañca patet paścānnirgate marutīśvare /🔽vātāhataḥ patatyeva nirādhāro yathā drumaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śarīram ca patet paścāt nirgate maruti īśvare  vāta āhataḥ patati eva nirādhāraḥ yathā drumaḥ
translated: And the body falls down after the lord of the winds has left.🔽Like a tree without support falls when struck by the wind.

original: pṛthivyāṃ līyate pṛthvī āpaścaiva tathāpsu ca /
analyzed: pṛthivyām līyate pṛthvī āpaḥ ca eva tathā apsu ca
translated: The earth dissolves into the earth, and the water into the water.

analyzed: tejaḥ tejasi līyate samīraṇaḥ samīraṇe
translated: Fire dissolves into fire, wind into wind,

original: ākāśe ca tathā kāśaḥ sarvavyāpī ca śaṅkare // / / //
analyzed: ākāśe ca tathā kāśaḥ sarvavyāpī ca śaṅkare
translated: and space into space, all-pervading in Śaṅkara.

original: tatra kāmastathā krodhaḥ kāye pañcendriyāṇi ca /
analyzed: tatra kāmaḥ tathā krodhaḥ kāye pañca indriyāṇi ca
translated: There, desire and anger, and the five senses in the body,

original: ete tārkṣya samākhyātā dehe tiṣṭhanti taskarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ete tārkṣya samākhyātāḥ dehe tiṣṭhanti taskarāḥ
translated: these, O Garuḍa, are said to be thieves residing in the body.

analyzed: kāmaḥ krodhaḥ hi ahaṅkāraḥ manaḥ tatra eva nāyakaḥ
translated: Desire, anger, ego, and the mind are the leaders there,

analyzed: saṃhārakaḥ ca kālaḥ yam puṇya pāpa samanvitaḥ
translated: and this time of dissolution is endowed with merit and sin.

analyzed: jagataḥ ca sva rūpam tu nirmitam svena karmaṇā
translated: And the nature of the world is created by one's own actions,

analyzed: punar deha antaram yāti sukṛtaiḥ duṣkṛtaiḥ naraḥ
translated: a man goes again to another body through good and bad deeds.

analyzed: pañca indriya samāyuktam sakalaiḥ viṣyaiḥ saha
translated: Endowed with the five senses, along with all the elements,

original: praviśet sa navaṃ dehaṃ gṛhe dagdhe yathā gṛhī // / / //
analyzed: praviśet sa navam deham gṛhe dagdhe yathā gṛhī
translated: he would enter a new body, like a householder whose house has been burnt.

analyzed: śarīre ye samāsīnā sambhavet sarva dhātavaḥ
translated: The elements that exist in the body

original: ṣāṭkauśiko hyayaṃ kāyo mātā pitrośca dhātavaḥ // / / //🔽sambhaveyustathā tārkṣya sarve vātāśca dehinām /
analyzed: ṣāṭkauśikaḥ hi ayam kāyaḥ mātā pitroḥ ca dhātavaḥ  sambhaveyuḥ tathā tārkṣya sarve vātāḥ ca dehinām
translated: are the six constituents of this body, the elements of the mother and father.🔽In the same way, O Garuḍa, all the winds of embodied beings

original: mūtraṃ purīṣaṃ tadyogā ye cānye vyādhayastathā // / / //
analyzed: mūtram purīṣam tad yogāḥ ye ca anye vyādhayaḥ tathā
translated: would come into existence, along with urine, feces, and other diseases.

original: asthi śukraṃ tathā snāyuḥ dehena saha dahyate /
analyzed: asthi śukram tathā snāyuḥ dehena saha dahyate
translated: Bones, semen, and sinews are burned along with the body.

analyzed: eṣa te kathitaḥ tārkṣya vināśaḥ sarva dehinām
translated: O Garuḍa, this destruction of all embodied beings has been told to you.

original: kathayāmi punasteṣāṃ śarīrañca yathā bhavet /🔽ekastambhaṃ snāyubaddhaṃ sthūṇādvayasamuddhṛtam // / / //
analyzed: kathayāmi punar teṣām śarīrañca yathā bhavet  eka stambham snāyu baddham sthūṇā dvaya samuddhṛtam
translated: I shall again tell you how their bodies come to be.🔽The body is like a single-pillared building, bound by sinews, raised by two beams,

original: indriyaiśca samāyuktaṃ navadvāraṃ śarīrakam /🔽viṣayaiśca samākrāntaṃ kāmakrodhasamākulam // / / //🔽rāgadveṣasamākīrṇaṃ tṛṣṇādurgasudustaram /
analyzed: indriyaiḥ ca samāyuktam nava dvāram śarīrakam  viṣayaiḥ ca samākrāntam kāma krodha samākulam  rāga dveṣa samākīrṇam tṛṣṇā durga su dustaram
translated: Endowed with the senses, having nine doors,🔽Seized by the objects of sense, agitated by desire and anger,🔽Filled with attachment and aversion, with a fortress of craving very difficult to cross,

analyzed: lobha jāla samāyuktam puram puruṣa saṃjñitam
translated: United with the net of greed, the city called the body,

analyzed: etat guṇa samāyuktam śarīram sarva dehinām
translated: This body of all embodied beings is endowed with these qualities.

analyzed: tiṣṭhanti devatāḥ sarvāḥ bhuvanāni caturdaśa
translated: All the gods and the fourteen worlds

original: ātmānaṃ ye na jānanti te narāḥ paśavaḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ātmānam ye na jānanti te narāḥ paśavaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Those men who do not know the Self, they are considered to be animals.

analyzed: evam etat mayā ākhyātam śarīram te caturvidham
translated: Thus this fourfold body has been explained to you.

analyzed: caturaśīti lakṣāṇi nirmitāḥ yonayaḥ purā
translated: Eighty-four lakhs of wombs were created in the past,

analyzed: udbhid jāḥ sveda jāḥ ca eva aṇḍa jāḥ ca jarāyu jāḥ
translated: Born from wombs, born from sweat, born from eggs, and born from wombs.

analyzed: etat te sarvam ākhyātam yat pṛṣṭaḥ aham tvayā anagha
translated: I have thus told you everything that you asked me, O sinless one.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe dvitīyāṃśe pretakalpe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde dānapha lānyadehapraveśādinirūpaṇaṃ nāmai katriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe dvitīya aṃśe pretakalpe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde dānapha lānyadehapraveśādinirūpaṇam nāma e katriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Thirty-first Chapter, in the Second Part, of the Pretakalpa in the Uttara-Khanda of the Skanda-Purana, dealing with the fruits of gifts and the entry of the soul into another body, etc.

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: The Glorious Garuda Mahapurana

analyzed: tārkṣyaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

analyzed: katham utpadyate jantuḥ bhūta grāme caturvidhe
translated: How is a living being born in the four types of living beings?

original: tvacā raktaṃ tathā māṃsaṃ medo majjāsthi jīvitam // / / //
analyzed: tvacā raktam tathā māṃsam medaḥ majja asthi jīvitam
translated: Skin, blood, flesh, fat, marrow, bones, and life...

original: pādau pāṇī tathā guhyaṃ jihvākeśanakhāḥ śiraḥ /
analyzed: pādau pāṇī tathā guhyam jihvā keśa nakhāḥ śiraḥ
translated: Feet, hands, genitals, tongue, hair, nails, and head.

analyzed: sandhi mārgāḥ ca bahuśas rekhāḥ nā ekavidhāḥ tathā
translated: Many joint paths and lines of various kinds...

original: kāmaḥ krodho bhayaṃ lajjā mano harṣaḥ sukhāsukham /
analyzed: kāmaḥ krodhaḥ bhayam lajjā manaḥ harṣaḥ sukha asukham
translated: Desire, anger, fear, shame, mind, joy, pleasure and pain.

analyzed: citritam chidritam ca api nānā jālena veṣṭitam
translated: Painted, perforated, and wrapped in various nets...

analyzed: indrajālam idam manye saṃsāre sāra sāgare
translated: I consider this to be a magic show in the insubstantial ocean of worldly existence.

analyzed: tāvat na ālokyate vaktram pāpam yāvat vapuḥ sthitam

analyzed: prathame hani cāṇḍālī dvitīye brahma ghātinī

translated: The sixteen nights of a woman's menstrual cycle are generally considered suitable for conception.

analyzed: yā caturdaśamī rātriḥ garbhaḥ tiṣṭhati tatra ced

analyzed: prāyaśas sambhavati atra garbhaḥ tu aṣṭa aha madhyatas

analyzed: tasmin uptvā naraḥ svāmī samyak phalam avāpnuyāt

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca eva ātapaḥ varjya śītalam kevalam caret

analyzed: niṣeka samaye yādṛś nara citta vikalpanā
translated: The mental fluctuations of a man at the time of conception,

analyzed: tādṛś svabhāva sambhūtiḥ jantuḥ viśati kukṣi gaḥ  śukra soṇita saṃyoge piṇḍa utpattiḥ prajāyate
translated: The fetus, born of such a nature, enters the womb.🔽In the union of semen and blood, the formation of the embryo takes place.

analyzed: vardhate jaṭhare jantuḥ tārāpatiḥ iva ambare

analyzed: caitanyam bīja rūpam hi śukre nityam vyavasthitam
translated: Consciousness, in the form of a seed, is always present in the semen.

analyzed: kāmaḥ cittam ca śukram ca yadā hi eka tvam āpnuyuḥ
translated: When semen, mind, and desire become one,

analyzed: tadā drāvam avāpnoti yoṣā garbhāśaye naraḥ  rakta ādhikye bhavet nārī śukra ādhikye bhavet pumān

analyzed: śukra soṇitayoḥ sāmye garbhāḥ ṣaṇḍa tvam āpnuyuḥ
translated: If blood and semen are equal, the fetus becomes a eunuch.

analyzed: pañcaviṃśatime ca ahni balam puṣṭiḥ ca jāyate

original: tathā māse tu sampūrṇe pañcatattvaṃ nidhārayet // / / //
analyzed: tathā māse tu sampūrṇe pañcatattvam nidhārayet

analyzed: majja asthīni tribhiḥ māsaiḥ keśa aṅgulyaḥ caturthake

analyzed: aṅga pratyaṅga sampūrṇaḥ garbhaḥ māsaiḥ atha aṣṭabhiḥ

analyzed: navame māsi samprāpte garbha stha ojau dṛḍham bhavet

analyzed: cikitsā jāyate tasya garbha vāsa parikṣaye

analyzed: pañca indriya samopetam daśa nāḍī vibhūṣitam

analyzed: navame daśame māsi jāyate pāñcabhautikaḥ

analyzed: sūtivātaiḥ samākṛṣṭaḥ pīḍayā vihvalīkṛtaḥ
translated: Pulled by the winds of birth, afflicted by pain,

analyzed: puṣṭaḥ nāḍyāḥ suṣumṇāyāḥ yoṣit garbha sthitaḥ tvaran

analyzed: ebhiḥ bhūtaiḥ pīḍitaḥ tu nibaddhaḥ snāyu bandhanaiḥ
translated: afflicted by these elements, bound by the bonds of sinews,

analyzed: kevalam bhuktam annam ca puṣṭi dam sarva dehinām

analyzed: nayate prāṇa daḥ vāyuḥ śarīre sarva sandhiṣu

analyzed: palāni daśa medaḥ ca tvacā ca eva tu tad samā

The marrow is twelve palas, and the great blood is three palas.

translated: The semen should be known as two kudavas, and the blood is remembered as one kudava.

analyzed: śleṣmāṇaḥ ca ṣaṭ ūrdhvan ca viṣ mūtram tad pramāṇataḥ

analyzed: asthnām hi hi adhikam proktam ṣaṣṭi uttara śata trayāt

analyzed: evam piṇḍaḥ samākhyātaḥ vaibhavam sampracakṣmahe
translated: Thus the body is described. Now we shall describe the glory.

analyzed: tale tu karayoḥ nyasya vardhate jānu pārśvayoḥ

analyzed: aṅguṣṭhau ca upari nyastau kara aṅgulī

analyzed: taiḥ āpyāyita dehaḥ sau jantuḥ vṛddhim upaiti ca

analyzed: tatas nirvedam āyāti pīḍyamānaḥ itas tatas
translated: Then, being afflicted here and there, he becomes indifferent.

analyzed: punar nā evam kariṣyāmi bhukta mātraḥ iha udarāt
translated: After eating, he thinks, I will not do this again in this belly.

analyzed: tathā tathā yatiṣyāmi garbham na āpnomi aham yathā
translated: I will strive in such and such a way that I do not obtain a womb.

analyzed: iti sañcintayan jīvaḥ smṛtvā janma śatāni vai
translated: Thinking thus, the living being remembers hundreds of births,

analyzed: yāni pūrva anubhūtāni deva bhūta ātmajāni vai
translated: which were previously experienced as divine, human, and animal births.

analyzed: tatas kāla kramāt jantuḥ parivartyatu adhomukhaḥ
translated: Then, in due course, the creature turns upside down,

original: navame daśame vāpi māsi saṃjāyate tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: navame daśame vā api māsi saṃjāyate tatas
translated: In the ninth or tenth month, it is then born.

analyzed: niṣkramyamāṇaḥ vātena prājāpatyena pīḍyate
translated: When coming out, it is afflicted by the wind of Prajapati.

analyzed: niṣkramate ca vilapan tadā duḥkha nipīḍitaḥ  niṣkrāman ca udarāt mūrchām asahyām pratipadyate
translated: And it comes out crying, then afflicted by pain.🔽And coming out of the womb, it attains unbearable fainting.

analyzed: prāpnoti cetanām ca asau vāyu sparśa sukha anvitaḥ
translated: And it regains consciousness, endowed with the pleasure of the touch of air.

original: tatastaṃ vaiṣṇavī māyā samāskandati mohinī /🔽tayā vimohitātmāsau jñānabhraṃśamavāpnute // / / //
analyzed: tatas tam vaiṣṇavī māyā samāskandati mohinī  tayā vimohita ātmā asau jñāna bhraṃśam avāpnute
translated: Then that deluding illusion of Vishnu overwhelms it.🔽With its self deluded by that, it attains the loss of knowledge.

analyzed: bhraṣṭa jñānam bāla bhāve tatas jantuḥ prapadyate
translated: Then the creature attains the state of infancy, with its knowledge lost.

analyzed: tatas kaumāraka avasthām yauvanam vṛddha tām api
translated: Then the state of childhood, youth, and even old age.

analyzed: punar ca tadvat maraṇam janma prāpnoti mānavaḥ
translated: And then again, in the same way, death and birth, a man attains.

analyzed: tatas saṃsāra cakre smin bhrāmyate ghaṭa yantra vat
translated: Then it is whirled in this cycle of birth and death, like a potter's wheel.

analyzed: kadācid svargam āpnoti kadācid nirayam naraḥ
translated: Sometimes it attains heaven, sometimes hell, a man.

analyzed: svargam ca nirayam ca eva sva karma phalam aśnute
translated: And heaven and hell, it experiences the fruit of its own actions.

analyzed: kadācid bhukta karmā ca bhuvam su alpena gacchati
translated: Sometimes, one whose actions have been enjoyed goes to earth with little difficulty.

analyzed: svar loke narake ca eva bhukta prāye dvijottamāḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, when the enjoyments in heaven and hell are almost over,

analyzed: narakeṣu mahat duḥkham etat yat svarga vāsinaḥ
translated: In hell, there is great suffering for those residing in heaven.

analyzed: dṛśyate na atra modante pātyamānāḥ tu nārakaiḥ
translated: It is seen that they do not rejoice there, but are being thrown down by the denizens of hell.

analyzed: svarge duḥ kham atulam yad ārohaṇa kālataḥ
translated: Even in heaven, there is incomparable suffering, starting from the time of ascent.

analyzed: prabhṛti aham patiṣyāmi iti etat manasi vartate
translated: The thought that I will fall remains in the mind.

analyzed: nāra kān ca eva samprekṣya mahat duḥ kham avāpyate
translated: And seeing the denizens of hell, great suffering is obtained.

original: evaṃ gatimahaṃ gantetyaharniśamanirvṛtaḥ // / / //🔽garbhavāse mahadduḥ khaṃ jāyamānasya yonijam /
analyzed: evam gatim aham gantā iti aharniśam anirvṛtaḥ  garbha vāse mahat duḥ kham jāyamānasya yoni jam
translated: Thinking I will go to such a state, one is restless day and night.🔽There is great suffering in the womb, and in being born from the womb.

analyzed: jātasya bāla bhāve vṛddha tve duḥkham eva ca
translated: For one who is born, there is suffering even in childhood and in old age.

analyzed: kāma īrṣyā krodha sambandhāt yauvane pi ca duḥ saham
translated: Due to the connection with desire, envy, and anger, it is also unbearable in youth.

original: duḥsvapnaṃ yā vṛddhatā ca maraṇe duḥ khamutkaṭam // / / //
analyzed: duḥsvapnam yā vṛddha tā ca maraṇe duḥ kham utkaṭam
translated: Bad dreams, old age, and intense suffering at the time of death.

original: kṛṣyamāṇaśca yāmyaiḥ sa narake 'pi ca yātyadhaḥ /
analyzed: kṛṣyamāṇaḥ ca yāmyaiḥ sa narake ca yāti adhas
translated: And being dragged by the messengers of Yama, one goes down even into hell.

analyzed: punar ca garbhāt janma syāt maraṇam duṣkaram tathā
translated: And again, there is birth from the womb, and death is difficult in the same way.

analyzed: evam saṃsāra cakre smit jantavaḥ ghaṭa yantra vat
translated: Thus, in this cycle of birth and death, beings revolve like a potter's wheel.

analyzed: bhrāmyante prāktanaiḥ badhaiḥ baddhāḥ vidhyanti ca asakṛt
translated: They are whirled around by their own past actions, and are repeatedly pierced by them.

analyzed: na asti pakṣin sukham kiñcid kṣetre duḥ kha śata ākule
translated: O bird! There is no happiness at all in the field that is full of hundreds of miseries.

original: vinatāsuta mokṣāya yatitavyaṃ tato naraiḥ // / / //🔽etatte sarvamākhyātaṃ yathā garbhasya saṃsthitiḥ /
analyzed: vinatā suta mokṣāya yatitavyam tatas naraiḥ  etat te sarvam ākhyātam yathā garbhasya saṃsthitiḥ
translated: O son of Vinata! Therefore, men should strive for liberation.🔽I have told you all about how the embryo is situated.

original: kathayāmi kramapraśraṃ pṛṣṭaṃ vā vartate spṛhā // / / //
analyzed: kathayāmi kramapraśram pṛṣṭam vā vartate spṛhā
translated: I will tell you the sequence of questions asked, or if there is a desire for the third question, the answer should be given.

analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca
translated: Garuda said:

analyzed: madhye kṛta mahā praśra dvayasya āptam mayā uttaram
translated: I have received the answer to the two great questions asked in the middle.

analyzed: praśrasya api tṛtīyasya uttaram ca vidhīyatām
translated: Let the answer to the third question also be given.

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Krishna said:

analyzed: mriyamāṇasya kim kṛtyam iti tvam pṛṣṭavān asi
translated: You have asked what should be done for one who is dying.

original: śṛṇu tatrottaraṃ tūktaṃ kathayāmi samāsataḥ // / / //🔽āsannamaraṇaṃ jñātvā puruṣaṃ snāpayettataḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇu tatra uttaram tu uktam kathayāmi samāsatas  āsanna maraṇam jñātvā puruṣam snāpayet tatas
translated: Listen to the answer given there, I will tell you in brief.

analyzed: go mūtra gomaya su mṛd tīrtha udaka kuśa udakaiḥ
translated: Knowing that a person is about to die, he should be bathed with cow's urine, cow dung, good clay, water from holy places, and water with kuśa grass.

original: vāsasī paridhāryātha dhaute tu śuci nī śubhe /
analyzed: vāsasī paridhārya atha dhaute tu śuci nī śubhe
translated: Then he should wear two washed and pure white garments.

analyzed: darbhāṇi ādau samāstīrya dakṣiṇa agrān vikīrya ca
translated: First spreading darbha grass, and scattering it with the tips pointing to the south,

analyzed: tilān gomaya liptāyām bhūmau tatra niveśayet
translated: One should place sesame seeds there on the ground smeared with cow dung.

original: prāgudakśirasaṃ vāpi mukhe svarṇaṃ viniḥ kṣepet /
analyzed: prāc udak śirasam vā api mukhe svarṇam kṣepet
translated: Or with the head towards the northeast, one should place gold in the mouth.

analyzed: śālagrāma śilā tatra tulasī ca khageśvara
translated: O lord of birds, there should be a Shalagrama stone and Tulasī plant.

analyzed: vidheyā sannidhau sarpiḥ dīpam prajvālayet punar
translated: One should light a ghee lamp nearby.

analyzed: namaḥ bhagavate vāsudevāya iti japaḥ tathā
translated: And one should chant the mantra Salutations to Lord Vāsudeva.

original: ādau tu praṇavaṃ kṛtvā pūjādāne tataḥ smṛte /
analyzed: ādau tu praṇavam kṛtvā pūjā dāne tatas smṛte
translated: At the beginning, having uttered the praṇava, then the worship and offering are remembered.

analyzed: samabhyarcya hṛṣīkeśam puṣpa dhūpa ādibhiḥ tatas
translated: Having thus worshipped Hṛṣīkeśa with flowers, incense, etc.,

analyzed: praṇipātaiḥ stavaiḥ puṇyaiḥ dhyā na yogena pūjayet
translated: One should worship with prostrations, auspicious praises, and meditation.

original: dattvā dānaṃ ca viprebhyo dīnānāthebhya eva ca // / / //
analyzed: dattvā dānam ca viprebhyaḥ dīna anāthebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: Having given gifts to the brahmins, the poor and the helpless,

analyzed: puttre mitre kalatre ca kṣetra dhānya dhana ādiṣu
translated: One should renounce attachment to sons, friends, wife, fields, grains, wealth, etc.

original: nivartayenmamatvaṃ ca viṣṇoḥ pādau hṛdi smaran // / / //
analyzed: nivartayet mamatvam ca viṣṇoḥ pādau hṛdi smaran
translated: Remembering Lord Viṣṇu's feet in the heart,

analyzed: uccais puruṣasūktam ca yadi śreṣṭhā padaḥ tadā
translated: If one is in a critical condition, one should loudly chant the Puruṣa Sūkta.

analyzed: puttra ādyāḥ prapaṭheyuḥ te mriyamāṇe nije jane
translated: Then one's sons and others should recite it when one's own people are dying.

analyzed: etat te sarvam ākhyātam kṛtyam mṛtyau upasthite
translated: This has been told to you completely, the duty when death is imminent.

analyzed: phalam api asya kṛtsnasya samāsāt te vadāmi aham
translated: I shall now tell you in brief the fruits of all these.

analyzed: snānena śuci tā prāptiḥ apāvitrya hṛtiḥ tatas
translated: Purity is attained through bathing, then the removal of impurity.

original: tato viṣṇoḥ smṛtistasya jñānātsarvaphalapradā // / / //🔽darbhatūlī nayetsvargamāturaṃ tu na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas viṣṇoḥ smṛtiḥ tasya jñānāt sarva phala pradā  darbha tūlī nayet svargam āturam tu na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Then the remembrance of Vishnu, which gives all fruits through knowledge.🔽There is no doubt that the dead person goes to heaven by the darbha grass spread on the ground.

original: tilairdarbhaiśca niḥ kṣiptaiḥ snānaṃ kratumayaṃ bhavet // / / //
analyzed: tilaiḥ darbhaiḥ ca niḥ kṣiptaiḥ snānam kratu mayam bhavet
translated: If tila and darbha are offered, the bath becomes equal to a sacrifice.

analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca śrīḥ hutāśaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Rudra, Lakshmi, and the sacrificial fire,

original: maṇḍale copatiṣṭhanti tasmātkurvīta maṇḍalam // / / //🔽prāgudagvā kṛteneha śirasā lokamuttamam /
analyzed: maṇḍale ca upatiṣṭhanti tasmāt kurvīta maṇḍalam  prāk udak vā kṛtena iha śirasā lokam uttamam
translated: all stand in the circle; therefore one should make a circle.🔽If a person dies facing east or north,

analyzed: vrajate yadi pāpasya alpa tvam puṃsaḥ bhavet khaga
translated: if the sin of the person is small, O bird,

original: pañcaratne mukhe mukte jive jñānaṃ prarohati /
analyzed: pañcaratne mukhe mukte jive jñānam prarohati
translated: if the five gems are released in the mouth, life grows in knowledge.

analyzed: tulasī brāhmaṇāḥ gāvaḥ viṣṇuḥ ekādaśī khaga
translated: Tulasi, Brahmanas, cows, Vishnu, and Ekadashi, O bird,

analyzed: pañca pravahaṇāni eva bhava abdhau majjatām nṛṇām
translated: are the five boats for men drowning in the ocean of worldly existence.

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ ekādaśī gītā tulasī vipra dhenavaḥ
translated: Vishnu, Ekadashi, the Gita, Tulasi, Brahmanas, and cows,
in this worthless and difficult worldly existence, the six-limbed devotion is the giver of happiness.

analyzed: namaḥ bhagavate vāsudevāya iti japan naraḥ
translated: One who recites Salutations to Lord Vāsudeva

analyzed: oṅkāra pūrvam sāyujyam prāpnuyāt na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that by reciting the Puruṣa Sūkta along with the syllable Om, one attains union with me.

analyzed: pūjayā api ca mad loka prāptiḥ ārāt divam vrajet
translated: By worship also, one attains my world and goes to heaven immediately.

analyzed: bandha abhāve mamatve tu jñānam puruṣasūktataḥ
translated: In the absence of bondage, by the knowledge from the Puruṣa Sūkta, one attains liberation.

analyzed: tu sādhaneṣu eṣu kāśyapa
translated: O Kaśyapa! One should understand that the fruit of whichever of these means is superior,

analyzed: tad tad phalasya api ādhikyam bhavati iti avadhāraya
translated: that fruit will be more abundant.

analyzed: dātavyāni yathāśaktyā prītaḥ sau sarvadā bhavet
translated: They should be given to the best of one's ability, for he is always pleased.

analyzed: etat te sarvam ākhyātam snāna ādiṣu phalam mayā
translated: I have told you all this about the fruits of bathing etc.

original: brahmāṇḍe ye guṇāḥ santi śarīre te vyavasthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmāṇḍe ye guṇāḥ santi śarīre te vyavasthitāḥ
translated: The qualities that exist in the universe are present in the body.

analyzed: pātāla bhūdharāḥ lokāḥ tathā anye dvīpa sāgarāḥ
translated: The nether worlds, mountains, and other regions, islands, and oceans,

original: ādityādigrahāḥ sarve piṇḍamadhye vyavasthitāḥ // / / //🔽pādādhastu talaṃ jñeyaṃ pādordhvaṃ vitalaṃ tathā /
analyzed: āditya ādi grahāḥ sarve piṇḍa madhye vyavasthitāḥ  pāda adhas tu talam jñeyam pāda ūrdhvam vitalam tathā
translated: all the planets beginning with the sun, are situated in the middle of the body.🔽The lower part should be known as the nether world, and the part above the feet as Vitala.

analyzed: jānubhyām sutalam viddhi sakthi deśe mahātalam
translated: Know the part above the knees as Sutala, and the region of the thighs as Mahatala.

analyzed: tathā guhya deśe rasātalam
translated: Similarly, Talātala is in the hips, and Rasātala is in the genital region.

analyzed: pātālam kaṭi saṃstham tu pāda ādau lakṣayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should consider the nether world to be in the hips, and the feet and so on.

analyzed: bhūrlokam nābhi madhye tu bhuvarlokam tad ūrdhvatas
translated: The earth world is in the navel, and above that is the world of the atmosphere.

analyzed: svarga lokam hṛdaye vidyāt kaṇṭha deśe mahar tathā
translated: One should know the heaven world to be in the heart, and in the region of the throat is the great world.

analyzed: janalokam vaktra deśe tapolokam lalāṭake
translated: The world of men is in the region of the face, and the world of austerities is on the forehead.

analyzed: satya lokam mahā randhre bhuvanāni caturdaśa
translated: The world of truth is in the great aperture, and the fourteen worlds are there.

original: trikoṇe saṃsthito meruradhaḥ koṇe ca mandaraḥ /
analyzed: trikoṇe saṃsthitaḥ meruḥ adhas koṇe ca mandaraḥ
translated: Meru is located in the triangle, and Mandara is in the lower corner.

analyzed: dakṣiṇe ca iva kailāsaḥ vāma bhāge himācalaḥ
translated: And on the right is Kailasa, and on the left is the Himalayas.

analyzed: niṣadhaḥ ca ūrdhva bhāge ca dakṣiṇe gandhamādanaḥ
translated: And on the upper part on the right is Gandhamadana,

analyzed: malayaḥ ramaṇaḥ
translated: and Malaya and Ramaṇa,

original: vāmarekhāyāṃ saptaite kulaparvatāḥ // / / //🔽asthisthāne sthito jambūḥ śāko majjāsu saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: vāma rekhāyām saptā ete kulaparvatāḥ  asthi sthāne sthitaḥ jambūḥ śākaḥ majjāsu saṃsthitaḥ
translated: these seven are the family mountains on the left line.🔽The rose apple tree is located in the place of bones, and the śāka tree is located in the marrow.

analyzed: kuśadvīpaḥ sthitaḥ māṃse krauñcadvīpaḥ śirā sthitaḥ
translated: The Kuśa continent is located in the flesh, and the Krauñca continent is located in the head.

original: tvacāyāṃ śālmalidvāpo plakṣaḥ romṇāṃ ca sañcaye /
analyzed: tvacāyām plakṣaḥ romṇām ca sañcaye
translated: The Śālmali continent is in the skin, and the Plakṣa tree is in the collection of body hair.

analyzed: nakha sthaḥ puṣkaradvīpaḥ sāgarāḥ tad anantaram
translated: The Puṣkara continent is in the nails, and after that are the oceans.

analyzed: kṣārodaḥ ca tathā mūtre kṣāre kṣīroda sāgaraḥ
translated: And the salt ocean is in the urine, and in the salt is the milk ocean.

analyzed: surā udadhiḥ ca śleṣma sthaḥ majjāyām ghṛta sāgaraḥ
translated: The ocean of phlegm is in the marrow, and the ocean of ghee is in the fat.

analyzed: rasa udadhim rase vidyāt śoṇite dadhi sagaram
translated: One should know the ocean of rasa in rasa, the ocean of curd in blood,

analyzed: svādulam lambikā sthāne garbhodam śukra saṃsthitam
translated: The ocean of sweet in the place of lambika, and the ocean of garbha in the place of semen.

original: nādacakre sthitaḥ sūryo binducakre ca candramāḥ /
analyzed: nādacakre sthitaḥ sūryaḥ binducakre ca candramāḥ
translated: The sun is located in the cakra of sound, and the moon in the cakra of bindu.

original: locanasthaḥ kujo jñeyo hṛdaye ca budhaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: locana sthaḥ kujaḥ jñeyaḥ hṛdaye ca budhaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Mars should be known to be located in the eyes, and Mercury is remembered to be in the heart.

analyzed: viṣṇu sthāne gurum vidyāt śrukre śukraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: One should know Jupiter to be in the place of Vishnu, and Venus is situated in semen.

original: nābhisthāne sthito mando mukhe rāhuḥ sthitaḥ sadā // / / //🔽pāyu da sthāne sthitaḥ ketuḥ śarīre grahamaṇḍalam /
analyzed: nābhi sthāne sthitaḥ mandaḥ mukhe rāhuḥ sthitaḥ sadā  pāyu da sthāne sthitaḥ ketuḥ śarīre graha maṇḍalam
translated: Saturn is located in the navel, and Rahu is always situated in the mouth.🔽Ketu is located in the place of the anus, and the circle of planets is in the body.

analyzed: vibhaktam ca samākhyātam āpādatalamastakam
translated: It is said to be divided from the soles of the feet to the head.

original: utpannā ye hi saṃsāre mriyante te na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: utpannāḥ ye hi saṃsāre mriyante te na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Those who are born in the world die, there is no doubt.

original: bubhukṣā ca tṛṣā raudrā dāhodbhūtā ca mūrchanā // / / //
analyzed: bubhukṣā ca tṛṣā raudrā dāha udbhūtā ca mūrchanā
translated: Hunger and thirst are terrible, and fainting caused by burning.

analyzed: yatra pīḍāḥ tu imāḥ raudrāḥ tāḥ vai vṛścika daṃśa jāḥ
translated: Where these terrible afflictions are, they are born from the bite of a scorpion.

analyzed: vināśaḥ pūrṇa kāle ca jāyate sarva dehinām
translated: Destruction occurs at the time of fullness for all embodied beings.

analyzed: agre agre hi dhāvanti
translated: For one who has gone to the world of Yama, they run ahead,

analyzed: tapta vāluka madhyena prajvalat vahni madhyataḥ
translated: In the midst of hot sand, in the midst of blazing fire.

analyzed: keśa grāhaiḥ samākrāntāḥ nīyante yama kiṅkaraiḥ
translated: They are seized by the hair and led by Yama's servants.

analyzed: pāpiṣṭhāḥ tu adhamāḥ tārkṣya dayā dharma vivirjitāḥ
translated: O Garuḍa, the most sinful, the lowest, devoid of the dharma of compassion,

original: yamaloke vasantyete kuṭyāṃ janma na vidyate /
analyzed: yama loke vasanti ete kuṭyām janma na vidyate
translated: They dwell in the world of Yama, there is no birth in a womb for them.

original: evaṃ sañjāyate tārkṣya martye jantuḥ svakarmabhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam sañjāyate tārkṣya martye jantuḥ sva karmabhiḥ
translated: Thus, O Garuḍa, a creature is born in the mortal world due to its own actions.

original: utpannā ye hi saṃsāre mriyante te na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: utpannāḥ ye hi saṃsāre mriyante te na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Those who are born in the world, they die, there is no doubt.

original: āyuḥ karma ca vittañca vidyā nidhanameva ca // / / //
analyzed: āyuḥ karma ca vittam ca vidyā nidhanam eva ca
translated: Life, action, wealth, knowledge, and death -

analyzed: pañca etāni hi sṛjyante garbha sthasya eva dehinaḥ
translated: These five are created even for the fetus in the womb.

analyzed: karmaṇā jāyate jantuḥ karmaṇā eva pralīyate
translated: A creature is born due to action, it is dissolved due to action alone.

original: sukhaṃ duḥ khaṃ bhayaṃ kṣemaṃ karmaṇaivābhipadyate /
analyzed: sukham duḥ kham bhayam kṣemam karmaṇā eva abhipadyate
translated: Happiness, sorrow, fear, and safety are obtained only through action.

original: adhomukhaṃ cordhvapādaṃ garbhādvāyuḥ prakarṣati // / / //🔽janmato vaiṣṇavī māyā saṃmohayati satvaram /
analyzed: adhomukham ca ūrdhva pādam garbhāt vāyuḥ prakarṣati  janmataḥ vaiṣṇavī māyā saṃmohayati satvaram
translated: The wind draws it out of the womb, face down and feet up.🔽From birth, Viṣṇu's Māyā quickly deludes.

analyzed: sva karma kṛta sambandhaḥ jantuḥ janma prapadyate
translated: A creature, bound by the relations created by its own actions, attains birth.

original: sukṛtāduttamo bhogabhogyavān sukule bhavet /🔽yathāyathā duṣkṛtaṃ tat kule hīne prajāyate // / / //
analyzed: sukṛtāt uttamaḥ bhoga bhogyavān su kule bhavet  yathā yathā duṣkṛtam tat kule hīne prajāyate
translated: One born in a good family enjoys the best pleasures due to good deeds.🔽As the bad deeds increase, one is born in a low family.

analyzed: sva jātyaiḥ para jātyaiḥ ca deyaḥ nadyām jala añjaliḥ
translated: The water offering should be made in the river by those of one's own caste and by those of other castes.

original: gantavyaṃ naiva vipreṇa dātuṃ śīghraṃ jalāñjalim /
analyzed: gantavyam nā eva vipreṇa dātum śīghram jala añjalim
translated: A brahmin should not return to offer the water libation quickly.

analyzed: nivṛttāḥ ca yadā nāryaḥ loka ācāraḥ sadā bhavet
translated: When women have returned, the conduct of the world should always be.

original: pañcatvañca gate śūdre yaḥ kāṣṭhaṃ nayate citām /
analyzed: pañcatvam ca gate śūdre yaḥ kāṣṭham nayate citām
translated: When a shudra has died and the funeral pyre is carried,

analyzed: anuvrajet yadā vipraḥ tri rātram aśuciḥ bhavet
translated: if a brahmin follows, he becomes impure for three nights.

original: trirātre ca tataḥ pūrṇe nadīṃ gacchet samudragām /
analyzed: tri rātre ca tatas pūrṇe nadīm gacchet samudra gām
translated: After three nights have passed, he should go to a river that flows into the ocean,

analyzed: prāṇāyāma śatam kṛtvā ghṛtam prāśya viśudhyati
translated: perform one hundred breath-control exercises, eat ghee, and becomes pure.

original: śūdro gacchati sarvatra vaiśyastriṣu dvayoḥ paraḥ /
analyzed: śūdraḥ gacchati sarvatra vaiśyaḥ triṣu dvayoḥ paraḥ
translated: A shudra can go everywhere, a vaishya in three, the next in two,

analyzed: gacchati svīya varṇeṣu dātum prete jala añjalim
translated: and a brahmin in his own caste, to offer the water libation to the deceased.

analyzed: datte jala añjalau paścāt vidadhyāt dantadhāvanam
translated: After offering the water libation, one should perform tooth-cleaning.

original: tyajanti gotriṇaḥ sarve dināni nava kāśyapa // / / //
analyzed: tyajanti gotriṇaḥ sarve dināni nava kāśyapa
translated: All the relatives should give up (their work) for nine days, Kashyapa.

analyzed: jala añjalim tathā dātum gacchanti dvijasattamāḥ
translated: The best of the twice-born go to offer the water libation.

original: yatra sthāne mṛto yastu adhvanyapi gṛhe 'pi vā /
analyzed: yatra sthāne mṛtaḥ yaḥ tu adhvani api gṛhe vā
translated: Wherever a person dies, on a journey or at home,

analyzed: viśleṣaḥ tu tatas sthānāt na kvacid vihitaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: But separation from that place is not ordained anywhere by the wise.

original: strījanaścāgrato gacchet pṛṣṭhato navasañcayaḥ /🔽ācamanaṃ vidhātavyaṃ pāṣāṇopari saṃsthitaiḥ // / / //🔽yavāṃśca sarṣapān dūrvāḥ pūrṇapātre vilokayet /
analyzed: strī janaḥ ca agratas gacchet pṛṣṭhatas nava sañcayaḥ  ācamanam vidhātavyam pāṣāṇa upari saṃsthitaiḥ  yavān ca sarṣapān dūrvāḥ pūrṇa pātre vilokayet
translated: The women should go in front, and the newly collected [ashes] should go behind.🔽Sipping water should be performed by those standing on a stone.🔽One should look at barley, mustard seeds, and durva grass in a filled vessel.

original: prāśayennimbapatrāṇi snehasnānaṃ samācaret // / / //🔽gotribhirna ca kartavyaṃ gṛhānnañca na bhojayet /
analyzed: prāśayet nimba patrāṇi sneha snānam samācaret  gotribhiḥ na ca kartavyam gṛha annam ca na bhojayet
translated: One should chew neem leaves and perform an oil bath.🔽It should not be done by relatives, and one should not eat food from home.

analyzed: bhuñjīta mṛd maye pātre uttānam ca vivarjayet
translated: One should eat from an earthen vessel and avoid lying on one's back.

analyzed: mṛtakasya guṇāḥ grāhyāḥ yama gāthām samudgiret
translated: The qualities of the deceased should be accepted, and one should recite the verses of Yama.

analyzed: śubha aśubhe ca dhyātavye pūrva karma upasañcite
translated: The good and bad [actions] accumulated from previous karma should be contemplated.

analyzed: labdhena eva ca dehena bhuṅkte sukṛta duṣkṛte
translated: One experiences the good and bad [actions] with the very body that was obtained.

analyzed: vāyu rūpaḥ bhramati eva vāyuḥ ūrdhvam sa gacchati
translated: In the form of air, one wanders, and the air goes upwards.

analyzed: daśa aha karma kriyayā kuṭī niṣpādyate dhruvam
translated: By performing the rites for ten days, the hut is certainly accomplished.

original: navakaiḥ ṣoḍaśaśrāddhaiḥ prayāti hi kuṭīṃ naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: navakaiḥ ṣoḍaśa śrāddhaiḥ prayāti hi kuṭīm naraḥ
translated: A man goes to the hut by the nine and sixteen śrāddhas.

original: tilairdarbhaiśca bhūmyāṃ vai kuṭī dhātumayī bhavet /
analyzed: tilaiḥ darbhaiḥ ca bhūmyām vai kuṭī dhātu mayī bhavet
translated: The hut made of earth with sesamum seeds and darbha grass becomes made of elements.

original: pañca ratnāni vaktre tu yena jīvaḥ prarohati // / / //
analyzed: pañca ratnāni vaktre tu yena jīvaḥ prarohati
translated: The five gems are in the mouth, by which the life grows.

original: yadā puṣpaṃ pranaṣṭaṃ hi tadā garbhaṃ na dhārayet /
analyzed: yadā puṣpam pranaṣṭam hi tadā garbham na dhārayet
translated: When the flower is lost, then one should not carry the embryo.

analyzed: ādarāt ca tatas bhūmau tila darbhān viniḥ kṣipet
translated: And out of respect, one should scatter sesamum and darbha grass on the ground.

original: paśutve sthāvaratve ca yatra kvāpi sa jāyate /
analyzed: paśu tve sthāvara tve ca yatra kvāpi sa jāyate
translated: Wherever he is born, whether as an animal or an immobile being,

analyzed: tatra eva jantuḥ utpannaḥ śrāddham tatra upatiṣṭhati
translated: there alone the creature is born, and the śrāddha is offered there.

analyzed: dhanvinā lakṣyam uddiśya muktaḥ bāṇaḥ tat āpnuyāt
translated: Just as an arrow shot by an archer aiming at a target would hit it,

analyzed: yathā śrāddham yam uddiśya kṛtam tasya upatiṣṭhati
translated: in the same way, the śrāddha performed with someone in mind serves him.

analyzed: yāvat na utpāditaḥ dehaḥ tāvat śrāddhaiḥ na prīṇanam
translated: As long as the body is not produced, there is no satisfaction through śrāddhas.

analyzed: kṣudhā vibhramam āpannaḥ daśa ahena ca tarpitaḥ
translated: Having fallen into the delusion of hunger, he is satisfied after ten days.

original: piṇḍadānaṃ na yasyābhūdākāśe bhramate tu saḥ /🔽dinatrayaṃ vasaṃstoye agnāvapi dinatrayam /
analyzed: piṇḍa dānam na yasya abhūt ākāśe bhramate tu saḥ  dina trayam vasan toye agnau api dina trayam
translated: He who has not offered the piṇḍa offering wanders in the sky.🔽Dwelling in water for three days, and in fire for three days,

original: ākāśe vasate trīṇi dinamekantu vāsake // / / //🔽dagdhe dehe ca vahnau ca jalenaiva tu tarpitaḥ /
analyzed: ākāśe vasate trīṇi dinam ekam tu vāsake  dagdhe dehe ca vahnau ca jalena eva tu tarpitaḥ
translated: and in the sky for three days, and in the house for one day.🔽When the body is burnt, he is satisfied only by water and fire.

analyzed: sneha snānam jalena eva pūpakaiḥ kṛsaraiḥ gṛhe
translated: In the house, with oil bath and water, and with cakes and kṛsara.

original: prathame 'hni tṛtīye ca pañcame saptame 'pi vā /
analyzed: prathame hni tṛtīye ca pañcame saptame vā
translated: On the first day, third, fifth, seventh,

analyzed: navama ekādaśe ca eva śrāddham navakam ucyate
translated: ninth and eleventh, the Śrāddha is said to be the Navaka.

original: gṛhadvāre śmaśāne vā tīrthe devālaye 'pi vā /
analyzed: gṛha dvāre śmaśāne vā tīrthe devālaye vā
translated: At the door of the house, in the cremation ground, at a holy place, or even in a temple,

analyzed: yatra ādyaḥ dīyate piṇḍaḥ tatra sarvān samāpayet
translated: where the first ball of rice is offered, one should complete all there.

analyzed: ekādaśa ahe yat śrāddham tat sāmānyam udāhṛtam
translated: The Śrāddha performed on the eleventh day is said to be the general one.

analyzed: caturṇām eka varṇānām śuddhi artham snānam ucyate
translated: For the purification of the four castes, bathing is prescribed.

analyzed: kṛtvā ca ekādaśa ahan ca punar snātvā śuciḥ bhavet
translated: Having performed the eleventh day rites, one should again bathe and become pure.

analyzed: dadyāt viprāya yaḥ śayyām yathoktam preta mokṣa dām
translated: One who gives a bed to a Brāhmaṇa, as prescribed, which grants liberation to the deceased,

original: na bhavet yadā sa gotro paro 'pi vidhimācaret /
analyzed: na bhavet yadā vidhim ācaret
translated: if a person of the same Gotra is not available, another person should also perform the rite.

original: bhāryā vā puruṣaḥ kaścit tuṣṭaśca kurute striyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāryā vā puruṣaḥ kaścid tuṣṭaḥ ca kurute striyaḥ
translated: Either the wife or some other man, being satisfied, should perform the rites for the women.

analyzed: prathame hani yaḥ piṇḍaḥ dīyate vidhi pūrvakam
translated: The ball of rice that is offered on the first day, in accordance with the rules,

analyzed: annādyena ca tena eva sarva śrāddhāni kārayet
translated: with that food alone, all the Śrāddhas should be performed.

analyzed: amantram kārayet śrāddham daśa aham nāma gotrataḥ
translated: The Śrāddha should be performed without mantras for ten days, mentioning the name and Gotra.

original: śrāddhaṃ kṛtantu yairvastraistāni tyaktvā gṛhaṃ viśet // / / //
analyzed: śrāddham yaiḥ vastraiḥ tāni tyaktvā gṛham viśet
translated: Having performed the Śrāddha with those clothes, one should discard them and enter the house.

original: asagotraḥ sagotro vā yadi strī yadi vā pumān /
analyzed: asagotraḥ sagotraḥ vā yadi strī yadi vā pumān
translated: Whether one is of the same Gotra or not, whether one is a woman or a man,

original: prathame 'hani yaḥ kuryāt sa daśāhaṃ samāpayet // / / //🔽jīvasya daśabhiḥ piṇḍairdeho niṣpādyate dhruvam /
analyzed: prathame hani yaḥ kuryāt sa daśa aham samāpayet  jīvasya daśabhiḥ piṇḍaiḥ dehaḥ niṣpādyate dhruvam
translated: he who performs on the first day should complete it in ten days.🔽Certainly the body of the living being is produced by ten balls of rice.

analyzed: vṛddhiḥ ca daśabhiḥ māsaiḥ garbha sthasya yathā bhavet
translated: And just as there is growth of the fetus in ten months,

analyzed: āśaucam yāvat etasya tāvat piṇḍa udakakriyā
translated: as long as there is impurity for him, for that long there is the rite of offering balls of rice and water.

analyzed: caturṇām api varṇānām eṣaḥ eva vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: This is the same rule for all the four varnas.

analyzed: yatra tri rātram āśaucam tatra ādau trīn pradāpayet
translated: Where there is impurity for three nights, there one should give three at the beginning,

analyzed: caturaḥ tu dvitīye hni tṛtīye trīn tathā eva ca
translated: four on the second day, and three on the third day.

analyzed: pṛthak śarāvayoḥ dadyāt eka aham kṣīram ambu ca
translated: One should give milk and water separately in two vessels for one day.

analyzed: ekoddiṣṭam tu vai śrāddham caturthe hani kārayet
translated: But the Ekoddiṣṭa Śrāddha should be performed on the fourth day.

analyzed: prathame hani yaḥ piṇḍaḥ tena mūrdhā prajāyate
translated: The head of the deceased is produced by the ball of rice offered on the first day.

original: cakṣuḥ śrotrañca nāsā ca dvitīye 'hni prajāyate // / / //
analyzed: cakṣuḥ śrotram ca nāsā ca dvitīye hni prajāyate
translated: The eyes, ears, nose are produced on the second day.

original: gaṇḍau vaktraṃ tathā grīvā tṛtīye 'hani jāyate /
analyzed: gaṇḍau vaktram tathā grīvā tṛtīye hani jāyate
translated: The cheeks, face and neck are formed on the third day.

analyzed: hṛdayam kukṣiḥ udaram caturthe tadvat eva hi
translated: The heart, belly and stomach are formed on the fourth day in the same way.

analyzed: kaṭi pṛṣṭham gudam ca api pañcame hani jāyate
translated: The hips, back and anus are formed on the fifth day.

original: ṣaṣṭhe ūrū ca vijñeye saptame gulphasambhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe ūrū ca vijñeye saptame gulpha sambhavaḥ
translated: The thighs should be known on the sixth day, and the ankles are formed on the seventh day.

original: aṣṭame divase prāpte jaṅghe ca bhavato 'ṇḍaja /
analyzed: aṣṭame divase prāpte jaṅghe ca bhavataḥ ṇḍaja
translated: When the eighth day arrives, the calves are formed, O egg-born one.

original: pādau ca navame jñeyau daśame balavatkṣudhā // / / //
analyzed: pādau ca navame jñeyau daśame balavat kṣudhā
translated: The feet should be known on the ninth day, and on the tenth day, hunger becomes strong.

original: ekādaśāhe yaḥ piṇḍastaṃ dadyādāmiṣeṇa tu /🔽siddhānnaṃ tasya dātavyaṃ kṛśarāḥ pūpakāḥ payaḥ /
analyzed: ekādaśa ahe yaḥ piṇḍaḥ tam dadyāt āmiṣeṇa tu  siddhānnam tasya dātavyam kṛśarāḥ pūpakāḥ payaḥ
translated: On the eleventh day, the ball of flesh should be offered with meat.🔽Cooked food, kṛsaras, cakes and milk should be given to him.

analyzed: prakṣālya vipracaraṇau arghyam dhūpam ca dīpakram
translated: Having washed the feet of the Brāhmaṇas, Arghya, incense and lamps should be offered in order.

analyzed: dvādaśa pratimāsyāni śrāddhāni aikādaśe tathā
translated: The Śrāddha rites are performed every fortnight, on the eleventh day,

original: tripakṣañcāpi ṣaṇmāse dve śrāddhāni ca ṣoḍaśa // / / //
analyzed: tri pakṣam ca api ṣaṣ māse dve śrāddhāni ca ṣoḍaśa
translated: and every three fortnights, on the sixth day, thus sixteen Śrāddha rites are performed.

original: prati māsaṃ pradātavyaṃ mṛtāhe yā tithirbhavet /
analyzed: prati māsam pradātavyam mṛtāhe yā tithiḥ bhavet
translated: The Śrāddha should be performed on the day of death every month.

original: sa māsaḥ prathamo jñeya iti vedavido viduḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa māsaḥ prathamaḥ jñeyaḥ iti veda vidaḥ viduḥ
translated: The first month is known as such, so say those who know the Vedas.

analyzed: śava haste ca yat śrāddham mṛti sthāne dvija āsane
translated: The Śrāddha performed with the hand of a corpse, at the place of death, on a seat for the Brāhmaṇas,

analyzed: tat eva prathamam śrāddham tat syāt ekādaśe hani
translated: That very first Śrāddha should be performed on the eleventh day.

original: sā tithirmāsike śrāddhe mṛto yasmin dine naraḥ /
analyzed: sā tithiḥ māsike śrāddhe mṛtaḥ yasmin dine naraḥ
translated: That date on which a man dies, that date is to be observed in a monthly Śrāddha.

original: riktayośca tripakṣe ca sā tithirnādriyeta vai // / / //
analyzed: riktayoḥ ca tri pakṣe ca sā tithiḥ na ādriyeta vai
translated: And the empty dates and the tripakṣa dates should not be observed.

original: paurṇamāsyāṃ mṛto yo 'sau caturthī tasya conakā /🔽caturthyāntu mṛto yastu navamī tasya conakā // / / //
analyzed: paurṇamāsyām mṛtaḥ sau caturthī tasya conakā  caturthyām tu mṛtaḥ yaḥ tu navamī tasya conakā
translated: One who dies on the full moon day, the fourth is his empty date.🔽One who dies on the fourth, the ninth is his empty date.

original: navamyāñca mṛto yaśca riktā tasya caturdaśī /
analyzed: navamyām ca mṛtaḥ yaḥ ca riktā tasya caturdaśī
translated: One who dies on the ninth, the fourteenth is his empty date.

original: etā riktāśca vijñeyā antyeṣṭau kuśalena ca // / / //
analyzed: etāḥ riktāḥ ca vijñeyāḥ antyeṣṭau kuśalena ca
translated: These empty dates should be known by the wise in the funeral rites.

analyzed: ekādaśa ahe yat śrāddham navakam tat prakīrtitam
translated: The Śrāddha that is performed on the eleventh day is declared to be the group of nine.

original: catuṣpathe tyajedannaṃ punaḥ snānaṃ samācaret // / / //🔽ekādaśāhādārabhya ghaṭasyānnaṃ jalānvitam /
analyzed: catuṣpathe tyajet annam punar snānam samācaret  ekādaśa ahāt ārabhya ghaṭasya annam jala anvitam
translated: One should discard food at the crossroads and then perform ablution again.🔽From the eleventh day onwards, the food of the pitcher along with water

analyzed: dine dine ca dātavyam abdam yāvat dvijottame
translated: should be given daily to the best of the twice-born for a year.

analyzed: mānuṣasya śarīre tu vidyate hi asthi sañcayaḥ
translated: In the human body there is a collection of bones.

analyzed: tad saṃkhyaḥ sarva deheṣu ṣaṣṭi adhika śata trayam
translated: That number is in all bodies, three hundred and sixty.

analyzed: uda kumbhena puṣṭāni tāni asthīni bhavanti hi
translated: Those bones become nourished by the water pitcher.

analyzed: etasmāt dīyate kumbhaḥ prītiḥ pretasya jāyate
translated: From this, a pot is given, and the satisfaction of the departed one is produced.

original: yasmin dine mṛto janturaṭavyāṃ viṣame 'pi vā /
analyzed: yasmin dine mṛtaḥ jantuḥ aṭavyām viṣame vā
translated: On whatever day a person dies in a forest or in a difficult place,

analyzed: yadā tadā bhavet dāhaḥ sūtakam mṛta vāsarāt
translated: then on that day, the cremation should be done, and the period of impurity begins from the day of death.

analyzed: tila pātram tathā annādyam yat
translated: Sesamum seeds, a vessel, food, and other articles, along with incense, flowers, etc.,

original: ekādaśāhe dātavyaṃ tena śūddho dvijo bhavet // / / //
analyzed: ekādaśa ahe dātavyam tena śūddhaḥ dvijaḥ bhavet
translated: should be given on the eleventh day, by which the twice-born becomes pure.

original: kṣattriyo dvādaśāhe tu vaiśyaḥ pañcadaśe tathā /
analyzed: kṣattriyaḥ dvādaśa ahe tu vaiśyaḥ pañcadaśe tathā
translated: A Kshatriya becomes pure after twelve days, a Vaishya after fifteen days,

analyzed: śuddhiḥ śūdrasya māsena mṛtake jāta sūtake
translated: and a Shudra after one month, in the case of death or birth pollution.

original: māsatraye trirātraṃ syāt ṣaṇmāsena tu pakṣiṇī /
analyzed: māsa traye tri rātram syāt ṣaṣ māsena tu pakṣiṇī
translated: For three months, it should be three nights, for six months, it should be a fortnight,

analyzed: ahar saṃvatsarāt arbudh pūrṇe dattvā udakam śuciḥ
translated: and for a year or more, after offering water, one becomes pure.

original: anenaivā nusāreṇa śuddhiḥ syāt sārvavarṇikī // / / //🔽ekādaśāhaprabhṛti purataḥ prativatsaram /
analyzed: anena eva anusāreṇa śuddhiḥ syāt sārvavarṇikī  ekādaśa aha prabhṛti puratas prativatsaram
translated: In this very way, there should be purification for all castes.🔽From the eleventh day onwards, every year,

analyzed: viśvedevān tu sampūjya piṇḍam ekam ca nirvapet
translated: worshipping the Vishvedevas, one should offer a single ball of rice.

analyzed: yathā tārā gaṇāḥ sarve chādyante ravi raśmibhiḥ
translated: Just as all the clusters of stars are covered by the rays of the sun,

original: evaṃ pracchādyate sarvaṃ na preto bhavati kvacit // / / //
analyzed: evam pracchādyate sarvam na pretaḥ bhavati kvacid
translated: in the same way, everything is covered, and the departed one never becomes so.

analyzed: śayyā dānam praśaṃsanti sarvadā eva dvijottamāḥ
translated: The best of Brahmins always praise the gift of a bed.

original: anityaṃ jīvanaṃ ysamāt paścāt ko nu pradāsyati // / / //
analyzed: anityam jīvanam ysamāt paścāt kaḥ nu pradāsyati
translated: Since life is uncertain, who will give it later?

analyzed: tāvat vandhuḥ pitā tāvat yāvat jīvati mānavaḥ
translated: A father is a relative only as long as a man lives.

original: mṛte mṛta iti jñātvā kṣaṇāt sneho nivartate // / / //
analyzed: mṛte mṛtaḥ iti jñātvā kṣaṇāt snehaḥ nivartate
translated: Knowing that the dead are dead, affection ceases in an instant.

analyzed: ātmā eva hi ātmanaḥ bandhuḥ evam jñātvā muhur muhur
translated: The self is indeed the friend of the self. Knowing this again and again,

analyzed: jīvan api iti sañcintya svīyam hita manuḥ tam aret
translated: thinking that even while living one will die, one should do what is beneficial for oneself.

analyzed: mṛtānām kaḥ sutaḥ dadyāt dvijeśayyām sa tūlikām
translated: Who will give a bed with cotton to the sons of the dead?

analyzed: evam jānan idam sarvam sva hastena eva dāpayet
translated: Knowing this, one should give all this oneself.

analyzed: tasmāt śayyām samāsādya sāradāru maryaḥ dṛḍhām
translated: Therefore, having obtained a bed made of strong heartwood,

analyzed: danta ādi rucirām ramyām hema paṭṭaiḥ ralaṅkṛtām
translated: beautiful and charming, adorned with golden cloth,

original: tasyāṃ saṃsthāpya haimañca hariṃ lakṣmyā samanvitam // / / //
analyzed: tasyām saṃsthāpya haimam ca harim lakṣmyā samanvitam
translated: having placed on it a golden Hari along with Lakshmi,

analyzed: ghṛta pūrṇam ca kalaśam parikalpayet
translated: one should prepare a pot filled with ghee.

original: vijñeyo garuḍa prītyai sa nidrākalaśo budhaiḥ // / / //

analyzed: kartavyam tat ca vai sarvam eṣaḥ eva vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ  devānām pitaraḥ devāḥ pitṝṇām ṛṣayaḥ tathā

analyzed: ṛṣīṇām pitaraḥ devāḥ pitā jayati tena vai

analyzed: yajñanāthasya yat dattam tat dattam sarva dehinām

analyzed: pretībhūtāḥ tu pitaraḥ lupta piṇḍa udaka kriyāḥ

analyzed: atha mātuḥ vipattiḥ syāt pitṛ kāryam na lupyate
translated: But if the mother dies, the offerings to the father are not discontinued.

analyzed: hantakāraḥ tad uddeśe śrāddham na eva jala añjaliḥ

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe dvitīyāṃśe dharmakāṇḍe pretakalpe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde aurdhvadehikādinirūpaṇaṃ nāma catustriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam

analyzed: puruṣasya ca kasya api matā pañcatvam āgatā
translated: The view of some people is that a person who has attained the state of the dead,

analyzed: kena sā melyate mātā etat kathaya me prabho

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇaḥ uvāca

analyzed: umā lakṣmīḥ ca sāvitrī iti a tābhiḥ melayet dhruvam

analyzed: iti ete puruṣāḥ khyātāḥ pitṛ mātṛ kuleṣu ca

analyzed: tārayet yajamānaḥ tu daśa pūrvān daśa avarān

analyzed: sapiṇḍaḥ sa bhavet ādau sapiṇḍīkaraṇe kṛte

analyzed: antyaḥ tu tyājakaḥ jñeyaḥ yaḥ vṛddhaprapitāmahaḥ

analyzed: yajamānaḥ bhavet ekaḥ daśa pṛrtve daśa avare

analyzed: iti ete pitaraḥ jñeyāḥ ekaviṃśati saṃkhyakāḥ

analyzed: vidhinā kurute yaḥ tu saṃsāre śrāddham uttamam
translated: He who performs the excellent Sraddha in the world according to the rules,

original: jāyate 'tra na sandehaḥ śṛṇu tasyāpi yat phalam // / / //

translated: is born here, there is no doubt. Listen to the fruit of that also.

analyzed: dadyāt vipulam annādyam vṛddhaḥ tu prapitāmahaḥ

analyzed: viśuddhaḥ sarva pāpebhyaḥ muktaḥ sa narakāt dhruvam

analyzed: nivaset nāka loke ca na atra kāryā vicāraṇā

analyzed: pañcaka anantaram tasya kartavyam sarvam anyathā

analyzed: sūtaka ante tatas putraḥ kuryāt śāntikam uttamam

analyzed: pañcakeṣu mṛtaḥ na gatim labhate naraḥ

analyzed: bhājana upānahau chatram hema mudrā ca vāsasī

analyzed: bāla vṛddha āturāṇām ca mṛtānām pañcakeṣu hi

analyzed: vidhānam yaḥ na kurvīta vighnaḥ tasya prajāyate

analyzed: agnaukaraṇam ucchiṣṭam śrāddham vai vaiśvadaivikam
translated: not performing the rites in the fire, not being impure, a funeral rite for all,

translated: not scattering, not uttering the word Svadha, not using the word Pitri,🔽one should not utter the word Anu, not invoke, not carry a torch,

analyzed: āsīmāntam na kurvīta pradakṣiṇa visarjanam

analyzed: na kuryāt vaiśvadevam ced kartā gacchati adhogatim

analyzed: malina śrāddha saṃjñānam pūrva ṣoḍaśakam tathā

analyzed: ṣaṣṭham sañcayane proktam daśa piṇḍāḥ daśa āhikāḥ

analyzed: śrāddha ṣoḍaṣakam ca etat prathamam parikīrtitam

analyzed: kartavyāni iha vidhinā śrāddhāni ekādaśa eva tu
translated: Eleven Sraddhas should be performed here according to the rules,

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu śiva ādyam ca tathā anyat śrāddha pañcakam
translated: And another set of five Sraddhas for Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, and others.

analyzed: evam ṣoḍaśakam prāhuḥ etat tattva vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: Thus the people who know the truth speak of a set of sixteen.

analyzed: dvādaśa pratimāsyāni śrāddham ekādaśe tathā

analyzed: tri pakṣa sambhavañca eva dve rikte khaga ṣoḍaśa
