analyzed: varṇāḥ ca catvāraḥ iha praśastāḥ varṇeṣu dharmiṣṭha narāḥ praśastāḥ
translated: The four castes are praised here, and among the castes, men who are most righteous are praised.

original: dharmeṇa saukhyaṃ samupaiti sarvaṃ jñānaṃ samāpnoti mahāpathe sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dharmeṇa saukhyam samupaiti sarvam jñānam samāpnoti mahāpathe sthitaḥ
translated: By dharma, one attains happiness everywhere, and by remaining on the great path, one attains knowledge.

original: dehaṃ parityajya yadā gatāyuḥ pakṣin sthito 'haṃ kṛmikīṭasaṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: deham parityajya yadā gata āyuḥ pakṣin sthitaḥ ham kṛmi kīṭa saṃsthitaḥ
translated: When one's life is over and one abandons the body, O bird, I remain as a worm or insect,

original: sarīsṛpo 'haṃ maśako vinirmitaścatuṣpado 'haṃ vanasūkaro 'ham // / / //🔽sarvaṃ vijānāti hi garbhasaṃsthito jātaśca sadyastadidañca vismaret /
analyzed: sarīsṛpaḥ ham maśakaḥ vinirmitaḥ catuṣpadaḥ ham vana sūkaraḥ ham  sarvam vijānāti hi garbha saṃsthitaḥ jātaḥ ca sadyas tat idam ca vismaret
translated: a reptile, a mosquito, a quadruped, or a wild boar.🔽One who is in the womb knows everything, but as soon as one is born, one forgets it.

original: yaccintitaṃ garbhasamāgatena vai bālo yuvā vṛddhavayā babhūva // / / //
analyzed: yat cintitam garbha samāgatena vai bālaḥ yuvā vṛddha vayāḥ babhūva
translated: What was thought by one who has come to the womb, becomes a child, a youth, or an old man.

original: mohādvināṣṭaṃ yadi garbhacintitaṃ smṛtaṃ punarmṛtyugate cadehe /
analyzed: mohāt vinā aṣṭam yadi garbha cintitam smṛtam punar mṛtyu gate ca dehe
translated: If the thought of destruction is remembered again when the body has gone to death,

original: tasminpranaṣṭe hṛdi cintitaṃ gataṃ smṛtaṃ punargarbhagate ca dehe // / / //
analyzed: tasmin pranaṣṭe hṛdi cintitam gatam smṛtam punar garbha gate ca dehe
translated: when that is destroyed, the thought in the heart is gone, remembered again when the body has entered the womb.

original: tasminpranaṣṭe hṛdi cintitaṃ punarmayā svakośe paravañcanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tasmin pranaṣṭe hṛdi cintitam punar mayā sva kośe para vañcanam kṛtam
translated: When that is destroyed, the thought in the heart is gone again. I have deceived others in my own treasury.

original: dyūtaiśchalenāpi ca cauryavṛttyā dharmaṃ vyatikramya śarīrarakṣaṇe // / / //
analyzed: dyūtaiḥ chalena api ca caurya vṛttyā dharmam vyatikramya śarīra rakṣaṇe
translated: By gambling, deceit, and even by thievery, transgressing dharma in protecting the body.

original: kṛcchreṇa lakṣmīḥ samupārjitā svayaṃ mayā na bhuktaṃ manasepsitaṃ dhanam /
analyzed: kṛcchreṇa lakṣmīḥ samupārjitā svayam mayā na bhuktam manasā īpsitam dhanam
translated: Wealth is earned with difficulty, by oneself. I have not enjoyed wealth as desired by the mind.

analyzed: tāmbūlam annam madhuram sa gorasam dattvā agni deva atithi bandhu varge
translated: Having given betel nut, sweet food with milk, to the group of fire, gods, guests, and relatives.

original: somagrahe sūryasamāgamepi vā na sevitaṃ tīrthavariṣṭhamuttamam /
analyzed: soma grahe sūrya samāgame api vā na sevitam tīrtha variṣṭham uttamam
translated: Even at the time of a lunar eclipse or a solar eclipse, the best and excellent holy place has not been resorted to.

original: kośaṃ svakīyaṃ malamūtrapūritaṃ dehinkvacinnistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: kośam svakīyam mala mūtra pūritam dehin kvacid nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: O embodied one, dispose of somewhere the wealth that you have earned, filled with urine and feces.

original: mayā na dṛṣṭā na natā na pūjitā traivikramī mūrtiriha sthitā bhuvi /
analyzed: mayā na dṛṣṭā na natā na pūjitā traivikramī mūrtiḥ iha sthitā bhuvi
translated: The three-step form of Vishnu, which is present on the earth, has not been seen, bowed to, or worshipped by me.

original: prabhāsanātho na ca bhaktisaṃstuto dehinkvacinnistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: prabhāsa nāthaḥ na ca bhakti saṃstutaḥ dehin kvacid nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: O Lord of Prabhasa, not praised with devotion, O embodied one, go and be punished for what you have done.

original: gatvā variṣṭhe bhuvi tīrthasannidhau dhanaṃ na dattaṃ viduṣāṃ kare mayā /
analyzed: gatvā variṣṭhe bhuvi tīrtha sannidhau dhanam na dattam viduṣām kare mayā
translated: Having gone to the best place on earth near the holy place, wealth was not given by me in the hands of the wise.

original: āplutya dehaṃ vidhinā dvije gurau dihinkvacinnistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //🔽na mātṛpūjā na ca viṣṇuśaṅkarau gaṇeśacaṇaḍyau na ca bhāskaro 'pi vā /
analyzed: āplutya deham vidhinā dvije gurau dihin kvacid nistara yat tvayā kṛtam  na mātṛ pūjā na ca viṣṇu śaṅkarau gaṇeśa caṇaḍyau na ca vā
translated: Having bathed the body according to the rules, O embodied one, go and be punished for what you have done.🔽No worship of the mother, no Vishnu, Shankara, Ganesha, Chandika, or the sun,

analyzed: yat ca upacāraiḥ bali yukta candanaiḥ dehin kvacid nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: And no offerings with services and sandalwood paste, O embodied one, go and be punished for what you have done.

original: labdhā mayā mānavadevatopamā mohādgatā sarvamidañca pārthiva /
analyzed: labdhā mayā mānava devatā upamā mohāt gatā sarvam idan ca pārthiva
translated: I have obtained the status of a human god, but out of delusion, I have wasted all this, O king.

original: gatiṃ na vīkṣeta sa vai vimūḍhadhīrdehinkvacinnistara yattvayā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: gatim na vīkṣeta sa vai vimūḍha dhīḥ dehin kvacid nistara yat tvayā kṛtam
translated: That one with a deluded mind does not see the path, O embodied one, go and be punished for what you have done.

analyzed: etāni pakṣin manasā vicintya vākyāni dharma artha yaśaskarāṇi
translated: O bird, having thought of these words which bring about dharma, artha and fame,

original: muktiṃ samāyānti manuṣyaloke vasanti ye dharmaratāḥ sudeśe // / / //
analyzed: muktim samāyānti manuṣya loke vasanti ye dharma ratāḥ sudeśe
translated: Those who are devoted to dharma and reside in a good country attain liberation in the human world.

analyzed: iti bruvāṇaiḥ yama dhūta vargaiḥ vihanyate kāla mayaiḥ ca mudgaraiḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the group of Yama's messengers, he is struck with time-like hammers.

original: hā daiva hā daiva iti smaran vai dhanaṃ na dattaṃ svayamarjitaṃ yat // / / //
analyzed: hā daiva hā daiva iti smaran vai dhanam na dattam svayam arjitam yat
translated: Alas, fate! Alas, fate! remembering that wealth earned by oneself was not given away.

original: na bhūmidānaṃ na ca gopradānaṃ na vāridānaṃ na ca vastradānam /
analyzed: na bhūmi dānam na ca go pradānam na vāri dānam na ca vastra dānam
translated: Not the gift of land, not the gift of cows, not the gift of water, not the gift of clothes,

original: phalaṃ satāmbūlavilepanaṃ vā tvayā na dattaṃ bhuvi śocase katham // / / //
analyzed: phalam sa tāmbūla vilepanam vā tvayā na dattam bhuvi śocase katham
translated: Not the fruit of betel nut and ointment, was given by you on earth. How do you lament?

original: pitā mṛtaste ca pitāmahaḥ sā yayā dhṛto vāpyudare svakīye /
analyzed: pitā mṛtaḥ te ca pitāmahaḥ sā yayā dhṛtaḥ vā api udare svakīye
translated: Your father is dead, and your grandfather, by whom you were indeed supported in your own womb,

original: mṛto 'pyasau bandhujanaḥ samasto dṛṣṭaṃ tvayā sarvamidaṃ gatāyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mṛtaḥ pi asau bandhu janaḥ samastaḥ dṛṣṭam tvayā sarvam idam gata ayaḥ
translated: That entire group of relatives is dead. You have seen all this, O departed one.

original: kośaṃ tvadīyaṃ jvalitañca vahninā puttrairgṛhīto dhanadhānya sañcayaḥ /
analyzed: kośam tvadīyam jvalitam ca vahninā puttraiḥ gṛhītaḥ dhana dhānya sañcayaḥ
translated: Your treasury was burned by fire. The accumulation of wealth and grain was taken by your sons.

original: subhāṣitaṃ dharmacayaṃ kṛtañca yattadeva gacchettava pṛṣṭhasaṃstham // / / //
analyzed: su bhāṣitam dharma cayam kṛtam ca yat tat eva gacchet tava pṛṣṭha saṃstham
translated: Whatever good advice, accumulation of Dharma, and good deeds were done, that alone will follow you, mounted on your back.

original: na dṛśyate ko 'pi mṛtaḥ samāgato rājā yatirvā dvijapuṅgavo 'pi vā /
analyzed: na dṛśyate kaḥ pi mṛtaḥ samāgataḥ rājā yatiḥ vā vā
translated: No one who has died and returned is seen, whether a king, an ascetic, or a great Brahmin.

original: yo vai mṛtaḥ sāhasikaḥ sa martyako nāśaṃ yo 'pi dharātale sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ vai mṛtaḥ sāhasikaḥ sa martyakaḥ nāśam dharā tale sthitaḥ
translated: That mortal who dies rashly, even if he is on earth, is destroyed.

original: evaṃ gaṇāste bruvate sakinnarā dhairyaṃ samālambya vipādapūritaḥ /
analyzed: evam gaṇāḥ te bruvate sa kinnarāḥ dhairyam samālambya vipāda pūritaḥ
translated: Thus those hosts of gods speak, filled with grief, taking courage,

original: śrutvā gaṇānāṃ vacanaṃ mahādbhutaṃ bravīti pakṣīndra manuṣyatāṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā gaṇānām vacanam mahā adbhutam bravīti pakṣi indra manuṣya tām gataḥ
translated: Having heard the extremely wonderful words of the Ganas, the bird who has attained human form speaks.

analyzed: dāna prabhāveṇa vimāna saṃsthitaḥ dharmaḥ pitā mātṛ dayā anurūpiṇī
translated: By the power of charity, he is seated in a celestial vehicle. Dharma is the father, compassion towards the mother,

original: vāṇī kalatraṃ madhurārthabhāṣiṇī snānaṃ sutīrthe ca subandhavargaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vāṇī kalatram madhura artha bhāṣiṇī snānam su tīrthe ca su bandha vargaḥ
translated: Speech is the wife, speaking sweet words. Bathing in an excellent holy place, and a good group of relatives.

original: karārpitaṃ yatsukṛtaṃ samastaṃ svargastadā syāttava kiṅkaropamaḥ /
analyzed: kara arpitam yat sukṛtam samastam svargaḥ tadā syāt tava kiṅkara upamaḥ
translated: Whatever good deeds are done with the hands, then heaven will be like your servant.

original: yo dharmavān prāpsyati so 'tisaukhyaṃ pāpī samastaṃ vividhañca duḥkham // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ dharmavān prāpsyati saḥ ti saukhyam pāpī samastam vividham ca duḥkham
translated: One who is righteous will attain great happiness, and the sinful one will experience all kinds of misery.

original: yo dharmaśīlo jitamānaroṣo vidyāvinīto na paropatāpī /
analyzed: yaḥ dharma śīlaḥ jita māna roṣaḥ vidyā vinītaḥ na para upatāpī
translated: One who is virtuous, has conquered pride and anger, is learned and disciplined, and does not harm others,

original: svadāratuṣṭaḥ paradāradūraḥsa vai naro no bhuvi vandanīyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva dāra tuṣṭaḥ para dāra dūraḥ sa vai naraḥ naḥ bhuvi vandanīyaḥ
translated: Is content with his own wife and stays away from others' wives - such a man is worthy of our worship on earth.

analyzed: miṣṭānna dātā carita agnihotraḥ vedānta vid candra sahasra jīvī
translated: One who gives delicious food, performs Agnihotra, knows the Vedanta, lives for a thousand years like the moon,

original: māsopavāsī ca pativratā caṣaḍ jīvaloke mama vandanīyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: māsa upavāsī ca pativratā ca ṣaṣ jīva loke mama vandanīyāḥ
translated: Observes fasts for a month, and is devoted to her husband - these six are worthy of my worship in the world of the living.

original: evaṃ samācārayuto naro 'pi vāpīṃ sakūpāṃ sajalaṃ taḍāgam /
analyzed: evam samācāra yutaḥ naraḥ vāpīm sa kūpām sa jalam taḍāgam
translated: Even a man endowed with such conduct, who builds a pond, a well, or a water tank,

original: prapāśubhaṃ hṛdgṛhadevamandiraṃ kṛtaṃ nareṇaiva sa dharmauttamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prapā śubham hṛd gṛha deva mandiram kṛtam nareṇa eva sa dharmauttamaḥ
translated: The best of men who builds a pavilion for the distribution of water, a house for the heart, and a temple for the gods, he is indeed the best of the righteous.

original: varṣāśanaṃ vedavide ca dattaṃ kanyāvivāhastvṛṇamocanaṃ dvije /
analyzed: varṣa aśanam veda vide ca dattam kanyā vivāhaḥ tu ṛṇamocanam dvije
translated: Giving food for a year to one who knows the Vedas, arranging the marriage of a girl, and releasing a cow from bondage,

analyzed: bhūmiḥ su kṛṣṭā api tṛṣā ārti hetoḥ tat evam etam samastam
translated: Even well-ploughed land is of no use if it lacks water. Thus, all this is the essence of good deeds.

original: adhyāyamenaṃ sukṛtasya sāraṃ śṛṇoti gāyatyapi bhāvaśuddhyā /
analyzed: adhyāyam enam su kṛtasya sāram śṛṇoti gāyati api bhāva śuddhyā
translated: He who listens to this chapter on the essence of good deeds, and sings it with a pure heart,

original: sa vai kulīnaḥ sa ca dharmayukto viśvālayaṃ yāti paraṃ sa nūnam // / / //🔽iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe dvitīyāṃśe dharmakāṇḍe pretakalpe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde manuṣyasya sukhaduḥ khaprāpakadharmādharmanirūpaṇaṃ
analyzed: sa vai kulīnaḥ sa ca dharma yuktaḥ viśva ālayam yāti param sa nūnam  iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe dvitīya aṃśe dharma kāṇḍe pretakalpe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde manuṣyasya sukha duḥ kha prāpaka dharma adharma nirūpaṇam
translated: He is indeed of noble birth, he is indeed righteous, and he certainly goes to the highest abode of the universe.

analyzed: nāma aṣṭacatvāriṃśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-eighth chapter in the Uttarakhṇḍa of the Skanda Purāṇa, in which is described the determination of the good and bad deeds that lead to happiness and sorrow for a human being, in the dialogue between Śrī Kṛṣṇa and Garuḍa in the Pretakalpa of the Dharma section.

analyzed: śrī garuḍa mahāpurāṇam
translated: Śrī Garuḍa Mahāpurāṇa

analyzed: garuḍaḥ uvāca  śrutā mayā dayā sindho hi ajñānāt jīva saṃsṛtiḥ
translated: Garuḍa said:🔽O ocean of compassion, I have heard about the transmigration of the soul due to ignorance.

analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi mokṣa upāyam sanātanam
translated: Now I wish to hear about the eternal means of liberation.

analyzed: bhagavan devadeveśa śaraṇa āgata vatsala
translated: O Lord, Lord of the gods, compassionate to the surrendered,

analyzed: asāre ghora saṃsāre sarva dus kha malīmase
translated: In this worthless and terrible worldly existence, defiled by all kinds of misery,

analyzed: nānāvidha śarīra sthāḥ anantāḥ jīva rāśayaḥ
translated: The infinite mass of living beings, dwelling in various kinds of bodies,

original: jāyante ca mriyante ca teṣāmanto na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: jāyante ca mriyante ca teṣām antaḥ na vidyate
translated: Are born and die, and there is no end to them.

original: sadā duḥ khāturā eva na sakhī vidyate kkacit /
analyzed: sadā duḥ kha āturā eva na sakhī vidyate kkacid
translated: They are always afflicted by misery, and have no friend anywhere.

original: kenopāyena mokṣeśa mucyante vada me prabho // / / //
analyzed: kena upāyena mokṣa īśa mucyante vada me prabho
translated: By what means, O Lord of Liberation, do they become liberated? Tell me, O Lord.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān ubāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: śṛṇu tārkṣya pravakṣyāmi yanmāṃ tvaṃ paripṛcchasi /
analyzed: śṛṇu tārkṣya pravakṣyāmi yat mām tvam paripṛcchasi
translated: Listen, O Garuda, I shall tell you what you ask me,

analyzed: yasya śravaṇa mātreṇa saṃsārāt mucyate naraḥ
translated: By merely hearing which a man becomes liberated from worldly existence.

analyzed: asti devaḥ para brahma svarūpaḥ niṣkalaḥ śivaḥ
translated: There is a God, of the form of the Supreme Brahman, the partless Shiva,
Omniscient, the doer of all, the lord of all, spotless, non-dual.

analyzed: svayañjyotiḥ anādi antaḥ nirvikāraḥ parātparaḥ
translated: Self-luminous, without beginning or end, changeless, greater than the greatest,

analyzed: nirguṇaḥ saccidānandaḥ tad aṃśāḥ jīva saṃjñakāḥ
translated: Without qualities, existence, knowledge and bliss. The parts of Him are called the individual souls.

analyzed: anādya vidyā upahatāḥ yathā agnau visphuliṅgakāḥ
translated: Afflicted by beginningless ignorance, like sparks in a fire,

analyzed: deha ādi upādhi sambhinnāḥ te karmabhiḥ anādibhiḥ
translated: They are identified with the limiting adjuncts like the body, by beginningless actions,

analyzed: sukha duḥ kha pradaiḥ puṇya pā rūpaiḥ niyantritāḥ
translated: Which give rise to happiness, sorrow, and are controlled by virtue and vice.

analyzed: tad tad jāti yutam deham āyuḥ bhogam ca karma jam
translated: The body endowed with that and that type, and the life and enjoyment are born of karma.

original: pratijanma prapadyante teṣāmapi paraṃ punaḥ /🔽sasūkṣmaliṅgaśarīramāmokṣādakṣaraṃ khaga // / / //
analyzed: pratijanma prapadyante teṣām api param punar  sa sūkṣma liṅga śarīram āmokṣāt akṣaram khaga
translated: They attain rebirth after rebirth, and even beyond that,🔽The subtle body with the imperishable principle, O bird, is imperishable until liberation.

analyzed: sthāvarāḥ kṛmayaḥ ca ajāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ paśavaḥ nagaḥ
translated: The immobile beings, worms, insects, birds, animals, and trees,

analyzed: dhārmikāḥ tridaśāḥ tadvat mokṣiṇaḥ ca yathākramam
translated: The righteous, the gods, and the liberated ones attain liberation in due order.

analyzed: caturvidha śarīrāṇi dhṛtvā muktvā sahasraśas
translated: Having taken up and abandoned thousands of four-fold bodies,

analyzed: sukṛtāt mā navaḥ bhūtvā jñānī ced mokṣam āpnuyāt
translated: If one becomes a virtuous person and a knower of reality, one attains liberation.

analyzed: caturaśīti lakṣeṣu śarīreṣu śarīriṇām
translated: Among the eighty-four lakh types of bodies of embodied beings,

analyzed: na mānuṣam vinā anyatra tattva jñānan tu labhyate
translated: The knowledge of reality is not obtained anywhere else except in the human body.

analyzed: atra janma sahasrāṇām sahasraiḥ api koṭibhiḥ
translated: Here, even after thousands and millions of thousands of births,

analyzed: kadācid labhate jantuḥ mānuṣyam puṇya sañcayāt
translated: A creature sometimes obtains a human body by the accumulation of merit.

analyzed: sopāna bhūtam mokṣasya mānuṣyam prāpya durlabham
translated: Having obtained the human body, which is a stepping stone to liberation, and which is difficult to obtain,

analyzed: yaḥ tāra yati nā ātmānam tasmāt pāpataraḥ tra kaḥ
translated: If one does not liberate oneself, what greater sinner is there than him?

analyzed: naraḥ prāpya itarat janma labdhvā ca indriya sauṣṭhavam
translated: A man having obtained this birth and having obtained the excellence of the senses,

analyzed: na vetti ātma hitam yaḥ tu sa bhavet brahma ghātakaḥ
translated: He who does not know what is beneficial for himself becomes a murderer of Brahman.

original: vinā dehena kasyāpi puruṣārtho na vidyate /
analyzed: vinā dehena kasya api puruṣa arthaḥ na vidyate
translated: For no one has any human goal without a body.

analyzed: tasmāt deham dhanam rakṣet puṇya karmāṇi sādhayet
translated: Therefore, one should protect one's body and wealth and accomplish meritorious deeds.

analyzed: rakṣet ca sarvadā ātmānam ātmā sarvvasya bhājanam
translated: One should always protect oneself, for the self is the vessel of everything.

analyzed: rakṣaṇe yatnam ātiṣṭhet jīvan bhadrāṇi paśyati
translated: One should strive to protect oneself, for while living one sees auspicious things.

analyzed: punar grāmaḥ punar kṣetra punar vittam punar gṛham
translated: Again a village, again a field, again wealth, again a house,

original: punaḥ śubhāśubhaṃ karma na śarīraṃ punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: punar śubha aśubham karma na śarīram punar punar
translated: again good and bad deeds, but not the body again and again.

analyzed: śarīra rakṣaṇa upāyāḥ sarvadā budhaiḥ
translated: The means of protecting the body are always employed by the wise.

analyzed: na icchanti ca punar tyāgam api kuṣṭha ādi rogiṇaḥ
translated: Even those afflicted with leprosy and other diseases do not wish to give it up again.

analyzed: tat gopitam syāt dharma artham dharmaḥ jñāna artham eva ca
translated: That should be concealed for the sake of Dharma, Dharma for the sake of knowledge alone,

analyzed: jñānam tu dhyāna yoga artham acirāt pravimucyate
translated: and knowledge for the sake of meditation and yoga, one is soon liberated.

analyzed: ātmā eva yadi na ātmānam ahītebhyaḥ nivārayet
translated: If the self itself does not keep the self away from calamities,

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ hita karaḥ tasmāt ātmānam sukhayiṣyati
translated: then who else, being a benefactor, will make the self happy?

analyzed: iha eva naraka vyādheḥ cikitsām na karoti yaḥ
translated: He who does not treat the disease of hell right here itself,

original: gatvā nirauṣadhaṃ deśaṃ vyādhimthaḥ kiṃ kariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: gatvā nirauṣadham deśam kim kariṣyati
translated: Having gone to a place devoid of medicine, what will you do when afflicted with disease?

original: vyāghrīvāste jarā cāyuryāti bhinnaghaṭāmbuvat /🔽nighnanti ripuvadrogāstasmācchreyaḥ samabhyaseta // / / //
analyzed: vyāghrī iva āste jarā ca āyuḥ yāti bhinna ghaṭa ambu vat  nighnanti ripu vat rogāḥ tasmāt śreyaḥ samabhyaseta
translated: Old age lurks like a tigress, life passes like water from a broken jar,🔽and diseases strike like enemies. Therefore, one should practice what is beneficial.

analyzed: yāvat na āśrayate duḥ kham yāvat na āyānti ca āpadaḥ
translated: As long as suffering does not befall, as long as calamities do not come,

analyzed: yāvat na indriya vaikalyam tāvat śreyaḥ samabhyaset
translated: and as long as there is no impairment of the senses, one should practice what is beneficial.

analyzed: yāvat tiṣṭhati dehaḥ yam tāvat tattvam samabhyaset
translated: As long as this body remains, one should practice the truth.

analyzed: sandīpta kośa bhavane kūpam khanati durmatiḥ
translated: The foolish one digs a well in a house with a blazing treasury.

analyzed: kālaḥ na jñāyate nānā kāryaiḥ saṃsāra sambhavaiḥ
translated: Time is not known due to various worldly activities.

original: sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ jano hanta na vetti hitamātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sukham duḥkham janaḥ hanta na vetti hitam ātmanaḥ
translated: People do not know what is good for themselves, whether it is happiness or sorrow.

analyzed: jātān ārtān mṛtān āpad bhaṣṭān dṛṣṭvā ca duḥ khitān
translated: Having seen the born, the afflicted, the dead, and the distressed,

original: loko mohasurāṃ pītvā na bibheti kadācana // / / //
analyzed: lokaḥ moha surām pītvā na bibheti kadācana
translated: the world, having drunk the wine of delusion, never fears.

analyzed: sampadaḥ svapna saṃkāśāḥ yauvanam kusuma upamam
translated: Wealth is like a dream, youth is like a flower,

analyzed: taḍit capalam āyuṣyam kasya syāt jānataḥ dhṛtiḥ
translated: and life is as fickle as lightning. Who, knowing this, would have fortitude?

analyzed: śatam jīvitam ati alpam nidrā ālasyaiḥ tad ardhakam
translated: A hundred years of life is very short, half of it is spent in sleep and idleness,

original: bālyarogajarāduḥ khairalpaṃ tadapi niṣphalam // / / //🔽prārabdhavye nirudyogī jāgartavye prasuptakaḥ /
analyzed: bālya roga jarā duḥkhaiḥ alpam tat api niṣphalam  prārabdhavye nirudyogī jāgartavye prasuptakaḥ
translated: And even that little is fruitless due to the sufferings of childhood, disease, old age, and so on.🔽One who is inactive when there is work to be done, asleep when one should be awake,

original: viśvastaśca bhayasthāne hā naraḥ ko na hanyate // / / //
analyzed: viśvastaḥ ca bhaya sthāne hā naraḥ kaḥ na hanyate
translated: and trusting in a place of danger - alas! What man is not killed?

analyzed: toya phena same dehe jīvena ākramya saṃsthite
translated: In a body resembling water bubbles, the living being resides, having occupied it.

analyzed: tiṣṭhati nirbhayaḥ
translated: How can one remain fearless in an impermanent and impure abode?

analyzed: ahite hita saṃjñaḥ syāt adhruve dhruva saṃjñakaḥ
translated: One should have the notion of beneficial in the harmful, the notion of permanent in the impermanent,

original: anarthe cārthavijñānaḥ svamarthaṃ yo na vetti saḥ // / / //
analyzed: anarthe ca artha vijñānaḥ svam artham yaḥ na vetti saḥ
translated: and the notion of purpose in the purposeless. One who does not know one's own purpose.

analyzed: paśyan api praskhalati śṛṇvan api na budhyati
translated: Even while seeing, one stumbles; even while hearing, one does not understand.

analyzed: paṭhan api na jānāti deva māyā vimohitaḥ
translated: Even while reading, one does not know, deluded by the divine illusion.

analyzed: tat nimajjat jagat idam gambhīre kāla sāgare
translated: Thus, this world is sinking in the deep ocean of time.

original: mṛtyurogajarāgrāhairna kaścidapi budhyate // / / //🔽pratikṣaṇabhayaṃ kālaḥ kṣīyamāṇo na lakṣyate /
analyzed: mṛtyu roga jarā grāhaiḥ na kaścid api budhyate  pratikṣaṇa bhayam kālaḥ kṣīyamāṇaḥ na lakṣyate
translated: No one is aware of death, disease, and old age, the grasping ones.🔽Time, which is fearful every moment, is being exhausted but is not noticed.

original: āmakuṃbha ivāṃbhaḥ stho viśīrṇo na vibhāvyate // / / //
analyzed: āma kuṃbhaḥ iva aṃbhaḥ sthaḥ viśīrṇaḥ na vibhāvyate
translated: Like a new pot filled with water, it is being destroyed but is not realized.

analyzed: yujyate veṣṭanam vāyoḥ ākāśasya ca khaṇḍanam
translated: It is possible to wrap up the wind and break up the sky,

analyzed: grathanam ca taraṅgāṇām āsthā na āyuṣi yujyate
translated: Attachment to the waves of the world and to life is not proper.

analyzed: pṛthivī dahyate yena meruḥ ca api viśīryate
translated: By which the earth is burned and even Meru is shattered,

original: śuṣyate sāgarajalaṃ śarīrasya ca kā kathā // / / //
analyzed: śuṣyate sāgara jalam śarīrasya ca kā kathā
translated: And the water of the ocean dries up, what to speak of the body?

original: apatyaṃ me kalatraṃ me dhanaṃ me bāndhavāśca me /
analyzed: apatyam me kalatram me dhanam me bāndhavāḥ ca me
translated: My children, my wife, my wealth, my relatives -

analyzed: jalpantam iti martya ajam hanti kālavṛkaḥ balāt
translated: Thus, the howling mortal is forcibly killed by the wolf of time.

analyzed: idam kṛtam idam kāryam idam anyat kṛtākṛtam
translated: This is done, this is to be done, this other is done or not done -

analyzed: evam īhā samāyuktam kṛtāntaḥ kurute vaśam
translated: Thus, being full of desires, one comes under the control of death.

analyzed: śvas kāryam adya kurvīta pūrvāhne ca āparāhnikam
translated: One should do tomorrow's work today and the afternoon's work in the forenoon,

original: na hi mṛtyuḥ pratīkṣeta kṛtaṃ vāpyatha vākṛtam // / / //
analyzed: na hi mṛtyuḥ pratīkṣeta kṛtam vā api atha vā akṛtam
translated: For death will not wait, whether the work is done or not done.

analyzed: jarā darśita panthānam pracaṇḍa vyādhi sainikam
translated: The path shown by old age, with the army of fierce diseases,

original: adhiṣṭhito mṛtyuśatruṃ trātāraṃ kiṃ na paśyati // / / //
analyzed: adhiṣṭhitaḥ mṛtyu śatrum trātāram kim na paśyati
translated: Seized by the enemy of death, why does he not see the protector?

analyzed: tṛṣṇā sūcī vinirbhinnam siktam viṣaya sarpiṣā
translated: Pierced by the needle of craving, sprinkled with the ghee of objects,

analyzed: rāga dveṣa anale pakvam mṛtyuḥ aśrāti mānavam
translated: Cooked in the fire of passion and hatred, death devours the human.

analyzed: bālān ca yauvana sthān ca vṛddhān garbha gatān api
translated: The young, the middle-aged, the old, and even those in the womb,

analyzed: sarvān āviśate mṛtyuḥ evambhūmi dam jagat
translated: Death pervades all this world of the earth.

analyzed: sva deham api jīvaḥ yam muktvā yāti yama ālayam
translated: Even this living soul, leaving its own body, goes to the abode of Yama.

analyzed: strī mātṛ pitṛ puttra ādi sambandhaḥ kena hetunā
translated: By what cause is there the connection with wife, mother, father, son, and so on?

original: duḥ khamūlaṃ hi saṃsāraḥ sa yasyāsti sa duḥ khitaḥ /
analyzed: duḥ kha mūlam hi saṃsāraḥ sa yasya asti sa duḥ khitaḥ
translated: For the world is the root of sorrow; he who has it is sorrowful.

original: tasya tyāgaḥ kṛto yena sa sukhī nāparaḥ kvacit // / / //🔽prabhavaṃ sarvaduḥ khānāmālayaṃ sakalāpadām /
analyzed: tasya tyāgaḥ kṛtaḥ yena sa sukhī na aparaḥ kvacid  prabhavam sarva duḥ khānām ālayam sakala āpadām
translated: He who has renounced it is happy, and no one else anywhere.🔽The source of all sorrows, the abode of all calamities,

analyzed: āśrayam sarva pāpānām saṃsāram varjayet kṣaṇāt
translated: the basis of all sins, one should instantly avoid the world.

analyzed: loha dāru mayaiḥ pāśaiḥ pumān baddhaḥ vimucyate
translated: A man bound with iron and wooden fetters is released,

analyzed: puttra dāra mayaiḥ pāśaiḥ mucyate na kadācana
translated: but never released from the fetters of wife, children, and so on.

analyzed: yāvataḥ kurute jantuḥ sambandhān manasaḥ priyān
translated: As many dear connections a creature makes for the mind,

analyzed: tāvantaḥ sya nikhanyante hṛdaye śoka śaṅkavaḥ
translated: so many darts of sorrow are planted in his heart.

analyzed: vañcita aśeṣa vittaiḥ taiḥ nityam lokaḥ vināśitaḥ
translated: All wealth-seekers have always deceived the world and destroyed it.

analyzed: hā hanta viṣaya āhāraiḥ deha stha undriya taskaraiḥ
translated: Alas! Alas! By the thieves of the senses, dwelling in the body, with objects as food.

original: māṃsalubdho yathā matsyo lohaśaṅkuṃ na paśyati /
analyzed: māṃsa lubdhaḥ yathā matsyaḥ loha śaṅkum na paśyati
translated: As a fish, greedy for flesh, does not see an iron hook,

analyzed: sukha lubdhaḥ tathā dehī yam avādhām na paśyati
translated: The embodied being, greedy for happiness, does not see the obstruction of Yama.

analyzed: hita ahitam na jānantaḥ nityam unmārga gāminaḥ
translated: Not knowing what is beneficial and harmful, always going on wrong paths,

original: kukṣipūraṇaniṣṭhā ye te narā nārakāḥ khaga // / / //
analyzed: kukṣi pūraṇa niṣṭhāḥ ye te narāḥ nārakāḥ khaga
translated: Those who are intent on filling their stomachs, O bird, they are hellish men.

analyzed: nidrā abhī maithuna āhārāḥ sarveṣām prāṇinām samāḥ
translated: Sleep, sex, and food are the same for all living beings.

original: jñānavānmānavaḥ prokto jñānahīnaḥ paśuḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //🔽prabhāte malamūttrābhyāṃ kṣuttṛḍbhyāṃ madhyage ravau /
analyzed: jñānavān mānavaḥ proktaḥ jñāna hīnaḥ paśuḥ smṛtaḥ  prabhāte mala mūttrābhyām kṣudh tṛḍbhyām madhya ge ravau
translated: A wise man is said to be a human, one devoid of knowledge is considered an animal.

analyzed: rātrau madana nidrābhyām bādhyante mūḍha mānavāḥ
translated: In the morning, at night, and at midday, deluded men are obstructed by excrement, urine, hunger, thirst, and sexual desire.

analyzed: sva deha dhana dāra ādi niratāḥ sarva jantavaḥ
translated: All living beings, attached to their own bodies, wealth, wives, and so on,

original: jāyante ca mriyante ca hā hantājñānamohitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: jāyante ca mriyante ca hā hanta ajñāna mohitāḥ
translated: Are born and die, alas! deluded by ignorance.

original: tasmātsaṅgaḥ sadā tyājyaḥ sacettyaktuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: tasmāt saṅgaḥ sadā tyājyaḥ saced tyaktum na śakyate
translated: Therefore, attachment should always be abandoned. If it cannot be abandoned,

original: mahadbhiḥ saha kartavyaḥ santaḥ saṅgasya bheṣajam // / / //
analyzed: mahadbhiḥ saha kartavyaḥ santaḥ saṅgasya bheṣajam
translated: It should be done with the great ones. The good are the remedy for attachment.

analyzed: sat saṅgaḥ ca vivekaḥ ca nirmalam nayana dvayam
translated: Association with the good and discrimination are the two pure eyes.

original: yasya nāsti naraḥ so 'ndhaḥ kathaṃ na syādamārgagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasya nā asti naraḥ saḥ ndhaḥ katham na syāt amārga gaḥ
translated: A man who does not have them is blind. How can he not go on a wrong path?

analyzed: sva sva varṇa āśrama ācāra niratāḥ sarva mānavāḥ
translated: All men are engaged in the conduct of their own caste and stage of life,

original: na jānanti paraṃ dharmaṃ vṛthā naśyanti dāmbhikāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na jānanti param dharmam vṛthā naśyanti dāmbhikāḥ
translated: They do not know the supreme Dharma and perish in vain, being hypocrites.

analyzed: kim āyāsa parāḥ kecid vrata caryā ādi saṃyutāḥ
translated: Some are engaged in austerities, observances, and other practices, but are they really devoted?

analyzed: ajñāna saṃvṛta ātmānaḥ sañcaranti pracārakāḥ
translated: Their minds covered by ignorance, they wander about as preachers.

analyzed: nāma mātreṇa santuṣṭāḥ karmakāṇḍa ratāḥ narāḥ
translated: Content with mere names, people are engrossed in ritualistic acts.

analyzed: mantra uccāraṇa homa ādyaiḥ bhrāmitāḥ kratu vistaraiḥ
translated: Deluded by my Maya, the foolish desire heaven, which is far away, by the performance of sacrifices, the chanting of mantras, oblations, and other elaborate rituals.

original: ekabhuktopavāsādyairniyamaiḥ kāyaśoṣaṇaiḥ /🔽mūḍhāḥ parokṣamicchanti mama māyāvimohitāḥ // / / //🔽dehadaṇḍanamātreṇa kā muktiravivekinām /
analyzed: eka bhukta upavāsa ādyaiḥ niyamaiḥ kāya śoṣaṇaiḥ  mūḍhāḥ parokṣam icchanti mama māyā vimohitāḥ  deha daṇḍana mātreṇa kā muktiḥ avivekinām
translated: By fasting, eating only once a day, and other such practices that emaciate the body,🔽how can there be liberation for the undiscerning ones, merely by torturing the body?

analyzed: valmīka tāḍanāt eva mṛtaḥ kin nu mahā uragaḥ
translated: Is a great serpent dead merely by striking an anthill?

analyzed: jaṭā bhāra ajinaiḥ yuktāḥ dāmbhikāḥ veṣa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Hypocrites, wearing matted locks and deer skins,

analyzed: bhramanti jñāni vat loke bhrāmayanti janān api
translated: wander in the world like wise ones, deceiving people as well.

analyzed: saṃsāra ja sukha āsaktam brahma jñaḥ smi iti vādinam
translated: One who is attached to the worldly happiness of life, and claims to be a knower of Brahman,

analyzed: karma brahma ubhaya bhraṣṭam tam tyajet antyajam yathā
translated: falls from both action and knowledge; one should abandon him like an outcaste.

analyzed: gṛha araṇya samāḥ loke gata vrīḍāḥ digambarāḥ
translated: In this world, they consider home and forest to be the same, are shameless, and go naked.

analyzed: caranti gardabha ādyāḥ ca viraktāḥ te bhavanti kim
translated: Do donkeys and others who behave like them become detached?

analyzed: mṛd bhasma uddhūlanāt eva muktāḥ syuḥ yadi mānavāḥ
translated: If men were to become liberated merely by smearing themselves with clay and ashes,

original: mṛdbhasmavāsī nityaṃ śvā sa kiṃ mukto bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: mṛd bhasma vāsī nityam śvā sa kim muktaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: then a dog that always lives in clay and ashes, would it become liberated?

analyzed: tṛṇa parṇa udaka āhārāḥ satatam vana vāsinaḥ
translated: Those that always live in the forest, subsisting on grass, leaves and water,

analyzed: jambūka ākhu mṛga ādyāḥ ca tāpasāḥ te bhavanti kim
translated: are jackals, rats, deer and others, are they ascetics?

analyzed: ājanma maraṇa antam ca gaṅgā ādi taṭinī sthitāḥ
translated: Those that remain on the banks of the Ganges from birth to death,

original: maṇḍūkamatsyapramukhā yoginaste bhavanti kim // / / //🔽pārāvatāḥ śilāhārāḥ kadācidapi cātakāḥ /
analyzed: maṇḍūka matsya pramukhāḥ yoginaḥ te bhavanti kim  pārāvatāḥ śilāhārāḥ kadācid api cātakāḥ
translated: frogs, fish and others, are they yogis?🔽Pigeons that eat only stones, and peacocks that never drink water from the ground,

original: na pibanti mahītoyaṃ vratinaste bhavanti kim // / / //
analyzed: na pibanti mahī toyam vratinaḥ te bhavanti kim
translated: are they ascetics?

analyzed: tasmāt nitya ādikam karma loka rañjana kārakam
translated: Therefore, the eternal and other rites that please the world,

analyzed: mokṣasya kāraṇam sākṣāt tattva jñāna khageśvara
translated: are the direct cause of liberation, O lord of birds, along with the knowledge of reality.

analyzed: ṣarḍūana mahā kūpe patitāḥ paśavaḥ khaga
translated: O bird, the animals that have fallen into the great well of the six sense objects,

analyzed: parama artham na jānanti paśu pāśa niyantritāḥ
translated: are controlled by the bonds of the animal and do not know the ultimate truth.

analyzed: veda śāstra arṇavaiḥ gheraiḥ uhyamānāḥ itas tatas
translated: They are carried here and there by the great oceans of the Vedas and scriptures,

analyzed: ṣaḍūrmi nigraha grastāḥ tiṣṭhanti hi ku tārkikāḥ
translated: The sophists are indeed seized by the six waves and remain [deluded].

analyzed: veda āgama purāṇa jñaḥ parama artham na vetti yaḥ
translated: He who knows the Vedas, Agamas, and Puranas but does not understand the supreme truth,

analyzed: viḍambakasya tasya eva tat sarvam kāka bhāṣitam
translated: All that is mere talk like a crow's cawing for him who is a mere imitator.

analyzed: idam jñānam idam jñeyam iti cintā samākulāḥ
translated: Agitated by thoughts of this is knowledge and this is the knowable,

analyzed: paṭhanti aharniśam śāstram para tattva parāṅmukhāḥ  vākya chandaḥ nibandhena kāvya alaṅkāra śobhitāḥ
translated: They recite scriptures day and night, turning away from the supreme truth.🔽Adorned with poetic embellishments through the composition of verses and meters,

analyzed: cintayā duḥkhitāḥ mūḍhāḥ tiṣṭhanti vyākula indriyāḥ
translated: The deluded ones are afflicted by thoughts, their senses agitated.

original: anyathā paramaṃ tattvaṃ janāḥ kliśyanti cānyathā /
analyzed: anyathā paramam tattvam janāḥ kliśyanti ca anyathā
translated: The supreme truth is one way, but people suffer in another way.

analyzed: anyathā śāstra sadbhāvaḥ vyākhyām kurvanti ca anyathā
translated: The true nature of the scriptures is one way, but they explain it in another way.

analyzed: svayam na anubhavanti ca
translated: They speak of the state of the youthful mind, but do not experience it themselves.

analyzed: ahaṅkāraḥ tāḥ kecid upadeśāt iva arjitāḥ
translated: Some, devoid of teachings and so on, are full of ego.

analyzed: paṭhanti veda śāstrāṇi bodhayanti parasparam
translated: They recite the Vedas and scriptures, instructing each other,

original: na jānanti paraṃ tattvaṃ darvī pākarasaṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: na jānanti param tattvam darvī pāka rasam yathā
translated: But do not know the supreme truth, like a ladle does not know the taste of the cooked food.

original: śiro vahati puṣpāṇi gandhaṃ jānāti nāsikā /
analyzed: śiraḥ vahati puṣpāṇi gandham jānāti nāsikā
translated: The head bears the flowers, but the nose knows the fragrance.

analyzed: paṭhanti veda śāstrāṇi durlabhaḥ bhāva bodhakaḥ
translated: They recite the Vedas and scriptures, but one who awakens to the truth is rare.

analyzed: tattvam ātma stham a jñātvā mūḍhaḥ śāstreṣu muhyati
translated: Without knowing the truth that resides within the self, the deluded one is confused by the scriptures.

original: gopaḥ kakṣāgate cchāge kūpaṃ paśyati durmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: gopaḥ kakṣa gate chāge kūpam paśyati durmatiḥ
translated: The foolish one, seeing a well, is like a cowherd who sees a well when the goat is in the bushes.

analyzed: saṃsāra moha nāśāya śābda bodhaḥ na hi kṣamaḥ
translated: For the destruction of the delusion of worldly existence, verbal understanding is not sufficient.

analyzed: na nivarteta timiram kadācid dīpa vārtayā
translated: The darkness would never cease by the news of a lamp.

analyzed: prajñā hīnasya paṭhanam yathā andhasya ca darpaṇam
translated: The recitation of one devoid of wisdom is like a mirror for the blind.

analyzed: atas prajñāvatām śāstram tattva jñānasya lakṣaṇam
translated: Therefore, the scripture is for the wise, the characteristic of the knowledge of truth.

analyzed: idam jñānam idam jñeyam sarvan tu śrotum icchati
translated: This is knowledge, this is the knowable - everything he wishes to hear.

analyzed: divya varṣa sahasrāt ca śāstra antam na eva gacchati
translated: Even after a thousand divine years, he does not reach the end of the scriptures.

analyzed: anekāni ca śāstrāṇi su alpa āyuḥ vighna koṭayaḥ
translated: There are many scriptures and obstacles for one of short life.

analyzed: tasmāt sāram vijānīyāt kṣīram haṃsaḥ iva ambhasi
translated: Therefore, one should know the essence, like a swan in water taking the milk.

analyzed: abhyasya veda śāstrāṇi tattvam jñātvā atha budbhimān
translated: Having studied the Vedas and scriptures, having known the truth, and being wise,

analyzed: palālam iva dhānya arthī sarva śāstrāṇi santyajet
translated: like one seeking grain leaves the chaff, one should abandon all scriptures.

analyzed: yathā amṛtena tṛptasya na āhāreṇa prayojanam
translated: Just as one satisfied by nectar has no need for food,

original: tattvajñasya tathā tārkṣya na śāstreṇa prayojanam // / / //
analyzed: tattva jñasya tathā tārkṣya na śāstreṇa prayojanam
translated: O Garuḍa, one who knows the truth has no need for scriptures.

analyzed: na veda adhyayanāt muktiḥ na śāstra paṭhanāt api
translated: Not by studying the Vedas, nor by reciting the scriptures, is there liberation.

analyzed: jñānāt eva hi kaivalyam na anyathā vinatā ātmajaḥ
translated: Only through knowledge, O son of Vinatā, is there liberation, not otherwise.

analyzed: na āśramaḥ kāraṇam mukteḥ darśanāni na kāraṇam
translated: The stage of life is not the cause of liberation, nor are the philosophical views.

analyzed: tathā eva sarva karmāṇi jñānam eva hi kāraṇam
translated: Likewise, all actions are not the cause; only knowledge is the cause.

analyzed: mukti dāḥ guru vāc ekā vidyāḥ sarvāḥ viḍambikāḥ
translated: The guru's words alone bestow liberation; all other lores are mere imitations.

analyzed: śāstra bhāra sahasreṣu hi ekam sañjīvanam param
translated: Among thousands of heavy scriptures, the one supreme elixir of life is...

analyzed: advaitam hi śivam proktam kriyayā a parivarjitam
translated: Non-dualism is said to be auspicious, free from action.

analyzed: guru vaktreṇa labhyeta na adhīta āgama koṭibhiḥ
translated: It can be attained through the guru's words, not through studying millions of scriptures.

analyzed: āgama uktam viveka uttham dvidhā jñānam pracakṣate
translated: They describe knowledge as twofold: that which is stated in the scriptures and that which arises from discrimination.

analyzed: śabdavrahma āgama mayam param brahma viveka jam
translated: The supreme Brahman is born of discrimination, the Brahman of sound is born of the scriptures.

analyzed: advaitam kecid icchanti dvaitam icchanti ca apare
translated: Some desire non-duality, others desire duality.

analyzed: samam tattvam na jānanti dvaitāt dvaita vivarjitam
translated: They do not know the truth to be equal, free from duality and non-duality.

original: dve pade bandhamokṣāya namameti mameti ca /
analyzed: dve pade bandha mokṣāya namama iti mama iti ca
translated: The two words mine and mine are for bondage and liberation.

original: mameti badhyate janturnamameti pramucyate // / / //🔽tatkarma yanna bandhāya sā vidyā yā vimuktidā /
analyzed: mama iti badhyate jantuḥ na mama iti pramucyate  tat karma yat na bandhāya sā vidyā yā vimukti dā
translated: One is bound by the thought of 'mine', and one is liberated by the thought of 'not mine'.🔽That action which does not lead to bondage, that is true knowledge which gives liberation.

analyzed: āyāsāya aparam karma vidyā anyā śilpa naipuṇam
translated: Other action is for exertion, and other knowledge is the skill of craftsmanship.

analyzed: yāvat karmāṇi dīpyante yāvat saṃsāra vāsanā
translated: As long as actions shine, as long as the desires of worldly existence,

original: yāvadindriyacāpalyaṃ tāvattattvakathā kutaḥ // / / //🔽yāvaddehābhimānaśca mamatā yāvadeva hi /
analyzed: yāvat indriya cāpalyam tāvat tattva kathā kutas  yāvat deha abhimānaḥ ca mamatā yāvat eva hi
translated: As long as there is fickleness of the senses, how can there be talk of truth?🔽As long as there is identification with the body, as long as there is possessiveness,

analyzed: yāvat prayatna vegaḥ sti yāvat saṃkalpa kalpanā
translated: As long as there is the force of effort, as long as there is imagination of desires,

analyzed: yāvat naḥ manasaḥ sthairyam na yāvat śāstra cintanam
translated: As long as there is no stability of the mind, as long as there is no contemplation of scriptures,

analyzed: yāvat na guru kāruṇyam tāvat tattva kathā kutas
translated: As long as there is no compassion of the guru, how can there be talk of truth?

analyzed: tāvat tapaḥ vratam tīrtham japa homa arcana ādikam
translated: As long as one does not attain truth, austerities, vows, pilgrimages, japa, oblations, worship, etc.,

original: vedaśāstrāgamakathā yāvattattvaṃ na vindati // / / //🔽tasmātsarvaprayatnena sarvāvasthāsu sarvadā /
analyzed: veda śāstra āgama kathāḥ yāvat tattvam na vindati  tasmāt sarva prayatnena sarva avasthāsu sarvadā
translated: And the stories of the Vedas, scriptures, and Agamas - all this is useless.

analyzed: tattva niṣṭhaḥ bhavet tārkṣya yadi icchet mokṣam ātmanaḥ
translated: Therefore, O Tarkshya, one should be devoted to truth with all efforts, in all states, and at all times, if one desires liberation for oneself.

analyzed: dharma jñāna prasūnasya svarga mokṣa phalasya ca
translated: Of the flower of dharma and knowledge, which bears the fruit of heaven and liberation,

analyzed: tāpa traya ādi santaptaḥ chāyām mokṣa taroḥ śrayet
translated: Afflicted by the three kinds of miseries, one should seek refuge in the shade of the tree of liberation.

analyzed: tasmāt jñānena ātma tattvam vijñeyam śrī guroḥ mukhāt
translated: Therefore, the truth of the Self should be known through knowledge from the mouth of the revered Guru.

analyzed: sukhena mucyate jantuḥ ghora saṃsāra bandhanāt
translated: By that, a creature is easily liberated from the terrible bondage of worldly existence.

analyzed: tattva jñasya antimam kṛtyam śṛṇu vakṣyāmi te dhunā
translated: Listen, I shall now tell you the last duty of one who knows the truth,

analyzed: yena mokṣam avāpnoti brahma nirvāṇa saṃjñakam
translated: By which one attains liberation, called Brahman, the state of nirvana.

analyzed: antakāle tu puruṣaḥ āgate gata sādhvasaḥ
translated: But when death arrives, a man should be fearless,

original: chindyādasaṃgaśastreṇa spṛhāṃ dehe 'nu yā ca tam // / / //🔽gṛhātpravrājito dhīraḥ puṇyatīrthajalāplutaḥ /
analyzed: chindyāt asaṃga śastreṇa spṛhām dehe nu yā ca tam  gṛhāt pravrājitaḥ dhīraḥ puṇya tīrtha jala āplutaḥ
translated: And with a weapon of detachment, he should cut off all longing for the body and what belongs to it.🔽The wise one, having renounced his home and bathed in the waters of holy pilgrimage sites,

analyzed: śucau viviktaḥ āsīnaḥ vidhivat kalpita āsane
translated: Should sit in a clean, secluded place, on a seat properly prepared.

original: abhyasenmanasā śuddhaṃ trivṛdbrahmākṣaraṃ param /🔽mano yaṣchejjitaśvāso brahma bījamavismaran // / / //
analyzed: abhyaset manasā śuddham trivṛt brahma akṣaram param  manaḥ yaṣchet jita śvāsaḥ brahma bījam a vismaran
translated: He should practice with a pure mind the supreme syllable of Brahman, which is threefold.🔽Controlling the mind and conquering the breath, he should not forget the seed of Brahman.

analyzed: niyacchet viṣayebhyaḥ sārathiḥ
translated: The mind, the charioteer of the intellect, should restrain the senses from their objects.

analyzed: manaḥ karmabhiḥ ākṣiptam śubha arthe dhārayet dhiyā
translated: The mind, drawn by the actions, should be held by the intellect in the pursuit of good.

original: ahaṃ brahma paraṃ dhāma brahmāhaṃ paramaṃ padam /
analyzed: aham brahma param dhāma brahma aham paramam padam
translated: I am Brahman, the supreme abode. I am Brahman, the highest state.

analyzed: evam samīkṣya ca ātmānam ātmani ādhāya niṣkale
translated: Having thus considered the self and placed it in the self, which is without parts,

analyzed: om iti ekākṣaram brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran
translated: Reciting the one-syllabled Brahman Om and remembering Me,

original: yaḥ prayāti tyajandehaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ prayāti tyajan deham sa yāti paramām gatim
translated: He who departs, abandoning the body, he attains the supreme goal.

analyzed: na yatra dāmbhikāḥ yānti jñāna vairāgya varjitāḥ
translated: Where the hypocrites do not go, devoid of knowledge and detachment,

original: sudhiyastāṃ gatiṃ yānti tānahaṃ kathayāmi te // / / //
analyzed: sudhiyaḥ tām gatim yānti tān aham kathayāmi te
translated: The wise ones attain that goal. I shall tell you about them.

analyzed: nirmāna mohāḥ jita saṃga doṣāḥ adhyātma nityāḥ vinivṛtta kāmāḥ
translated: Free from pride and delusion, having conquered the faults of attachment, always devoted to the self, with desires turned away,

analyzed: dvandvaiḥ vimuktāḥ sukha duḥ kha saṃjñaiḥ gacchanti amūḍhāḥ padam avyayam tat
translated: Liberated from the pairs of opposites, with the notion of pleasure and pain, they go, undeluded, to that imperishable state.

original: jñānahrade satyajale rāgadveṣamalāpahe /🔽yaḥ snāti mānase tīrthe sa vai mokṣamavāpnuyāt // / / //
analyzed: jñāna hrade satya jale rāga dveṣa mala apahe  yaḥ snāti mānase tīrthe sa vai mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: In the lake of knowledge, with the pure water, which removes the impurities of passion and aversion,🔽He who bathes in the mental pilgrimage site, he will attain liberation.

analyzed: prauḍha vairāgyam āsthāya bhajate mām an anya bhāj
translated: Having resorted to intense non-attachment, he who worships Me, being solely devoted to Me,

analyzed: pūrṇa dṛṣṭiḥ prasanna ātmā sa vai mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: With a fulfilled vision, a delighted mind, he will attain liberation.

analyzed: tyaktvā gṛham ca yaḥ tīrthe nivaset maraṇa utsukaḥ
translated: He who, longing for death, abandons his home and dwells in a pilgrimage site,

analyzed: mukti kṣetreṣu mriyate sa vai mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: He who dies in the fields of liberation, he will attain liberation.

original: ayodhyā mathurā māyā kāśī kāñcī avantika /
analyzed: ayodhyā mathurā māyā kāśī kāñcī avantika
translated: Ayodhya, Mathura, Maya, Kashi, Kanchi, Avantika,

analyzed: purī dvāravatī jñeyāḥ saptā etāḥ mokṣa dāyikāḥ
translated: and the city of Dvaravati should be known as the seven cities that bestow liberation.

original: iti te kathitaṃ tārkṣya mokṣadharmaṃ sanātanam /
analyzed: iti te kathitam tārkṣya mokṣa dharmam sanātanam
translated: Thus, O Garuḍa, the eternal Dharma of liberation has been told to you.

analyzed: jñāna vairāgya sahitam śrutvā mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: Having heard it along with knowledge and detachment, one attains liberation.

original: mokṣaṃ gacchanti tattvajñā dhārmikāḥ svargatiṃ narāḥ /
analyzed: mokṣam gacchanti tattva jñāḥ dhārmikāḥ svar gatim narāḥ
translated: The knowers of truth go to liberation, the righteous to heaven,

analyzed: pāpinaḥ durgatim yānti saṃsaranti khaga ādayaḥ
translated: the sinners to hell, and the birds and others transmigrate.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca  sva praśra uttara rāddhāntam evam bhagavataḥ mukhāt
translated: Sūta said:🔽Having heard from the Lord's mouth the conclusion of his own question in this way,

analyzed: śrutvā hṛṣṭa tanuḥ tārkṣyaḥ nanāma jagat īśvaram
translated: Garuḍa, with his body delighted, bowed to the Lord of the universe.

analyzed: sandehaḥ me mahān naṣṭaḥ bhavat vākya virocanāt
translated: My great doubt has been dispelled by the illuminating words of yours.

analyzed: iti uktvā viṣṇum āmantrya sa gataḥ kaśyapa āśramam
translated: Having said this, he took leave of Vishnu and went to Kashyapa's hermitage.

original: sadyo dehāntaraṃ yāti yathā yāti vilambataḥ /
analyzed: sadyas deha antaram yāti yathā yāti vilambataḥ
translated: One goes to another body immediately, as one goes with delay.

analyzed: anayoḥ ubhayoḥ ca eva na virodhaḥ tathā eva vaḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction between these two, just as there is none between you.

analyzed: sarvam ākhyātavān tāta śrutaḥ bhagavataḥ yathā
translated: O father, he has told everything as he heard from the Lord.

original: mārīco 'pi mudaṃ lebhe śrutvā vākyaṃ ramāpateḥ // / / //
analyzed: mārīcaḥ pi mudam lebhe śrutvā vākyam ramāpateḥ
translated: Marīci also obtained joy on hearing the words of the Lord of Ramā.

analyzed: apākṛtaḥ tu sandehaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ bhavatām mayā
translated: I have removed your doubts, O Brahmanas.

analyzed: uktam suparṇa saṃjñam tu purāṇam parama adbhutam
translated: The Purana called Garuda, which is extremely wonderful, has been narrated.

original: idamāpa harestārkṣyastārkṣyādāpa tato bhṛguḥ /🔽bhṛgorvasiṣṭhaḥ saṃprāpa vāmadevastataḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: idam āpa hareḥ tārkṣyaḥ tārkṣyāt āpa tatas bhṛguḥ  bhṛgoḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ saṃprāpa vāmadevaḥ tatas punar
translated: Garuda obtained it from Hari, and Bhrigu from Garuda.🔽Vasishtha obtained it from Bhrigu, and then Vamadeva.

analyzed: parāśara muniḥ prāpa tasmāt vyāsaḥ tatas hi aham
translated: The sage Parashara obtained it from him, and then Vyasa, and then I.

original: mayā tu bhavatāṃ proktaṃ paraṃ guhyaṃ hareridam // / / //
analyzed: mayā tu bhavatām proktam param guhyam hareḥ idam
translated: This supreme secret of Hari has been told to you by me.

original: ya idaṃ śṛṇuyānmartyo yo vāpyabhidadhāti ca /
analyzed: yaḥ idam śṛṇuyāt martyaḥ yaḥ vā api abhidadhāti ca
translated: The man who listens to this or recites it,

original: ihāmutra ca loke sa sarvatra sukhamāpnuyāt // / / //
analyzed: iha amutra ca loke sa sarvatra sukham āpnuyāt
translated: will obtain happiness everywhere in this world and the next.

analyzed: vrajataḥ saṃyamanyām yat duḥkham atra nirūpitam
translated: The suffering described here for one going to Yama's abode,

original: asya śravaṇataḥ puṇyaṃ tanmukto jāyate tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: asya śravaṇataḥ puṇyam tad muktaḥ jāyate tatas
translated: is obtained by listening to this, and then one is liberated.

analyzed: atra ukta karma pāka ādi śravaṇāt ca nṛṇām iha
translated: And by listening to the ripening of actions mentioned here,

analyzed: vairāgyam āvahet yasmāt tasmāt śrotavyam eva ca
translated: people here will attain detachment, therefore it should be listened to.

original: bhajata jitahṛṣīkāḥ kṛṣṇamenaṃ munīśaṃ samajani bata yasmādgīḥ sudhāsāradhārā /
analyzed: bhajata jita hṛṣīkāḥ kṛṣṇam enam muni īśam samajani bata yasmāt gīḥ sudhā sāra dhārā
translated: O lords of sages, those who have conquered the senses, worship this Krishna, from whom this nectar-like discourse has arisen.

original: pṛṣatamapi yadīyaṃ varṇarūpaṃ nipīya śrutipuṭaculukena prāpnuyādātmanaikyam // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣatam api yadi iyam varṇa rūpam nipīya śruti puṭa culukena prāpnuyāt ātmanā aikyam
translated: If one could attain oneness with the Supreme by drinking in even a drop of the variegated form of the Lord with the cupped hands of the ears.

analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca  iti sūta mukha udgīrṇām sarva śāstra artha maṇḍitām
translated: Vyasa said:🔽Having drunk the nectar-like words of Vishnu, adorned with the meanings of all scriptures, uttered from the mouth of Suta,

analyzed: vaiṣṇavīm vāc sudhām pītvā ṛṣayaḥ tuṣṭim āyayuḥ
translated: the sages attained satisfaction.

analyzed: praśaśaṃsuḥ tathā anyonyam sūtam sarva artha darśinam
translated: They praised each other and the Suta, the seer of all things,

analyzed: praharṣam atulam prāpuḥ munayaḥ śaunaka ādayaḥ
translated: and the sages, Shaunaka and others, attained incomparable joy.

original: iti harivacanāni sūtavācā khagapatisaṃśayabhedakāni yāni /🔽sa munirapi niśamya śaunakendro bahutaramānayati sma cātmani svam // / / //
analyzed: iti hari vacanāni sūta vācā khaga pati saṃśaya bhedakāni yāni  sa muniḥ api niśamya śaunaka indraḥ bahutaram ānayati sma ca ātmani svam
translated: Thus, the words of Hari, uttered by Suta, which dispelled the doubts of the lord of birds,🔽the great sage Shaunaka, the foremost of sages, having heard them, greatly honored himself.

analyzed: apūjayan te munayaḥ tadānīm udākhāgbhiḥ muhur eva sūtam
translated: The sages then repeatedly praised the Suta with examples,

analyzed: dhanyaḥ si sūta tvam iha iti udairayan vyasarjayan tam ca nivartite dhvare
translated: and when the sacrifice was concluded, they sent him away, saying, O Suta, you are blessed.

analyzed: purāṇam gāruḍam puṇyam pavitram pāpa nāśanam
translated: The sacred, purifying, sin-destroying Garuda Purana,

analyzed: śṛṇvatām kāmanā pūram śrotavyam sarvadā eva hi
translated: which fulfills the desires of those who listen to it, should always be heard.

analyzed: śrutvā dānāni deyāni vācakāya akhilāni ca
translated: Having heard it, all gifts should be given to the reciter,

analyzed: pūrva ukta śayana ādīni na anyathā saphalam bhavet
translated: The above-mentioned bed etc. should not be done otherwise, as it will not be fruitful.

analyzed: purāṇam pūjayet pūrvam vācakam tad anantaram  vastra alaṅkāra godānaiḥ dakṣiṇābhiḥ ca sādaram
translated: One should first worship the Purana, then the reciter,🔽with clothes, ornaments, gifts of cows, and respectful offerings.

analyzed: anna dānaiḥ hema dānaiḥ bhami dānaiḥ ca bhūribhiḥ
translated: By gifts of food, gold, and land in abundance,

analyzed: pūjayet vācakam bhaktyā bahu puṇya phala āptaye
translated: one should worship the reciter with devotion to attain abundant merit.

analyzed: yaḥ ca idam śṛṇuyāt martyaḥ yathā api parikīrtayet
translated: If a mortal listens to this or recites it as described,

original: vihāya yātanāṃ ghorāṃ dhūtapāpo divaṃ vrajet // / / //🔽iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe śrīkṛṣṇagaruḍasaṃvāde dvitīyāṃśe dharmakāṇḍe pretakalpe mokṣopāyanirūpaṇaṃ nāmaikonapañcāśattamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: vihāya yātanām ghorām dhūta pāpaḥ divam vrajet  iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe uttara khaṇḍe śrī kṛṣṇa garuḍa saṃvāde dvitīya aṃśe dharma kāṇḍe pretakalpe mokṣopāyanirūpaṇam nāma ekonapañcāśattamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: having abandoned terrible torment, purified of sins, he would go to heaven.🔽Thus ends the forty-ninth chapter in the second part of the Uttara Khanda of Sri Garuda Purana, in the Dharma Kanda, on the method of attaining liberation.

original: iti śrīgāruḍe mahāpurāṇe dvitīyo dharmakāṇḍaḥ samāptaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī gāruḍe mahāpurāṇe dvitīyaḥ dharmakāṇḍaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second Dharma Kanda in the Sri Garuda Purana.
